loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Minavar

texts.ru: Минавар 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Минавар - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Минавар занимается полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Минавар, на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,48 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, кукурузу и овощи для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Минавар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Минавар планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Minavar is 50 and married with four children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 25 years ago with 6,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has 0.48 hectares of farmland, on which she grows potatoes, corn and vegetables for her own use and for sale, with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Minavar has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase high-quality seed potatoes to plant. She plans to invest profits from the loan into increasing her number of domestic livestock, and to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam is 31 years old and she is married with two children. Nam lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nam is the group leader of the 20505010003 Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 
Nam has been involved in this business for six years.

Nam is applying for a loan to purchase cattle to resell. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

This is Nam’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardships that Nam faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Nam hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Liên's Group

texts.en:
Liên is 33 years old and she is married with three children. Liên lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Liên is the group leader of the 20508040001 Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 

Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Liên has been involved in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to resell. 

This is Liên’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardships that Liên faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 47 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a cafeteria serving food in their village while her husband works as a solid waste collector in their community.

Alma has been doing this business for six years, earning well to support the family. She always wants to be the best in cooking and preparing food. She especially wants the best for her children. She wants to provide them a better education than she had while she was young.

Alma requested this loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale in order to improve sales. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to provide her family with additional income. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Эльмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эльмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 1 жеребец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома для старшего сына.
texts.en: Elmira is 40 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has five milking cows and one stallion, with a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Elmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase cows and increase her head count of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of domestic cattle and to save toward building a new house for her oldest son.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, es muy trabajador pues a pesar de vivir solo con su madre, él se ha dedicado siempre a trabajar fuertemente en las actividades agrícolas y pecuarias, por el momento está estudiando séptimo grado los fines de semana, está soltero y no tiene hijos. 


José desde los 12 años se ha dedicado a cuidar ganado y a trabajar en la agricultura, de lunes a viernes se dedica a trabajar en una finca, cuidando ganado, esta actividad le ayuda a cubrir sus gastos y a la vez aporta un poco de ingresos a su familia, la cual se compone de 5 hermanos que son menores que él, fue por esta razón que dejó sus estudios durante un tiempo por ser el mayor y tenía que trabajar, por lo que hoy se está esforzando por sacar sus estudios los fines de semana, pero la mayor parte de su tiempo  se dedica a trabajar con ganado y su madre vende productos básicos en el mercado

El crédito que está solicitado, lo necesita para comprar 2 novillas, las cuales piensa mantener y sacarles provecho, ya que él planea engordarlas y posteriormente venderlas a un mejor precio del que las compra, por el momento un vecino le vende 2 novillas a un buen precio, pero él no tiene los recursos económicos para poder comprarlas, por lo que necesita que se le apoye económicamente. 

Los sueños de este joven son, terminar sus estudios y en un futuro poder sacar una carrera universitaria, por lo que tiene que luchar fuertemente, también en un futuro quiere establecer una pequeña reproducción ganadera, de la que pueda obtener ingresos para mejorarle las condiciones de vida a su familia, ya que lo necesitan mucho.
texts.en:
José is an enterprising and hardworking man who is 22 years of age. Despite living alone with his mother, he has always devoted himself to working hard in his farming and ranching activities. At the moment, he is completing a seventh-grade level education on the weekends. José is single and has no children.

Since the age of 12, José has spent his time looking after cattle and working in agriculture. He works Monday through Friday on a farm where he is responsible for taking care of cattle. This job helps him to cover his expenses and provide a little bit of income for his family, which includes five younger siblings. Since he is the oldest child and has to work, this explains why he had to quit school temporarily. José works hard at his studies on the weekends, but most of his time is spent working with cattle. His mother sells basic products at the market.

José is requesting a loan so that he can buy two steers that he plans to maintain and put to good use. He plans to fatten them and then sell them at a better price than what he paid. At the moment, a neighbor is willing to sell him two steers at a good price, but he doesn’t have the financial resources to buy them. For this reason, he is requesting financial support.

His dreams as a young man are to finish his studies and enroll for a university degree in the future. It is for this reason that he works very hard. He also wants to establish a small livestock breeding business so that he can generate income to improve his living conditions and that of his family, since that is a great need.

loans.use: to buy two steers.

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: Mauricio Francisco Mayor de edad casado con dos hijos uno mayor de edad  el otro aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de unod e los municipios de Chinandega, lugar ubicado en el occidente del pais, Mauricio es un homnbre trabajador, responsable, luchador en la vida para sacar adelante a su hijo y darle un mejor futuro brindarles las oportuidades que el no tuvo por faltas de recursos economicos, para que puede seguir estudiando y ser todo un profesional, Mauricio es un microempresario propietario y administrador de una pulperia ubicado en su casa de habitacion, donde ofrece productos de consumo como:sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, huevos, sal, pan, leche, frijoles cosidos, caja de fosforo, cigarros por unidad, arroz, azucar, aceite, entre otros sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de la localidad tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos. Mauricio Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Mauricio Francisco is older, married with two children. One is older than the other in age though has less responsibility. He is originally from one of the townships of Chinadega, located in the west of the country. Mauricio is a hardworking responsible man, fighting in life to raise his son and give him a better future. He wants to bring his children the opportunities that he did not have due to lack of economic resources, so that he can continue studying and be a complete professional. 

Mauricio is a small business owner and administrator of a grocery store located in his house, where he offers consumer products such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, eggs, salt, bread, mild, beans, matchboxes, individual cigarrettes, sugar and oil among others. He makes his purchases in cash at the markets and locality distributors. He has permanent and temporary clients and his sales are made in cash. 

The objective of his loan is to invest in work capital and supply his grocery and bring better service to his customers, and in the near future augment his income. Mauricio Francisco is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors bring to people of fewer resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: the purchase of consumer products for the home such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, bread, eggs, tomatoes, frozen products, candies and chicken among others.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Эту 43-летнюю жительницу района Кубадиён зовут Саодат. Она трудолюбивая, ответственная и скромная женщина. Саодат на протяжении 3 лет занимается выращиванием молодых бычков для продажи. В данный момент этим делом она занимается одна, так как ее муж и сыновья находятся на заработках в России. Саодат хочет увеличить бюджет семьи, но для этого ей необходимо увеличить поголовье скотов. С такой целью она запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить пару молодых бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: This 43-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon region is called Saodat. She is a hardworking, responsible and modest woman. For three years, Saodat has been earning a living raising young bulls for sale. At the moment she maintains this business on her own, since her husband and sons are migrant labourers in Russia. Saodat wants to increase her family's budget, but to do this she needs to increase her head count of livestock. With this goal in mind she is requesting a loan to purchase a pair of young bulls for fattening and resale. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ory

texts.en:
Ory (in the photo), age 25, is single, lives with his parents and brothers in a village about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Ory is in his marketing bachelor degree. He is now in the fourth year of the four year degree program. He hopes to finish his degree by the end of this year. Hence Ory decided to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Flor De Melocoton Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana de estado civil casada. Tiene 46 años de edad. Cursó un año de educación primaria. tiene 3 hjos que no están estudiando. Se dedica a bordar guipiles de la región. Inició este negocio con la yuda de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales como: hilos, telas y otros para la elaboracion de los guipiles. En el futuro desea tener mayor capital y ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de diseños de guipiles.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la elaboración de guipiles.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is 46 years old, married, and has a first grade education. She has three children, but they are not in school. Ana makes embroidered dresses that are traditional to the region. She started this business with help from her husband. As of this date, she has three years of experience.

Ana organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy materials such as thread, fabrics, and other items for making traditional dresses. In the future, she wants to have more capital so that she can offer traditional dresses in a variety of designs to her customers.

The other group members also have businesses in which they make traditional dresses.

loans.use: to buy materials for making embroidered traditional dresses.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang is the head of the Kenanga Indah group. She is a farmer and pig farmer in the village of Banyubiru, west Bali. With her husband, Ni Komang is trying to develop a pig business by borrowing from the MUK.
From the sale of 3 pigs in this period, Ni Komang managed to gain a profit of 600.000 IDR. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances, when they are currently experiencing difficult times due to the increasingly expensive necessities of life.
Ni Komang with Kenanga Indah group decided to continue borrowing from the MUK as she felt it to be especially helpful in developing a pig businesses. Because the price of pigs and pig feed is growing, Ni Komang then expect an increase in borrowing in the next period.
The group received the loan with the loan amount of 21.000.000 IDR. Nothing has changed in the membership and composition of the board. The loan in this period will be used to buy piglets and sows for each member.
Ni Komang will be using her loan to buy 3 piglets and the rest for feed. Currently the price is quite expensive for piglets, 500.000 IDR per piglet. Ni Komang has a dream that this business will become a major source of family income.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 52 years old and has five children in school.

She has a business of making ice cream. Editha requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, plastics, etc.

Editha has been in this business for 24 years. In the future Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, plastics, etc

loans.name: Thập's Group

texts.en:
Thập is 60 years old and she is married with four children. Thập lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Mrs. Thập works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Thập has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thập is the group leader of the 13.03.04 - Quảng Thành Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. 

Thập is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Thập’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thập faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thập hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for a vacation within the country with her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 08-01-12-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm has a service business renting tables and chairs for marriages. She is requesting a loan to purchase tables and chairs for renting.

Tâm is 43 years old and is married with 2 children.
Tâm is the group leader of the 08-01-12-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tâm has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tâm has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for renting.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 27 years old, lives with his mother and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling mobile phones since 2008 to local people by renting a stall in the phone mart. Using his previous loan, he purchased a low-pressure heater and stopped using coal for heating. 

Now Batbayar is requesting a loan of 700 USD to buy vacuum insulated windows and a hardwood floor in order to protect against dust. The slum district his family lives in is very dusty due to a lack of proper infrastructure. So installing these windows and floors will greatly contribute to a healthy house environment.

loans.use: To buy vacuum insulated windows and a hardwood floor

loans.name: 04-04-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make processed food for resale.

Hòa is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hòa is the group leader of the 04-04-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2010, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hòa has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make processed food to resell.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is one step to success. He is going to graduate this year in his BS Accountancy. He hasd two siblings and his mother works at a dressmaking business. He wants them to be proud of him and to share his future success. To cover graduation fees, Mark took a loan from GDMPC micro credit. In the future he wants to become successful.

loans.use: for graduation fees

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a married woman and a mother of eight children from Panglao, Bohol. She is engaged in the pig raising business for more than ten years now. She is also into a fishing business with her husband.
Prima is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed, and also to purchase fishing materials like fish nets. With this she will be able to improve her pig raising and fishing business, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future Prima hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and also to buy fishing materials like fish nets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new fishing net.

Grace has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Symmoneth

texts.en: Symmoneth is studying BS Accountancy in a university. She has three siblings and she lives with her parents. Her father receives a salary as a government employee, while her mother is responsible for household chores. To pay the tuition fees for the second semester she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance. In the future she want to become a certified accountant.

loans.use: for tuition fees

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 53 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Edna owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for twelve years and earns better income for the family. In 2009, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. With her generated revenue, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Edna is requesting a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 1 year now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia works hard to support her family. Hermenia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

Hermenia has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 46 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Hilda has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en:
Greziel is a married woman and a mother of four children from Panglao, Bohol. She runs and operates a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Greziel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, soda and beverages. 

Through this, Greziel will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Greziel hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Roeun Group

texts.en: Roeun is 33 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Pursat Province, Cambodia. For a living, Roeun and her husband do farming. She is a leader of this group loan. Now, she would like to apply for loan to buy construction materials to build a latrine. This loan will help her live in good conditions. In the future, she would like to apply for another loan after this one to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Kiza Jean

texts.en: Kiza Jean has three siblings and she lives with her family. Her parents earns from their salary as government employees. She studs in the university taking BS - Aquatic Resource management and Technology.  She wants to help the environment and she was determined that with her knowledge she would contribute beyond what is in her mind for now. She wants her parents to become proud of her achievements. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to pay for school supplies, books and materials needed for the second semester. In the future she wants to become successful.

loans.use: for school supplies, books and materials needed for the second semester

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark wants to be an accountant someday. He has one step left for his graduation day that is fast approaching. He had used his previous loans for his tuition fees. Now, as a school requirement, he needs to pay for his graduation fee and other expenses . He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to pay this. He wants to become successful in his future.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation fee and other expenses.

loans.name: Ivis

texts.es:
Ivis tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar como ropa, zapatos, perfumería, útiles escolares, también se dedica a la venta de variedad de abarrotes arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa de temporada para damas, caballeros y niños y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ivis is 42 years old and lives with her husband and children in Pomahuaca district, an agricultural, commercial and livestock-rearing community in Jaén Province, which belongs to Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells bazaar products like clothing, shoes, perfume and school supplies, and also sells a variety of dry goods such as rice, sugar, oil, and milk. She has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of seasonal clothing for men, women and children, which will grow her business and help her earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothing to offer to her clients

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 42 years old and married with seven children, four of whom in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina works hard to support her family. Ma. Gina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Marichu has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future Marichu would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 41 years old and has seven children.  Marilou is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Marilou has been raising pigs for 18 years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa works hard to support her family. Nimfa is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nimfa has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

Marilyn has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 63 years old and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Matilde requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purhase additional fishing nets and bamboo for her business.

Matilde has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Matilde would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai has a manufacturing business, sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to provide tailor-made and clothing repair services.

Mai is 32 years old and she is married with two children. Mai is the group leader of the 13.03.08 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of six members. Mai lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, which is an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years, and the main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Mai hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to provide tailor-made and clothing repair services.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío San Lorenzo, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, bebidas gaseosa y golosinas cuenta con clientela de su distrito y transportistas de las rutas Jaén- Chiclayo, su negocio se encuentra ubicada al costado de la carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry, ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de bebidas y frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 58 years old and lives with her spouse and children in San Lorenzo neighborhood, a rural area of Pomahuaca District, a warm-weather, agricultural, commercial and livestock-rearing community in Jaén Province, which belongs to Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells fruit, sodas and candies to clients from her district as well as truckers who drive the Jaén-Chiclayo routes. Her business is located next to the Fernando Belaunde Terry highway. She has requested a loan of 600 nuevos soles to buy a variety of drinks and fruits to offer to her clients so that she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and fruits to offer her clients

loans.name: Hạnh's Group

texts.en:
Hạnh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

Hạnh is 43 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 13.03.01 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of six members. Hạnh lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, which is ana urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her other child is grown up.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila works hard to support her family. Prescila is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

Prescila has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Prescila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. Marissa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marissa has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Farly

texts.es:
Edwin Farly tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi desde hace 10 años, trasladando a sus pasajeros a diversos caseríos de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas para su mototaxi y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de transporte público.
texts.en:
Edwin Farly is 31 years old and lives with his wife and children in Oyotún disctrict, an agricultural, commercial and livestock-rearing community located in Chiclayo Province, part of the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

He has offered transportation to the public on his own mototaxi for the last 10 years, transporting his passengers to different parts of the district. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy tires for his mototaxi, so that he can continue to offer transportation services to the public.

loans.use: to buy tires for his mototaxi

loans.name: Carlos Stiven

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Stiven cuenta con 18 años recién cumplidos actualmente estudia cocina  en campo alto y trabaja los fines de semana  en un restaurante del barrio, necesita el subsidio para  poder continuar los estudios y adicional mente poder estudiar ingles en un instituto. 
Es hijo de de madre soltera  la cual labora de manera independiente y no cuenta con otro apoyo económico, el circulo familiar  se compone de algunos tíos de la misma edad  y la abuela que trabaja  de manera informal y vive en soacha.
  
Los planes a futuro son poder laborar en la carrera que mas le gusta que es la cocina para sobresalir y poder ayudar a la madre y a la familia y desarrollarse como un cocinero profesional y logar culminar teniendo bases solidad de ingles ya que esto abrirá mas  oportunidades laborales en el futuro.

El convenio con kiva le seria de gran ayuda ya que el sueldo que gana no es de un valor tan alto, ademas los gastos extras que tiene la carrera no le permite cancelar el valor normal de las cuotas, si tiene el beneficio de kiva le seria de gran ayuda para el y para la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Stiven recently turned 18, and is currently studying cooking at CampoAlto and working on weekends at a neighborhood restaurant. He needs this loan to continue with his studies and to study English at a language institute. He is the son of a single mother, who works independently and doesn't have any additional economic support. His family is made up of some uncles who are the same age and his grandmother, who does informal work and lives in Soacha.

In the future, he wants to work in his field of study. Cooking is what he most enjoys, and he wants to be outstanding so that he can help his mother and family, develop himself as a professional chef and have a solid base of English in order to open up future work opportunities.

The Kiva partnership will be a great help, since the wages he earns are low and the extra costs associated with his studies don't allow him to pay the upfront tuition costs. Having the benefit of Kiva financing will be a great help for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de carga en su carretilla transportando bultos como cajas, sacos de carga y todo tipo de bultos, es un joven emprendedor, por las tardes brinda servicio de secretario en la Parroquia de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para terminar de construir la segunda parte de su dormitorio y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para descansar.
texts.en:
Edgar is 23 years old and lives with his wife and children in Buenos Aires district, an agricultural, commercial, and livestock-rearing community located in Morropon Province, part of Piura Region on the north coast of Peru.

He provides cart transportation services, carrying loads like boxes, sacks, and other types of packages. He is a young entrepreneur, and in the afternoons works as a secretary at his district parish. He has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to finish building the second part of his bedroom so that he can have a pleasant place to rest.

loans.use: to construct the second part of his bedroom

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es docente y actualmente culminó sus estudios de Licenciada en educación, comenta que su esposo también es docente y viven en casa propia. 
Sus metas futuras es ganar  horas cátedras en colegios Nacionales para obtener mejores ingresos para llevar una vida digna y ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de tesis, ya que ahora ese es el desafío que tiene para culminar sus estudios.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria is a teacher and finished her degree in education; her husband is also a teacher and they live in their own home. Her future goals are to gain teaching hours in national schools so that she can earn more income in order to live with dignity and help her family. She is requesting this loan to invest in the costs associated with her thesis, since that is the challenge she faces to complete her studies. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay thesis-related costs

loans.name: La Lima Iv Group

texts.es:
El señor Enrique de estad civil casado. De edad 42 años. De escolaridad Primaria Completa. Tiene 2 hijos y no estan estudiando. Se dedica a la agricultura, a la cosecha de café. Inició este negocio ayudando a su padre y a la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizante para la produccion de café. Desea en el futuro contar com más capital y tener mejores cosechas para aumentar sus ingresos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Sr. Enrique is 42 years old, married, and completed primary school. He has two children, who are not in school. He works in agriculture as a coffee farmer. He got his start in the business by helping his father, and he now has 20 years of experience. 

He organizes the group and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for coffee production. In the future, he would like to have more capital and harvest more coffee in order to boost his income. 

The other members of the group are also coffee farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vanna Group

texts.en: Vanna is 41 years old. She is a married woman who has four children in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a motor-taxi driver.Vanna is the leader of this group. Now, she would like to apply for a loan to buy construction materials to build a latrine. This loan helps her live in good condition. In the future Vanna hopes that she can renovate her house and her children can finish their schools and get jobs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es soltero, vive con sus padres, comenta que es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias en la Educación, ya que quiere ser un Docente, que pueda ayudar a las personas que quieran aprender al igual que él.
El préstamo que pide es para pagos de cuotas en la universidad de cursos universitarios que necesita hacer para recibir su título. Su mayor objetivo es terminar su carrera y poder ejercer la docencia turno noche ya que quiere hacer paralelo a su trabajo actual de manera a poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Joel is single and lives with his parents. He is a student studying Education Sciences, because he wants to be a teacher in order to help people like himself who want to learn.

He is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition installments, which he needs to do in order to receive his degree. His primary goal is to finish his studies so that he can work as a teacher at night, since he wants to maintain his current job as well in order to boost his income. 

He is grateful for this opportunity to become a professional.

loans.use: to pay university tuition installments

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge viene de una humilde familia, está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Contables, y comenta que su meta es poder terminar la carrera para ser alguien en la vida y un profesional exitoso.
Su aspiración es trabajar y poder sostener a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo. Él pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchos los gastos que debe cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Jorge comes from a humble family and is studying Accounting Sciences. His goal is to finish his studies in order to be someone in life and to be a successful professional. 

His dream is to work so that he can support his family through his efforts. He is requesting this loan to pay his graduation fees, since there are many costs that he must cover. He is grateful for this opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, con mucho esfuerzo está estudiando a la vez que trabaja. Está siguiendo la carrera de Abogado, ya que quiere ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Quiere terminar su carrera para también ayudar a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo. Esta agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y así estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Gilberto is from the city of Ybycuí, and with great effort he is studying while also working. He is studying Law, since he wants to be a good professional who helps others through his knowledge. 

He wants to finish his degree so that he can also help his family through his hard work. He is grateful for the opportunity to continue his studies, and is requesting this loan to pay for his graduation fees, so he can get closer to attaining his goal.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor anhela ser un buen abogado, y  comenta que viene de una familia donde tiene ejemplos a seguir ya que siempre le han sido de muy buen ejemplo.
Por medio de su profesión quiere ayudar a la gente a defender sus derechos, es por eso que quiere ser un buen profesional por lo que está esmerándose.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Victor dreams of being a good lawyer. He comes from a family where there are examples to follow, since his family members have always set very good examples. Through his profession, he wants to help people defend their rights, and for that reason he is striving to be a good professional. He is requesting this loan to pay his university tuition, so that he can continue to study. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition installments

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, es una persona de 35 años de edad, está casada su esposo tiene 32 años, tienen dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, con el fin de tener un mejor estilo de vida y colaborar con los gastos de su familia, desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, trabaja todos los días, además por las tardes elabora pupusas para vender. Por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio surtiendo ambas actividades para mantenerse trabajando y tener los recursos económicos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia, comprara vitaminas, jarabes para la tos, laxantes, harina, quesillo, bebidas, tomates, aderezos, etc.
Aspira a tener un negocio más rentable para ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro lleno oportunidades.
texts.en:
Mirian is 35 years old and married. Her husband is 32 years old. They have two children, ages 15 and 12. In order to have a better lifestyle and contribute toward the family expenses, Mirian has been selling natural medicines for the past two years. She works every day. In addition, she prepares “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) to sell in the afternoons. At the moment, she has not had any difficulties with her business.

Mirian is requesting a loan that she can invest in order to maintain both business activities. This will enable her to have the financial resources that she needs to help her family get ahead. She will buy vitamins, cough syrups, and laxatives, as well as flour, cheese, beverages, tomatoes, seasoning, and other supplies.

Mirian aspires to have a more profitable business so that she can provide her family a better future that is filled with opportunities.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, cough syrups, and laxatives, as well as flour, cheese, beverages, tomatoes, seasoning, and other supplies.

loans.name: María Zenaida

texts.es:
María, a sus 49 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, activa y dedicada a su familia, es madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, se gana la vida trabajando en el campo de la confección, prestando sus servicios a terceros, el oficio lo aprendió por medio de sus hermanas mayores, quienes se han dedicado por muchos años a la misma labor, esto la motivó a montar su propio taller y desde el inicio obtuvo muy buenos resultados por la calidad del producto terminado que entrega a sus clientes.
El crédito que solicita es un aporte para mejorar su capacidad instalada, ya que con el dinero comprará una máquina sublimadora, con la que podrá optimizar el tiempo de producción y cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos a sus clientes, logrando una fidelización y mejorando los ingresos que percibe con su labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor deseo es acreditar y fortalecer aún más su negocio, logrando una ampliación del taller que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar educación universitaria a sus 2 hijos, con quienes quiere disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
María, at 49 years of age, is a hard-working woman who is active and dedicated to her family. She is the mother of two children and has been the head of her household since she separated from her husband. 

For about the last 15 years, she has earned a living working in sewing, offering her services to third parties. She learned the trade from her older sisters, who have worked in the same field for many years, which motivated her to start her own workshop. From the beginning, she had very positive results due to the high quality of the finished product that she gives her clients. 

The loan she is requesting will help her improve her installed capacity, and with the money she will buy a sublimation machine that will allow her to optimize her production time and turn around client orders promptly, so that she can gain loyal customers and boost the income she earns from her work. 

Maria tells us that her greatest dream is to strengthen and accredit her business even more, so that she can expand her workshop, generate job opportunities and guarantee her own economic stability so that she can send her two children to college. She would like to enjoy a higher quality of life and well-being with her children.

loans.use: to buy a sublimation machine

loans.name: Pedro Plutarco

texts.es: pedro vive en casa propia con su familia, e se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Pedro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. para continuar con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own home with his family. He has been farming for several years and his main crops are corn and beans. Pedro sells his products at different markets that are near his home. With the revenue he generates from his sales, he is able to pay for a few of the household expenses.

Pedro is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, seeds, and other supplies so that he can continue planting crops. As a result, he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es:
Erick, vive en casa familiar, dependen tres personas económicamente de él, el no posee ayuda del extranjero, desde hace 6 años se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, trabaja todos los días, una de sus ventajas es que el cultivo está ubicado cerca de su vivienda y puede estar más al pendiente de su cuido.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pago de mozos, le permitirá preparar el terreno en donde sembrara y tener cultivos de calidad. Espera aumentar la producción, tener buenos ingresos para cancelar sus deudas y cumplir con los compromisos familiares. 
Su sueño es continuar con el cultivo de granos básicos e incorporar la comercialización de ganado con el fin de de mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Erick lives in his family's home, and has three dependents. He does not receive any help from abroad. For the last six years, he has worked every day cultivating basic grains. One advantage is that his crops are located close to his home, so he can be more attentive to their care. He will use this loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay hired help. This will allow him to prepare the land where he will plant so he can produce quality crops. He hopes to increase his production and earn good income in order to repay his debts and fulfill his family's needs. His dream is to continue growing basic grains and also start selling livestock to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and to pay hired help

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov (pictured here) is 54 years old and lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1985 and has four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is married and lives separately, and her sons attend school. 

Pov is a tailor, while her husband is a mason. Anyway, under her wooden house is open-air space, so she wants to build a concrete brick room. With the concrete brick room that she wants to build, Pov can sleep or keep away from the elements.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a farming and vegetable-selling business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and vegetables seeds.

Rosario has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Liza is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle-transport business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her repair shop business.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. Marilyn earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 53 years old and married with 10 children, four of whom are in school. Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Mercy has been in this business for one year.

In the future Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa Yamilet

texts.es: Tomasa Yamilet, mayor de edad madre soltera de dos hijos aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, luchadora en la vida para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darle un futuro mejor, y brindarles las oportunidades que lamentablemente ella no tuvo por falta de recursos económicos. Pero hoy en día ella está estudiando una carrera de Derecho que pronto terminara. Pero gracias a su espíritu de superación personal esta microempresaria se dedica a la compra venta de ropa nueva como: variedades estilos de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños, al igual que zapatos, cosméticos los cuales los ofrece de forma ambulante, la mayor parte de su mercadería la mantiene en cuentas por cobrar los que recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido,  también es propietaria de un caramanchel donde ofrece productos como: granos básicos, aceite , detergentes productos congelados entre otros, ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza al contado en distintos mercados de otras localidades, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar sus estudios para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ver crecer mas su negocio para tener más ingresos, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo e invertir en al compra de granos básicos, y lograr cubrir algunos encargos de ropa que tiene, de esa manera brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes, Tomasa agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Tomasa Yamilet is a grown woman and a single mother of two children under her care. She is originally from one of the towns in the northern part of the country. She is known in life for being an enterprising, responsible, and determined woman who wants her children to get ahead and have a better future. Tomasa tries to provide them with the opportunities that she unfortunately did not have due to the lack of financial resources. However, she is now studying for a law degree and will be finishing soon.

Thanks to her drive to succeed on a personal level, this small businesswoman has devoted herself to selling new clothes such as women’s garments in various styles, menswear, children’s outfits, as well as shoes and cosmetics that she offers as a traveling vendor. Most of her merchandise is sold on credit, so she must collect payments on a weekly or biweekly basis. She also owns a vending stall located at her house where she offers products such as basic grains, oil, detergents, frozen products, and other items. Tomasa buys her products with cash at different markets in other towns.

One of her dreams it to finish her studies so that she can provide a better future for her children. She also wants to grow her business so that she will have more income. The purpose of this loan is to use it as operating capital so that she can buy basic grains and fulfill some of her outstanding clothing orders. This will enable her to provide better service to her customers.

Tomasa is extremely grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders offer to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and various types of clothing.

loans.name: Ena Milagro

texts.es: Doña Ena vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de los productos, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Ena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia como: golosinas, granos basicos, refrescos, azúcar, aceite, café, etc. todo por mayor para poder surtir mas su tienda y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Ena lives in her own home with her husband and children. She has a store set up in her residence that she has been managing for several years. Ena has many customers because she has a variety of products, offers good prices, and provides friendly service whenever she makes a sale. With the revenue she generates from her sales, she is able to pay for a few of the household expenses.

Doña Ena is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as snack foods, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, oil, coffee, and other products in bulk so that she can restock her store. As a result, she can earn more income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, oil, coffee, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Katherine Johana

texts.es: Johana es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella es soltera vive con sus padres y una hermana de 6 años que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Jhoana es muy responsable y  cuida muy bien a su ganado al que se dedica desde  hace 4 años, el crédito lo va a invertir comprando una vaca, ya que la ganadería es la fuente de ingresos de ella y de sus padres. Lo que esta joven aspira es que le siga yendo bien en su negocio como hasta ahora y así ampliarlo para que le deje mayor rentabilidad y con estos ingresos sobresalir juntamente con su familia
texts.en:
Johana is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is single and lives with her parents and a six-year-old sister who is in school.

Johana is very responsible and does a good job of looking after her cattle. She has been doing this for four years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow. Raising livestock is a source of income for both her and her parents.

What this young woman aspires to do is to continue doing well in her business, just like she is doing now. She would like to expand her business so that it becomes more profitable. The income it generates would help her get ahead along with her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Glinda

texts.en:
Glinda is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Glinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Glinda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from working at a general store and farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, dice que con el préstamo anterior pudo tener a su alcance los insumos necesarios para que su cosecha sea más abundante y de calidad, sus ganancias son mucho mejores y le han facilitado la cancelación de sus deudas y mejorado su situación familiar.
En esta oportunidad José solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semilla, de esta forma continuara trabajando y fortaleciendo poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en: José says that with the previous loan he was able to acquire necessary supplies to make his harvest more abundant and of higher quality. His earnings are much better and have helped him pay off his debts and improve his family's situation. José is taking this opportunity to request a new loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and seeds, and in this way he will continue working and strengthening his business little by little.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, ha tenido efectos positivos con el préstamo anterior tales como: cosecha abundante, productos de calidad, mejor venta y un buen margen de ganancia, con las que su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida y ha cancelado sus deudas.
El Sr.: Oscar opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla e insecticidas, que le faciliten tener todo lo necesario para realizar la próxima siembra.
texts.en: Oscar has seen positive effects from his previous loan, such as an abundant harvest of high-quality products, improved sales and a better profit margin, all of which helped his family improve its lifestyle and him pay off his debts. Oscar is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and insecticides, which hill help give him all he needs for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Miriam De Los Angeles

texts.es: Miriam de los Ángeles, mayor de edad acompañada con cuatro hijos todos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial por el turismo y sus hermosas playas, Miriam se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, desde muy joven tuvo que comenzar a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por falta de recursos económicos ella no logro seguir estudiando terminando solo la primaria, es por eso que uno de sus sueños es poder ver culminar las carreras de sus hijos, Miriam es una microempresaria propietaria de un negocio compra venta de mercadería en general como:variedades estilos de ropa para damas , caballeros y niños, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de otras localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido, inicia su negocio con capital propio buscando un medio digno de sobrevivir y salir adelante con sus hijos, su jornada diaria inicia desde muy temprano sale a recorrer las calles para entregar su mercadería la cual la mayor parte las mantiene en cuentas por cobrar. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, blusas, camisetas, short, faldas, bermudas, juegos de toallas, juegos de sabanas, ropa interior.
texts.en: Miriam de los Ángeles is a mother of four young children who are still under her care. She is a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega in the western part of the country, an area known for its tourism industry and beautiful beaches. Miriam is known as a hardworking, responsible woman with a desire for personal improvement, and since a very young age she had to work to help with household expenses. Due to a lack of economic resources, she was only able to attend primary school, and for this reason one of her dreams is for her children to earn degrees. Miriam is a small-business owner selling general merchandise such as a variety of clothing for men, women and children, shoes, cosmetics and other items. Her purchases are made in cash at markets in other towns, and her sales are in cash and credit, which she collects on a weekly and biweekly basis. She started her business with her own capital looking for a noble way to survive and make headway for her children. Her workday begins very early when she goes out to roam the streets to deliver her goods, managed mostly in accounts receivable. Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, towel sets, sheet sets and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as towel sets, sheets, underwear, shirts, skirts, cosmetics and other items.

loans.name: Marlisa

texts.en:
Marlisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a loan through NWTF to purchase an additional pail of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marlisa has been in this business for 10 years. Marlisa earns more income from direct selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional pail of fish to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Elsa has been in this business for two years. Elsa earns more income from her coffee shop and general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina works hard to support her family. Carmelina is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

Carmelina has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, coffee, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 48 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, shampoo, eggs, soap, etc.

Fely has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, milk, shampoo, eggs and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en:
Felyn is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felyn is 36 years old and four of her children are in school.

She has a buy and sell of young coconuts business in the Philippines. Felyn requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of young coconuts to sell.

Felyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Felyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more young coconuts to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Hannah requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like powdered rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Hannah has been in this business for 29 years now.

In the future, Hannah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like powdered rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en: Lolina is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Lolina requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, a sack of sugar and plastic bags for her pancakes. She plans to use her profits to help provide for her family's everyday needs and her children's education. Lolina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour,  vegetable oil, yeast,  sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Linaflor

texts.en: Linaflor is a 44-year-old mother who has three children attending school. She and her husband aim to educate their children so that they will find a good job someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, they help each other to generate income to support their education. Linaflor wants to continue to improve her business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of pork, fish and vegetables to sell in the local community. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more pork, fish and vegetables to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock flour and cereals

loans.name: Abhimunu

texts.en:
Abhimunu lives in a village in the outskirts of Deoghar town in the state of Jharkhand. He is married with five children (four sons and one daughter). The borrower is a physically challenged person. He started his dairy business by just trading milk 40 years ago. After four or five years, he bought two buffaloes. He used to stay in the kacha house (mud construction) and his buffaloes were kept in a hut whose roof was covered by a plastic sheet. With his enterprising capacity, he established a small dairy. 

Abhimunu took a loan and expanded his dairy farm. With the income from his business, he constructed a pacca house (brick construction) and built a cow shed for the cows and buffaloes. His eldest son is helping him with the dairy farm work. Two of his sons are working as masons with the local contractor and his daughter is married. Abhimunu now has 12 cows and buffaloes worth about Rs.400,000. 

Deoghar town has a very good demand for milk and the village has emerged as a dairy hub. Most of the residents are doing dairy businesses.

He is now seeking a loan to expand and modernize his dairy and ensure that his sons are well settled.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Bihari

texts.en:
Bihari, age 52, lives in Chittolodiya, Deosangh, Deogharh district, Jharkhand, India. He is married and a father of four children (one son and three daughters). Two of his daughters are married and the other two children are studying.  He owns a grocery shop. Bihari has been doing the business for the last 14 or 15 years.

Bihari is very hard working man. His wife helps him manage the shop. He has taken loans from the local NGO MESP earlier. His loan repayment track record is very good and he is seeking a loan for the third time. With this loan, he wants to purchase more goods for his shop. His shop is on the outskirts of the town and business is going well. He dreams of a better future for his children.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to marry his third daughter and pay for his son's education.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kausalya

texts.en:
Kausalya lives in Chittolodiya, Deogharh district, Jharkhand, India. She is married and a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All her kids are studying in the school. Her husband has a small dairy. He has four buffaloes, one cow and seven calves. He sells 40 litres of milk on a day-to-day basis in the Deoghar town where there is a good demand for milk. The town has emerged as a dairy hub.

Kausalya is a very hard working woman. Her husband is an enterprising man who has been doing the dairy business for the last 18 years. Kausalya has taken loans from MESP earlier. She wants a loan to purchase more buffaloes. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her farm in the future.  

She will use the profits from her expanded dairy farm to give her children good education so they become good human beings and improve the economic and living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Mohini

texts.en:
Chittolodiya is village in Deoghar District. The population of this village is very high. The residents of this village  work mainly in the construction sector as laborers and masons. 

Mohini is married and has two children. Her husband and one son work as masons with the local contractor. Due to the low collective monthly income of the family, she decided to start a stationery & cosmetics shop two years ago in her village so that she could contribute to the family's income.  She took a loan from the local NGO MESP to start her business. Her family does not have any agriculture lands. They are solely dependent on non-agriculture income. 

Mohini wants to take loan to expand her stationery and cosmetic shop as she is confident about her entrepreneurial skill.  Expanding her business will get her additional income with which she can build a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy stock for the shop.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is a married woman with three children (two daughters & one son). She got into the dairy business four years ago. Her two daughters are studying and her son is helping her in the dairy business. Her husband is working as a painter in the nearby villages.

She is staying in Chittolodiya village in the Deoghar district and has never gone to school. Most people in this village are working in the construction sector. She owns two cows and one calf. Sarita sells about 5 or 6 liters of milk every day. Her family is purely dependent on non-farming sector income.  She has taken a loan from the local NGO MESP to start the business.

With this loan, she wants to buy a cow so that she can improve her dairy business. Her husband is also very cooperative.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a herbal medicines business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bottles to sell. Marivic has been in this business for 7 years now. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bottles to sell

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a single mother hailing from Kacence in the Mbarara Municipality. She dropped out of school after getting pregnant at a very early age. After that incident, she lost the support of her parents, and unfortunately she didn’t know the father of the child.
