She later got a donation from her aunt and started buying and selling goats in the nearby market, which helped her and her child to survive.

Now she is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to increase her working capital in the business. She will be able to buy better quality goats and at a reduced price, since she will be buying many of them.

She is resilient and is optimistic that the business will grow.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es:
El socio lauro se dedica la negocio de agricultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde siembra cafe y cacao,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el terreno de cultivo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Lauro, works in agriculture and grows coffee and cocoa.  Through his business he has been able to make a living but now his goal is to expand his cropland.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Lauro is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karen, ha aprendido mediante cursos todo lo relacionado con la sastrería, artesanías y fabricación de piñatas, ella desde hace cinco años cuenta con su negocio en el que ofrece sus productos, trabaja en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.; vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de pegamento, papelería, pintura, alambre, etc., así como también realizara algunos arreglos en el local, espera aumentar su producción mejorar la vistosidad del negocio, mejorar las ganancias para dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con tener su casa propia y que su negocio sea autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Karen has learned through courses everything related to tailoring, handicrafts and piñata-making.  For five years she has been in business offering her products, working from 7;00 a.m. to 5;00 p.m.  She lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages ten and 13.

She will use the loan to buy glue, stationery goods, paint, wire, etc., as well as to fix up her shop.  Her aim is to increase production, make her business more attractive, earn more profit to improve her family's lifestyle and pay back the loan.

She dreams of having her own house and of making her business financially independent.

loans.use: To buy glue, stationery goods, paint, wire, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

"Este préstamo es parte de la "Credi Yapa" a la Asociación Arariwa, que permite a los prestatarios con un buen historial crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo: un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de cuatro meses."
texts.en:
The member, Julia, is involved in agriculture and grows coffee, cocoa and bananas.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and has been in business for several years, and the business is doing well.  Her dream is to have her own coffee store one day.  The loan she is requesting is to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Julia is happy with the loan and committed to paying it back on time.  


"This loan is part of the Arariwa Association's "Credi Yapa", which allows borrowers with a good credit record to receive a special loan: a small loan in addition to the regular loan, with a four-month, flexible pay schedule."

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for coffee crop care and maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oranges, bananas and tangerines.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es el responsable de generar los recursos económicos para que su familia tenga todo lo necesario, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, se dedica a la venta ambulante de pan francés y pan dulce así como también hot dogs, su tiempo lo distribuye así de 4:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., es su primer jornada luego por la tarde de 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m. es su último recorrido.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de pan, embutidos, aderezos y un coche para minutas, con dicha inversión tendrá la materia prima para su negocio y también incorpora la venta de minutas con el objetivo de tener ingresos extras para cancelar sus cuotas y cambiar su estilo de vida familiar.
Su visión es continuar creciendo con el negocio y tener una mejor economía para que su familia tenga mejor alimentación, educación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Juan is the breadwinner in his family and responsible for generating enough income to cover all household needs.  He lives with his common-law wife and their two children.  He works as a street vendor selling french bread and sweet bread, as well as hot dogs.  His work schedule is distributed over a period of time between 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. to start the day and then from 4:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. in the evening.

The loan he is requesting is to buy bread, sausages, condiments and a snowcone cart.  With this investment he will have the necessary raw materials for his business and be able to start selling snowcones in an aim to earn extra income to pay back the loan and to change his family's lifestyle.  His goal is to continue expanding the business and improve his financial situation so his family will have better food, education, health and clothing.

loans.use: To buy bread, sausages, condiments and a snowcone cart.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 24 años de edad, lamentablemente solo pudo estudiar hasta séptimo grado por los escasos recursos económicos de su familia, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 6 meses de edad y por lo tanto su pareja y su hijo dependen completamente de Oscar.
 
Él es un joven muy trabajador, desde hace 4 años Oscar se dedica  a la peluquería, además realiza trabajos agrícolas, él tiene un local en condición de alquiler, en el cual realiza los cortes de cabello y su horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde y el local le queda a la par de su casa.

El préstamo que él está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta por lo que debe complementar el dinero pues solo cuenta con una parte del monto, ocupa la moto ya que cuando hace mandados a la ciudad, demora mucho tiempo y pierde todo el día y debe ir en buses lo cual  resulta bastante incómodo pues existe un mal servicio de transporte público.

Este joven emprendedor, sueña con tener su propio local para el negocio y no seguir alquilando pues le resulta más caro, y desea mejorar sus condiciones económicas para brindarle a su familia el sustento diario y que no le falte nada a su hija recién nacida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 24 years old but was only able to get a seventh grade education, unfortunately, because his parents could not afford more.  He lives with his common-law wife, who is a homemaker, and their six-month-old son, both of whom are totally dependant on Oscar.

He is a very industrious young man who has been working as a hairdresser for four years.  He also works in agriculture.  He rents a shop near his home where he works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. offering hair cuts.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a motorcycle since he only has part of the money he needs to buy it.  He needs the motorcycle to get around the city because he wastes much of the day having to depend on buses, which is uncomfortable because of the bad public transportation service.

This young entrepreneur dreams of having his own shop and not having to rent since it is so expensive.  He wants to improve his economy in order to support his family on a daily basis and to make sure his baby girl has everything she needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, se decidió por otro crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, harina, bebidas, carnes, arroz, verduras, para preparar los diferentes menús de su comedor así como también para elaborar las pupusas.
Con el crédito anterior pudo surtir el inventario del negocio sus ventas aumentaron y ha tenido mejores ingresos los cuales le han servido para cancelar las deudas, compro una plancha de cocina y su familia goza de un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia has decided to request another loan to buy cheese, pork rinds, flour, beverages, meats, rice and vegetables to make the different foods she sells at her stand.  She also makes pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

With her previous loan she was able to stock her business so sales increased and she earned more income which helped pay off debt.  She bought a griddle and her family is enjoying a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cheese, pork rinds, flour, beverages, meats, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Kady

texts.fr:
Madame Kady est âgée  de 54 ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire à Darsalam    Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Après avoir abandonnée prématurément l’école  pour des raisons sociales, elle commença à vendre des articles Nigérian et mène cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis 40 ans. Elle a une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Sa force de vente est due à son courage et au sens élevé des affaires. 
Elle demande ce prêt  dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour la satisfaction des demandes clientèle et s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Elle a décide de collaborer avec Soro yiriwaso et elle est son 1er  prêt individuel. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 30 cartons de vaselines. 
Madame  Kady  vend au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte à Ségou. Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter  son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de pérenniser et diversifiée son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kady, age 54, is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in Darsalam Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After dropping out of school prematurely for social reasons, she started selling Nigerian products, a money-earning business she's been running for the past 40 years.  

She has a lot of experience in this field. She's a strong seller, thanks to her courage and her highly-developed business sense.

She's seeking this loan in order to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand. She gets her supplies in Nigeria.

She decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her first personal loan.

She intends to use it to buy 30 boxes of vaseline. She sells in Ségou, for cash and often on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. 

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000, to be used to provide for her children's needs and increase her working capital. Her ambition is to make her business sustainable and to diversify it.

loans.use: to buy 30 boxes of vaseline

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame  Madina est âgée  de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire au camp militaire de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Après avoir abandonné prématurément l’école  pour des raisons sociales, elle mène des activités génératrices de revenus depuis 18 ans, vente de glace et de jus de fruits. Elle a une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. 
Elle demande ce prêt  dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à  la demande clientèle. Elle a décide de collaborer avec Soro yiriwaso et elle est son 4éme  prêt individuel qui sera utiliser pour acheter un congélateur. 
Madame Madina  vend au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte chez elle et en ambulant. Elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et augmenter également son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madina, age 42, is married and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family at the military camp in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After dropping out of school prematurely for social reasons, she started selling ice and fruit juices 18 years ago.

She has a lot of experience in this field. She's seeking this loan in order to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand.

She decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her fourth personal loan, to be used to buy a freezer.

She sells for cash and often on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele, at her home and as a traveling saleswoman.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 75'000 with this loan, to be used to cover the family's expenses and also increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for maintenance for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Mukandikwa

texts.fr: Le client Mukandikwa est un agent nutritionniste de carrière de 21 ans dans un centre hospitalier de reconstitution physique de la place, âgé de 59 ans, marié et parent de 6 étudiants et élève inscrits respectivement à l’université et école secondaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants étudiants pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir de médecins, ingénieurs agronomes, électromécaniciens, informaticiens, cadres d’entreprise, professeur d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mukandikwa has been a professional nutritionist in a local rehabilitation hospital for 21 years.  He is 59 years old, married and father to six children who all study, either at secondary school or at university.  

He has recently been made aware of the new education loans offered by the field partner, Hekima.  These loans provide the opportunity to pay in advance for school fees.  This will allow Mukandikwa to pay the fees of his children for the school year 2013-2014, and ensure that they are not excluded from classes during the year.

Mukandikwa is a father who dreams of a better future for his children.  He would like to see them become doctors, agronomists, electrical engineers, IT specialists, business managers, university professors, reverend pastors, politicians, etc.

He is very grateful to Hekima for this loan initiative, which will have a great social impact.  This is especially important in this period of reconstruction in the east of the country.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Molobaly

texts.fr:
Madame  Molobaly est âgée  de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier sokala de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elle mène cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis 25 ans. Elle bénéficie d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Sa force de vente est due à son courage et au sens élevé des affaires. 
Elle demande ce prêt  dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande clientèle et s’approvisionner  sur place. 
Elle a décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et elle est son 3éme  prêt individuel. Elle compte acheter 1 tonne de poudre de savon et effectue ses 
ventes au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte chez elle et en ambulant. Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Molobaly, age 58, is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband in a traditional family in Sokala, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She's been running her money-earning business for the past 25 years. She has a lot of experience in this field. She's a strong seller, thanks to her courage and her highly-developed business sense.

She's seeking this loan in order to bolster her working capital and meet an ever-increasing customer demand. She gets her supplies locally.

She decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her third personal loan.

She intends to use it to buy 1 ton of soap powder. She resells for cash and often on credit, at her home and as a traveling saleswoman, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000, to be used to provide for her children's needs and also increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of soap powder

loans.name: Abibumbiyehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Félicisme fait partie du groupe  Abibumbiyehamwe et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 47 ans est mariée  à  Grégoire une cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 6 à 33 ans dont 5 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes, de tomates, et de limonade  depuis   15 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes, de tomates et de limonade à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait construire  une maison pour ses activités,  ajouter de la bière e de la farine et de petits poissons (ndagala)dans son commerce, et  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Félicisme, age 47, is part of Abibumbiyehamwe Group. She lives in Gitega and is married to Grégoire, a cultivator. They have seven children together, aged 6 to 33. Five of them attend school.

She's been selling bananas, tomatoes, and lemonade for 15 years. She's seeking her ninth loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, tomatoes, and lemonade to resell and increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to build a house for her business, start selling beer, flour and small fishes (ndagala), and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas, tomatoes, and lemonade

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket weaving business for several years now. She makes and sells native baskets made of buri (palm). This is the source of her income.

Flora is asking for a loan to purchase materials like buri (palm), and wicker (hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). 

With this, she will be able to make more baskets, thus allowing her to sell more to the market. 

Flora wants to expand her business in the future, and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials like buri (palm), and wicker (hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture)

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Tirun

texts.en:
Tirun lives in Lernagog village with her husband and son. Her husband is a village herdsman. Tirun herself takes care of their livestock, which includes 20 sheep.
 
Income from agriculture is very important for the family's living, and that's the reason Tirun and her husband work really hard to be able to sustain their living. 

By applying for this loan, Tirun asks financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to enrich her livestock by 10 more sheep, and gather more income.

Tirun has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Tirun has been approved for this loan. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Meet Eunice, a farmer residing in the rich highlands of Kericho with her husband and five children.  The children range in age between 24 and 4 years.

She has been doing farming for the past three years; her primary income is milk, eggs, tea. What she enjoys most about farming is dairy and tea farming, because it usually boosts her income. Her biggest challenge is insufficient rain which affects her tea farm.

Eunice chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers develop their farming projects by financing those projects with low interest rates, and they also offer training to the farmers.

This loan will enable her to buy a beef cow, which will be used to generate more income because of selling cow milk.

Her income base will increase and thus enabling her to educate her children better.

loans.use: to purchase a beef cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who applied for a loan of UGX.3,000,000. 

She runs a restaurant in Sanga trading centre, and has been doing this for more than five years. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy food in bulk (making it cheaper) and utensils, so that she can increase her earnings to maintain her family, pay school fees for her siblings, and develop herself. 

Mariam is an honest and very hard working woman but is always limited by capital. She intends to shift from a smaller room to a bigger room in Sanga town, where she says turnover and profit margins are higher than where she is currently operating. 

She is confident her dreams will soon come true, given the financial support from the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy food and utencils

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Cresencia engages in buying and reselling of footwear, AVON and Natasha products within her community. She is 55 years old and has only one child. She aims to improve her business to earn a sufficient income. 

She is asking for  a loan of PHP12,000 to buy more stock of footwear, AVON and Natasha products to sell in the local community. 

Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of footwear, AVON and Natasha products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 40-year-old woman from the village of Sakasria. She leads seven family members, and agricultural activity is the only source of income.

Family members get social assistance from the local government, as they live under poverty and have a small income for existence. Irma and her son run the agricultural activity, specifically, they take care of pigs, cultivate a plot of family-owned agricultural land, and grow strawberries and sell them seasonally. It's clear that this mentioned income is so insignificant for seven family members to cover all daily costs and have a satisfying condition of living for the children.

In order somehow to increase the productivity, Irma's business needs some investment. 

She requested a loan of 1,500 GEL to purchase chickens to set up a poultry farm. After they grow, she will sell them for a good price. 

Irma's request was approved within the start-up program that enables poor people to start or re-start businesses. 

Irma and her son will make much effort for maintain the other and really profitable part of agricultural activity. They await your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, embutidos, golosinas, granos básicos, concentrado para pollos etc., para surtir el negocio y continuar dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener mercadería que sus clientes requerían en su tienda y aumento los pollos de engorde su granja, sus ventas son mejoras y su economía es mucho mejor. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
María is choosing to take out a new loan to invest in buying drinks, sausages, sweets, staple foods, concentrated chicken feed, etc. with which to stock her business and continue to offer good service to her clients. 

The previous loan helped her to have in her store merchandise that her clients needed, and to have more chickens for fattening on her farm. Her sales are now better and her economy is much better also. Her family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sausages, sweets, staple foods, concentrated chicken feed, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica, 42, is married and has 6 children, only two of whom attend school. She deals in produce and has additional income from rentals in Hoima, Uganda. She started her business to take care of her family and educate her children, having failed to go to school herself because of a lack of money to pay the school fees. She hopes to expand her business and open up a big produce store for easy access by her customers, but encounters the challenges of limited capital and bad roads that affect her service delivery. Monica needs this loan to buy maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 23-year-old woman with two children. She runs a small plantation and sells her produce in her village and at the market.

She requested a loan to buy a bottle of chemicals, knife, wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, taro, and banana tube. She will use her business profits for her family's everyday needs. Filomena has been doing this business for many years and became a member of SPBD in 2014. 

She hopes to expand her business and help her children in their future education.

loans.use: to buy a bottle of chemicals, knife, wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, taro, and banana tube.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas, fertilizantes e insecticidas contar con los insumos necesarios con los que pueda preparar la tierra y sembrara sin ningún inconveniente.
Con el crédito anterior adquirió los insumos necesarios para cultivar,  sus ingresos no fueron muchos debido a que la cosecha por factores climáticas no se desarrolló como debía y no tuvo mucha producción, más sin embargo cancelo puntualmente su deuda y mejoro un poco el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José decided to ask for a new loan to buy soil amendments, pesticides, fertilizers, and insecticides.  He counts on having the necessary supplies to prepare the land and sow without inconvenience.

With his previous loan, he got the necessary supplies to plant.  His income wasn’t great because due to climatological factors, the harvest didn’t develop as it should, so he didn’t have good production.  Nevertheless, he paid off his debt on time and improved his family’s living conditions slightly.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, pesticides, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto, es padre de dos hijas de 18 y 28 años de edad, desde hace 38 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de loza es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres, ya posee muchos clientes a los que les distribuye su mercadería, su horario es de 6:00 a.m.  a 6:00 p.m.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de nacazcol, arcilla, barro y leña, teniendo los materiales necesarios continuara trabajando y así podrá entregar en menos tiempo sus pedidos, aumentar su producción, tener las ganancias a tiempo para cancelar las cuotas y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Sueña con mantenerse trabajando y que su negocio sea cada vez más rentable para cumplir con los diferentes compromisos que posee.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a father to two daughters, ages 18 and 28. For the past 38 years he has made and sold earthenware. He learned the trade from his parents, and he has many clients to whom he distributes his merchandise. His schedule is from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of nazcazcol (a black dye), clays, and firewood. Having the necessary materials, he will continue working, and so he will be able to fulfil his orders in less time, increase his production, and be paid in time to make his payments and improve his family's lifestyle. 

He dreams that he can keep working and that his business will become more and more profitable in order to fulfill his various commitments.

loans.use: compra de nacazcol, arcilla, barro y leña

loans.name: Miguel Ángel Alberto

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, actualmente él está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene 1 pequeño hijo y él es responsable de mantener a su familia.

Miguel se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al trabajo en la agricultura, además trabaja de motorista en la comunidad 3 días a la semana, y tiene un horario de trabajo de 6 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.

Este joven trabajador necesita muchísimo de este préstamo, para poner el agua potable en su vivienda ya que actualmente no cuenta con dicho servicio en su casa y quiere unirse al proyecto de agua de la comunidad y otra parte del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar un par de teneros.

Entre sus objetivos a futuro están, criar muy bien a los terneros para que crezcan bien y poder reproducirlos para luego venderlos y con las ganancias desea mejorar su vivienda pues con su familia son muy pobres y viven en una casa de lámina, espera mejorarla para que en época de invierno no tenga problemas por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old, studied up to the fourth grade in school, is now married, and his wife makes a living doing household chores.  He has one small son and is responsible for supporting his family.

For a large part of his life, Miguel has worked in agriculture in addition to working as a driver in the community three days a week.  His work schedule is from 6:00 in the morning to 4:00 in the afternoon.

This hard-working young man needs most of this loan in order to put potable water in his home because he does not have this service in his house right now and he wants to connect it to the community's water project.  He will use the other part of the loan to buy a pair of calves.

His goals for the future are to take good care of the calves so that they grow well and are able to reproduce so that he can later sell them.  With the profit he wants to improve his home since his family is very poor and they live in a house made of sheet metal.  He hopes to improve it so that in winter they do not have problems from the rain.

loans.use: to put potable water in his home.

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Benkady est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Bois de chauffage, Légumes et Fruits, Charbons, Condiments, Tissus  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Massan 1 ère de la droite vers la gauche est une vendeuse de bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du bois de chauffe. Elle se procure de ces Bois dans les villages environnant de Koutiala et les vend à la maison à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkady comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Massan compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkady is a group of women from Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 43 years of age and have at least 5 children.

They sell various products, such as firewood, charcoal, condiments, vegetables, fruits, fabrics, etc. To bolster their businesses, the members of the group decided to join the loan program from Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their fifth group loan.

Massan is the woman on the right in the photograph. She sells firewood. She intends to use her loan to buy firewood. She gets her wood supplies in the villages surrounding Koutiala, and sells it at her home, to a diverse clientele.

Whereas the other members of Benkady Group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 160'000 during this loan cycle, Mrs. Massan intends to reach XOF 170'000.

In addition to repaying the loans, they will use part of their income to cover personal expenses and increase their working capital. They wish to reinforce their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, to avoid getting out of stock.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  YANKADI est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’oignon et de  boissons à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 44 casiers de boissons  avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Yankadi Group is made up of seven married women, who average 37 years of age and three children. The live in nuclear families in Heremakono Nord, in Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capability and make their businesses more efficient, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first loan.

The women in the group sell onions and beverages, just like Fatoumata, the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 44 cases of beverages from wholesalers in Bamako.

She sells retail at the market and at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 44 cases of beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Este préstamo es parte de las lineas de créditos "Credi Yapa" de la Asociación Arariwa, que permite los prestatarios con un buen historial de crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo: Credi Yapa es un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de seis meses.

Justina se dedica la agricultura y le va muy bien pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde tiene frutales, café, té, cacao y coca, ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Huayopata - Chonta" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. 

Justina agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
This loan is part of the credit line "Credi Yapa" from the Arariwa Association that allows borrowers with a good credit history to receive a special loan. Credi Yapa is a small loan, in addition to their regular loan, that has a flexible payment schedule over six months.

Justina is in agriculture for a living and it is going well because she has various terrains of crops where she has fruit, coffee, cacao and cocoa. She is a responsible and kind person that belongs to the communal bank "Huayopata - Chonta" of the Arariwa Association and this time she needs a loan to buy seeds.

Justina is grateful to the lenders for the loan and promises to make her payments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a man of forty-seven years, and he is married to Mary and a father of six children. He sells timber in Limuru and has been in this business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of 7,500 KES.

This will be David's fifth loan with Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more timber to sell. He wants to educate his children in the future and also expand his current business.

loans.use: to purchase timber to resell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 41 years old, is a mother of two who lives with her family. To make a living, her husband had carpentry work in their village, while she raises pigs for sale. For three years, she has been selling pigs in the market, and sometimes meat in their village. She earns a better income from this which supports the family's basic needs. 

To to buy additional piglets, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which she had joined recently. 

In the near future, she wants to improve the general living situation as well as their business, to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Mayisyan village of Armavir region. She lives there with her father-in-law and little son. The other parts of her family (husband, elder son and mother-in-law) are migrant workers in a neighboring country. 

Karine herself runs a small farm. She keeps a cow, two calves, and cultivates wheat and watermelon. The gathered harvest she sells to local wholesalers. Karine dreams of having a big and profitable farm so her husband won't have to go abroad and live far from his farm.

She has now applied for this loan to ask financial support, and to purchase seeds for land cultivation, and hire a workforce for gathering the harvest. 

This will be a big support for Karine, and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for land cultivation, and hire a workforce for gathering the harvest

loans.name: Enrique Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Enrique es un hombre luchador, casado, de profesion Administrador de empresas con 5 años de ejercer dicha prefesion. Este señor tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y tener mejores condiciones de vida , como es contruir un dormitorio, siendo con este el numero de credito 8 mostrando ser un cliente responsable con sus compromisos. Dicho financiamiento lo utlizaria para comprade materiales de construccion tales como:Cemento,zinc, perlines, bloques, ladrillos, puerta, hierro, arena, piedrin y pago de mano  de obra.
 Enrique se encuentra muy agrdecido  con la institucion que por medio de ceprodel le han brindado el opyo oportuno. y de esta manera ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Enrique is a fighter, married, a company administrator by profession and with five years of experience doing this job. He needs to improve his home and have better living conditions, and so he is building a bedroom. This will be his eighth loan, showing him to be a client who is responsible with his commitments. 

He will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, purlins, blocks, bricks, a door, iron, sand, gravel, and to pay construction workers. Enrique is very grateful to the institution which, through Ceprodel, has given him this opportune support, and in this way he has been improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, purlins, blocks, bricks, a door, iron, sand, gravel, and to pay construction workers.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
To overcome poverty, Leonida helps her husband in earning an income. She runs a small variety store while her husband cultivates their farm land. They aimed to improve their sources of income in order to sustain their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Leonida planned to increase her products offerings and satisfy her customers' demand but she has inadequate capital. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, shampoo, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her community. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, shampoo, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She does dairy farming in Mbau-ini in the outskirts of Limuru, which she has been doing for four years. She earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

Monicah requested her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, she wants to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a father of three, provides for his family by earning from a transportation services business. He has been in this business for more than eight years. He earns well from this. 

With his generated revenue, his previous loan used for spare parts and tires was successfully repaid. 

To cover the costs for motorcycle maintenance, Peter took a new loan from GDMPC recently. 

In the future, he wants to see his children be successful.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 38-year-old female who lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She is a physical planner in the Masindi District local government, and has been in service for five years. 

Catherine was inspired to join the profession because of the passion she had for it. She has a dream of going for further studies, only to be challenged by delays in salary payment and high taxes of pay as you earn levied by the government. 

She is requesting a loan to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, dice que le crédito anterior le ayudo a tener los recursos necesario para adquirir los insumos agrícolas con los que preparo el terreno para sembrar y protegió la cosecha de plagas, con los nuevos ingresos cancelo las cuotas, da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y le ayudo a su compañera de vida a instalar la venta de tortillas.
José se decidió por otro crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y láminas, le servirán para preparar el terreno y sembrar sin problemas, así como también mejorar el establecimiento  en  donde elabora la venta su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
José says that his previous loan helped him to have the resources to get agricultural supplies, with which he prepared the land for sowing and protected his harvest from pests.  With his income he made his payments, gave his family better living conditions, and helped his partner to get set up selling tortillas.

José decided to take out another loan to buy soil amendments, insecticides, pesticides, and metal sheeting.  It will allow him to prepare the land and plant crops without problems, and will also improve the place where his partner makes her sales.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, insecticides, pesticides, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a repeat customer, age 30 years old. He is married with two children.

He deals with sugarcane plantations.  

He applied for a loan of 2,000,000 shs to buy mulch. 

He has a challenge of little income from his sugarcane, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy mulch so that he can improve the productivity and income in the long run.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de loza, vive junto a sus hijos de 16, 12, 9 y uno de 6 años de edad, de los cuales tres están estudiando, aprendió de su madre el oficio, lo realiza de forma independiente desde hace 18 años, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.
Utilizará el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de arcilla, nacazcol y barro, son parte de los materiales que utiliza para realizar sus piezas de loza, espera que su producción sea mayor, cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos.
Anhela a tener un negocio activo que le genere los ingresos económicos para darle a su familia una mejor salud, vestuario, alimentación y educación.
texts.en:
María makes and sells earthenware. She lives with her children ages 16, 12, 9, and 6 years old, of whom three are in school. She learned the trade from her mother and has been doing it independently for 18 years. Her schedule is from 6:00 AM until 5:00 PM. 

She will use the loan to buy clays and nacazcol (a type of black dye), which are some of the materials she uses to make her earthenware pieces. She hopes that her production will increase, she will fulfill her clients' orders and she will increase her income. She longs to have an active business that makes her enough money to give her family better health, clothing, food, and education.

loans.use: to buy clays and nacazcol (a type of black dye)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional restaurant-size pizza oven so she can meet additional customer demands.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr:
Madame Marie Thérèse est âgée de 55 ans et enseigne à l’école Vice Santa Maria de Médine, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vit chez elle dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Angoulême de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elle vend de la  pâte d’arachide et mène cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis 5 ans. Elle a une grande expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. Elle demande ce prêt  dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande clientèle et s’approvisionne sur place en matière première. Elle a décide de collaborer avec Soro yiriwaso et elle est son 1er  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 sacs  d’arachide auprès des producteurs. 
Madame Marie Thérèse vend au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte chez elle et ambulant. Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, ce dernier lui permettra de subvenir aux petits besoins de son enfant et augmenter également son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de pérenniser et diversifiée son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Marie Thérèse is 55 years old and teaches at the school Vice Santa Maria de Médine. She is a married mother of one child and lives in her home in a nuclear family in the Angoulême district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She sells peanut butter and has been in this revenue-generating businesses for five years. She has a lot of experience in this business domain. 

She is asking for this loan to increase her business capital, so as to do more and more to satisfy customer demands. She gets her supplies of ingredients locally. She decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to purchase 5 sacks of peanuts from producers. 

At her house and by hawking, Ms. Marie Thérèse makes her sales to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will enable her to meet the various needs of her child and also to increase her capital. Her ambition is to make her business sustainable and to diversify it.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has five children. 

Nena has been engaged in a motorcycle shop business for more than seven years now with her husband. She makes repairs on motorcycles in their community for a certain fee. This is the source of their income.

Nena is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and screw drivers. 

In the future, Nena hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tire, nuts and bolts, chains and others

loans.name: Hm - He 2 Group

texts.en:
Hieng is a Thai woman of 42 years, living with her son in an old Thai traditional house. Her husband passed away four years ago. Since then, her son has dropped out of school and supports her in earning a livelihood. 

They rely only on agricultural production, which consists of cultivating rice, planting vegetables, maize, breeding 21 chickens, 3 pigs for sale and a buffalo for ploughing. Despite her effort during the last harvest, the bad weather caused some damage to the rice and vegetable yield. Accordingly, this brought about a decrease in income. 

This is her third loan in the Anh Chi Em program and this time, she would use the loan to cover the expense of leveling the rice field, preparing for the next crop. 

With a timely loan and the training sessions from  Anh Chi Em, she hopes to improve the income and provide a better life for her son. She dreams that her son would escape from the vicious circle of poverty and have a more abundant life than her.

In the picture, Hieng is wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to level the rice field for the next crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy current and some future stock.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a repeat client. She is 25 years old and has separated from her husband. She is responsible for looking after her siblings and her own children.

She applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 shillings to increase her retail stock. She has a challenge of little business turnover from her business, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to expand her stock which will increase her sales and improve her service delivery and income in the long run.

loans.use: to buy retail stock

loans.name: Fogalele

texts.en:
Fogalele is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small plantation for planting taro and banana. She has been doing this business for many years. 

Fogalele has requested a loan to buy a knife, chemicals, backpack sprayer, banana tube, taro roots, safety boots, wheelbarrow and water tank to assist with her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will use her profits to assist with her family's daily needs and her children's education, as well as to improve her business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a knife, chemicals, backpack sprayer, banana tube, taro roots, safety boots, wheelbarrow and water tank.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 23-year-old male. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is married with one child. Sam has a health-products business, whereby he sells herbal products. He has two water taps and a boutique as additional income sources. His business is located on a busy street where the general public can access him. Sam started the business so as to earn a living. Sam has a great dream of having a stable income and family.

He wants a loan for buying more nutritional-supplement products.

loans.use: to buy nutritional supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Gouz Group

texts.en:
Gouz is a group that consists of four women living in Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB. 

Gouz is a leader of the group. She is a 47-year-old and a mother of five children. The oldest child is 25 years old, and the youngest one is 15 years old. She is an uneducated woman. 

Lately the economic situation of her family has worsened due to the crisis in Yemen. Gouz wants to improve the condition of her family through helping her husband in covering the family expenses, so she started two years ago working as a dressmaker. She makes clothes for women in her area. Her business is going very well, and she is in need to prepare herself for the marriage season, when most of the women and children wear new clothes. 

Gouz has to buy more sewing materials to meet the expected demand of her clients, but unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough money; thus, she applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER. She looks forward to opening a savings account and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 65 years old and married with five children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Josefina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 34 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nyamadzao

texts.en:
Nyamadzao is 39 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. He is from Mutare. Nyamadzao operates a manufacturing business producing formal shoes, school shoes, and sandals, which he has been doing for 16 years. His main challenge is a decrease in sales revenue due to liquidity challenges in the country. 

Nyamadzao requested a loan for $300, which he will use to buy leather, shoe saws, and glue. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his household income. In the future, Nyamadzao plans to open a leather shop.

loans.use: to purchase leather, shoe saws, and glue for making shoes

loans.name: Kabeega

texts.en:
Kabeega is a married, honest Ugandan man. He is aged 34 years and living in Kagadi with two children of ages 10 and 6 years; both attend school. 

He has been selling produce to get money, and hopes to grow his business and buy a lorry despite price fluctuations. Kabeega is asking lenders to fund this Hofokam loan, and he intends to use the loan to buy more maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale

loans.name: Ovidio Otilio

texts.es: Don ovidio de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia en casa propia desde hace varios años se dedica  ala fotografía, posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad con que toma la foto y los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Ovidio esta solicitando un crédito a integral para poder comprar una impresora para fotografías ya que la que tiene no le alcanza para poder sacar el pedido que e solicitan ya si podrá seguir con su trabajo y le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his family. For many years he has made a living through photography. He has many customers that prefer him for the quality of the photos that he takes and his affordable prices. With his earnings, he is able to cover his household expenses. 

Ovidio is requesting a loan from Integral so that he can buy a photo printer because the one he has is not sufficient to print his current orders. In this way, he will be able to continue working and offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a photo printer.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en:
Inoyat  is a hardworking woman who was born in 1970. She is married and has 3 children. Inoyat has her own business, sewing women’s and children’s clothes. She began her business 17 years ago and her daughter helps her to manage the business. Thanks to Inoyat's great experience and good service, she has regular customers. Inoyat’s husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Inoyat is going to repair her house as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy building materials, such as  as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Al-Yemen Today Group

texts.en:
Al-Yemen Today is a group of four female members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemeni rials) from AMB.

Huda is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with two children living with them in their own house. Her oldest child is 26 years old, and the youngest one is 13 years old. 

She studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Now, she works as a housekeeper, and her husband is the only breadwinner of the family. Her husband is an employee, and his salary is good, but it is not enough to cover all the living expenses, and most of what he earns goes to the children's education fees.  

Due to this condition, Huda decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase house appliances to improve the house living conditions. She looks forward to opening a savings account. Her ambition is to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy some home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and to prepare her farm for planting season

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Despite being widowed, Florenda aims to improve her status of living in order to support her family. She is 59 years old and has five children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. She also engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to have additional income. 

She aims to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of onions, garlic, beans, cabbages, squash and eggplant to resell in the community. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of onions, garlic, beans, cabbages, squash and eggplant to resell

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom was born in 1961. She is married and has six children. She began her job in a local hospital 11 years ago. Gulandom works as a cleaning woman. She works hard. Gulandom is one of the best workers. She uses her salary to buy food items for her big family. 

Now, her husband does not have a job in Tajikistan, and he is going to go to Russia for finding a job. Gulandom is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy an air ticket for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband to find work in Russia

loans.name: Kolgtaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA est responsable du groupe KOLGTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 04 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des habits pour enfant depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  04 et ½ douzaines d’habit pour enfant et 02 et ½ douzaines de couverture.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Rasmata represents the group 'Kolgtaaba'. She is a married mother of four children, of whom the oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 8. All four of her children currently attend school. 

Rasmata has been selling clothing for children for seven years. She gets her supplies from her local area, and her customers include both men and women. She would like to purchase four-and-a-half-dozen pieces of clothing for children and two-and-a-half-dozen blankets. 

She saves her profits and will use a part of them to help pay the school fees of her children. Her ambition is to open a big store one day.

loans.use: to buy 4½ dozen pieces of clothing for children and 2½ dozen blankets, for resale.

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a female aged 40 years and has two children. She is a businesswoman dealing in produce and also has a school canteen for additional income. She started her business to improve her family's welfare. She has a vision of educating her children and expanding her business into new markets, despite being challenged by poor roads that make transportation of her goods to her customers difficult.

Madrine is acquiring a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, es el administrador de la venta de repuestos y reparación de bicicletas, con dicho negocio puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, el negocio lo posee desde hace 11 años,  lo aprendió de un amigo, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., una de sus ventajas es que en la zona no tiene competencia, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 6 años de edad. 
José utilizara el crédito para comprar llantas, neumáticos, pedales, rines, tubos, etc., y equipar con todo lo necesario su negocio, espera mejorar el servicio, aumentar la clientela y mejorar sus ingresos para cancelar con buen record su préstamo.
Aspira reunir los recursos necesarios para abrir otro establecimiento en una localidad cercana para mejorar sus utilidades, generar fuentes de empleo y dar a su familia un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
José is the administrator of a bike repair and parts shop. With this business he receives the income necessary to cover his family's needs. He has had the business for eleven years, having learned from a friend. His schedule is from 8:00am to 5:00pm. One of his advantages is that he has no competition in the area. He lives with his wife and six year old son. 

José will use the loan to buy tires, pneumatic tires, pedals, rims, tubes and other items to stock his business. He hopes to improve his service, increase his clientele and improve his earnings so that he can pay his loan on time. He hopes to gather the necessary resources to open an additional establishment in the area to improve his profits, generate a source of employment, and offer his family a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy tires, pneumatic tires, pedals, rims, and tubes.

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUDEGBE est constitué de trente personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Justine(celle qui a la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Justine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Augustin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Justine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison, Justine vend du riz dans sa région depuis douze ans environ. de façon secondaire, Justine vend aussi divers articles. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Justine et les membres du groupement JESUDEGBE sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer le niveau de leur activité afin de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The thirty members of the 'Jesudegbe' Group are all friends who live in the same neighbourhood.  Justine (with her hand raised in the photo) is the representative of the group.  She is 35 years old and has never attended school.  She is married to a mason called Augustin and the couple have three children, some of whom attend school.  Justine lives together with her husband and their children, and between them they provide for the expenses of their household.  In order to do this, Justine has been selling rice in her area for around twelve years.  She also sells various other items.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

This will be the second loan that Justine and the other members of the group have requested from the field partner, Alidé.  They will use their loans to strengthen their businesses and enable them to satisfy the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 33 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su familia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace varios años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, Reina solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
Reina is 33 years old and lives in a rental home with her family. She has a business where she has been selling sandwiches and hamburgers for many years. She has good customers because she sells her food at a good price. Her business is located close to her home, and her income helps her with her family's expenses.

Reina is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy all that is necessary to make her sandwiches and hamburgers, including bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadela and other ingredients. In this way she will be able to receive greater earnings and continue supporting her house with the expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and mortadela.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel has been a farmer for 11 years. He earns well from this and was able to repay his previous loan used for his farm successfully. He always finds ways to earn an income and to save the profit for future emergencies. To sustain his living, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He hopes to gain more profit this crop season for his future needs.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, a mother of two, owns and operates a beauty salon in her village. For  more than two years, Maricel has earned a good income from this business. She has been able to support her children's education and other household expenditures. Maricel borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy spa materials and beauty supplies. She wants to improve her services to gain more customers. In the near future, Maricel wants to expand her business and improve her entire family's general living situation.

loans.use: to buy spa materials and beauty supplies

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 5 femmes existe depuis le 7 octobre 2007. Les membres qui le composent habitent pour la plupart dans le même village. Elles font du commerce et de l'embouche.
Coumba debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et 3 filles.
Avec le prêt elle va faire de l'embouche bovine et du commerce. Elle compte acheter 1 bœuf à 200000f pour l'engraisser pendant 3 mois afin de le vendre à 265000f. Pour les besoins de la nourriture du bœuf, elle compte acheter 20000f d'aliment de bétail. Avec le reste de l'argent elle va faire de la vente de niébé.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à soutenir son mari dans la construction de leur maison et satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois', to which this group of five women belongs, has been in existence since October 7, 2007. The members composing it live for the most part in the same village. They work in commerce and raise livestock.

Coumba, who is standing at the right with her hand raised in the photo, is 52 years old, married, and the mother of three boys and three girls. With this loan, she is going to fatten cattle and do commerce. She intends to purchase a head of cattle at 200,000 francs to fatten for three months and then sell at 265,000 francs. To feed it, she intends to buy 20,000 francs of animal feed. With the rest of the money, she is going to sell black-eye peas.The profits will be used to support her husband in building their house and to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase black-eye peas and to raise livestock

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, 43 years old, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She has four children, three of whom attend school. Sarah is a businesswoman who has a pharmacy located in Busanga town council. She started her business in 2013, selling to people around Hoima. Sarah has hopes of having a fully stocked pharmacy, attracting more customers and increasing her income. She faces business challenges of bad debts and fluctuations in prices of medicines. Sarah wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Kumry

texts.en:
Kumry, who was born in 1966, is married and has 3 children. She is a smart and kind woman who always works for her family's well being. Kumry began her own business, selling children's clothes in her own place in a local market, 16 years ago. Kumry renews her assortment of goods every season. She is the main provider for her family. 

Kumry is going to repair her house but does not have enough savings to do so. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy construction materials, such as as cement, wood, soil, paint, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials, such as as cement, wood, soil, paint, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: emmanuel est homme agé 48 ans divorcé, père de 03 enfants scolarisés dont l'âge varie entre 02 et 11 ans. il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis trois ans. il fait dans la vente des vêtements sportifs , son activité fonctionne à merveille, il a juste un problème dû à la petitesse de son capital qui l'empêche de diversifier sa marchandise et l'oblige à acheter en petite quantité. il a besoin de ce crédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandise tout en la diversifiant. Ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel is 48 years old, divorced and the father of three children enrolled in school. He has been a shopkeeper in a market in the capital for three years. He sells sports clothing, and his business is going really well. His only problem is that his working capital is so small which prevents him from diversifying his merchandise and forces him to buy in small quantities. Emmanuel needs this loan to increase his inventory and, at the same time, diversify it. This will increase his sales as well as his profit margin. Part of his profit will be reinvested in his business to expand it and the rest will help him to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to grow his inventory and diversify it.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en:
Zulaykho wakes up early in the morning every day and goes to the field - she's been doing this for 10 years. She is the owner of two hectares of land.

Zulaykho is married and she is a careful mother of three children. Zulaykho grows cotton on a one hectare pot of land and vegetables on another hectare plot of land. She works hard. She sells her harvest in a local market. Zulaykho’s husband helps her with managing the business. 

She is going to sow more vegetables and cotton, but she doesn't have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and accessories

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Chaullay Centro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AZUCENAS DE CHAULLAY CENTRO” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la comunidad de Chaullay del distrito de Maranura de la provincia de La Convencion, Cusco, Peru. 

Cintia tiene 31 años y es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en la comunidad de Chaullay y donde realiza todas sus actividades personales y económicas. Sus actividades económicas  son la crianza de animales menores y la agricultura donde tiene plantaciones de café y cacao. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y gallinas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura,  a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to Asociación Arariwa's "Las Azucenas de Chaullay Centro" ["The Lilies of the Center of Chaullay"] communal bank, and live in the community of Chaullay, in Maranura district in the province of La Convención, Cusco, Peru. 

Cintia is 31 years old and is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman who is getting her family ahead in life. She lives in the community of Chaullay, and also conducts all of her personal and economic activities there. She works raising small animals and as a farmer, cultivating coffee and cacao. She needs this loan to buy fertilizer and hens. 

The other group members work in livestock rearing, farming, food sales, small animal raising, and also offer other professional services. They are grateful to those who are helping to fulfill this dream and are committed to repaying their loan installments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hens

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra, 54 years old,  is a very hardworking woman. She is a widow and has a child. Gulchehra began her animal husbandry business 11 years ago, after the death of her husband. She feeds cows and sells milk and milk products in a local market. Gulchehra is ill now. She must treat her illness but she doesn't have money to buy medicine. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 32-year-old widow with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells cocoa and secondhand clothes to the people around her town. She has been in business for seven years and is a hardworking woman charged with the responsibility of looking after her children. Harriet faces hardships of competition and limited capital to meet all her personal and business expectations. Harriet is acquiring a loan to buy secondhand clothes and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Dulce Amanecer Maranniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DULCE AMANECER MARANNIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Mery ella es conviviente y tiene 21 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva frutas y plátanos y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the "Dulce Amanecer Maranniyoc" communal bank. This group is located in Vilcabamba District, which belongs to La Convención Province in Cusco Department. 

One of the group members is Sra. Luz Mery, who is 21 years old and lives with her partner. She works raising and selling animals, and also has a plot of land where she cultivates bananas and other fruits. She raises guinea pigs and hens, which she fattens up and then sells at different markets. Through this small business she hopes to get ahead in life. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and hens, as well as food for the guinea pigs and hens.

The other group members work in agricultural sales, fruit sales, dry goods stores and food sales. 

Luz Mery is grateful to those who are helping to fulfill this dream and is committed to repaying her loan installments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens and food for guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Tavaraly

texts.en:
Tavaraly was born in 1971. He is married and has 3 children. Tavaraly is a careful and responsible father for his children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. He buys cattle, feeds them for some months and then sells them at a local market. Thanks to his good experience in this field, he has regular customers in the local market. 

Tavaraly is going to develop his business further. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cattle for increasing his working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Mafutaga

texts.en: Mafutaga is a 48-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has run a small plantation for many years.
