Mafutaga has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, backpack sprayer, chemicals, safety boots, taro roots, banana tube, water tank and hand cover to help her improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Mafutaga will use her profits to help with her family's everyday needs. She hopes to get a pick-up (vehicle) to help her with her business transportation needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, backpack sprayer, chemicals, safety boots, taro roots, banana tube, water tank, and hand cover.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, who used her previous loan to buy sugar, maize flour, soap and cooking oil to sell is a 31-year-old woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 
She still faces hardships of price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to buy stock.

However, she has a vision of hiring employees to help grow her business and of expanding her business to new markets. Sarah is requesting for a loan to buy sugar, juice, soap and cutlery to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, juice, soap and cutlery to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a hard-working farmer who lives and does farming in the rich highland of Kericho area of South rift Kenya.

She is married and has two children, all of school-going age. She has been farming for over three years, and she loves dairy farming the most. Her primary source of income is milk, eggs, and tea.

Joyce chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she heard that Juhudi works with farmers in providing them with asset finances. During the training, she learned how dairy farming can help promote her living standards. Through this loan, she will have more milk production to sell and get more income, which will help sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, 62 years old, is a hardworking mother who is engaged in a business selling vegetables within her community. She lives with one of her children in a rural community. Cecilia is aspiring to improve her business and make it profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she is seeking a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy more stock of watermelon, ginger, onions, garlic, squash, tomatoes and sweet potatoes to resell in the local community. She is hoping that, someday, she will be able to improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watermelon, ginger, onions, garlic, squash, tomatoes and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en: Gulsanam, 27 years old, is a widow with no children. She always wanted to start her own business. With this aim, she completed the ‘To Get Ahead’ course from a women's organization and learned business skills. Gulsanam is going to start a business selling food items in a local market. Her mother will help her with the business. Gulsanam will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy food items such as sugar, pasta, biscuits, etc. for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items such as sugar, pasta, biscuits, etc. for organizing her new business

loans.name: Benancio Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Benancio de 52 años de edad, actualmente  no tiene hijos  que depende de él, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de granos como maíz y tambien productos de la canasta basica.
Don Benancio tiene varios clientes que le compran la cosecha y también compra para revender.
Don Benancio tiene casa propia y desea en este año tener el apoyo de Prisma para cosechar más maíz.
Don Benancio está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de 09 cargas de maíz, está muy contento y su deseo es tener buena cosecha este año.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en: Señor Benancio is 52 years old and does not currently have any dependent children. For many years, he has worked selling basic grains like corn as well as other basic foodstuffs. Don Benancio has various clients who buy his harvest from him, and he also buys for resale. He has his own home and this year he hopes to have support from Prisma in order to grow more corn. He is requesting this loan to buy 9 loads of corn. He is very happy and hopes to have a good harvest this year.

loans.use: to buy corn for his business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped, not just in her business, but also in the education of her child. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a mobile phone loading station for additional income. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the loan in her electronic loading station. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses. Elsie looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elsie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her family a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Petra dreams that her family will always be in good health and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su madre, ambas realizan actividades diferentes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, desde que tenía siete años aprendió de su madre a elaborar diferentes antojitos, como papas fritas, elotes locos, tostadas, etc., por su experiencia no ha tenido dificultades en realizar esta actividad. 
El crédito que solicita es para comprar elotes, papas, aceite, platos, servilletas, entre otros materiales necesarios para mantenerse trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
Su sueño es independizarse, comprar un lote y luego construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her mother, and the two of them do various activities to cover their household expenses. When she was seven years old, her mother started teaching her to make different snacks, like french fries, elotes locos [a snack with cooked corn, cheese and a mayonnaise-based sauce] and tostadas. Thanks to her experience, she has not had any business difficulties.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn, potatoes, oil, plates and napkins, as well as other materials that are necessary to keep working and improve her income, which she will use to repay her loan installments. 

Her dream is to become independent, buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, oil, plates and napkins, among other things

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 19-year-old, single woman who lives with her three brothers and her twin sister.

She is a third-year university student, majoring in Business Administration. Since Rania has a sense of responsibility towards her family, she decided to get her bachelors' degree in order to find a job after graduation that suits her study field and to financially help her family.

Now, Rania is applying for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.en:
Kudratullo is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He began his own business in animal husbandry 10 years ago because he needed money. His wife helps him feed the cattle. 

Kudratullo requested a loan for 5,000 Somoni, which he will use to buy cattle for increasing working capital of his business. He hopes to develop his business further.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sound amplifier.

loans.name: Panvina

texts.ru: Во многих областях Таджикистана для населения основным видом деятельности является животноводство и растениеводства. Парвина хочет быть в их числе и решилась тоже активно заняться  животноводством. У Парвины были пару скотин полтора года назад. И она собирается на заемные деньги купить телят и бычков, и заново начать деятельность животноводства. Она верит, что ее бизнес получит успех и принесет хорошую прибыль. Для Парвины Ваша поддержка станет важной помощью. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: In many areas of Tajikistan raising livestock and growing producing are the main business activities. Parvina also would like to be a farmer. She decided to go into raising livestock. She used to have a few heads of cattle a year and a half ago. She plans to use her loan to buy calves and bulls and relaunch her livestock business. She trusts that her business will be successful and bring in a good profit. Your support will help Parvina in a major way. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy calves and launching her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une jeune femme de 35 ans et mère de 04 enfants.elle est propriétaire d'une boutique dans un marché de la place Depuis 7 ans.la petitesse de son capital ne lui permettant pas de gérer  la rupture de stock,elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de marchandise . elle pourrait grâce à ce crédit réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de diversifier et agrandir sa boutique. à long terme ,elle compte acquerir la boutique qu'elle loue actuellemen,en plus,elle aimerait participer aux charges financières de sa famille
texts.en: Bernadette is a young woman, 35 years old, and the mother of four. She has been the owner of a shop at the local market for seven years. Her meager capital prevents her from managing inventory shortages. She is requesting  a loan to increase her inventory of merchandise. She would be able, thanks to this loan, to make the profits enabling her to diversify and expand her shop in the long term. She plans on acquiring the shop, which she currently leases. In addition, she would like to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on plastic wares and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Kolovina

texts.en:
Kolovina is 17-years-old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Kolovina has been working hard to manage her brewing business, which brews local beer. 

To help expand her business, Kolovina has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for brewing, and will help Kolovina to generate greater profits and pay her family's medical bills. Kolovina hopes that in the future she will be able to open a bar and restaurant. 

Kolovina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more materials for brewing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Adelaida aims to improve her hog-raising business to help her husband in financing the education of their two children and sustain their daily necessities. She plans to acquire additional piglets to raise, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Being a kind and hard-working mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus used his previous loan to buy fertilizers and mulch for his banana plantation. He is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. Titus' personal goal is to complete building his permanent house. He has been a farmer for the past eight years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. Titus has a vision of buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding it to new markets. Titus needs a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad, 20 years old, lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his family, which consists of eight members. Hamad is now a second year university student majoring in education. He noticed his family struggling financially during this period so he has applied for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees in order to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Muath

texts.en: Muath, 23 years old, lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his family, which consists of seven members. Muath is now a university student majoring in business administration. He is in his fourth year and is only one step away from graduation. He noticed his family struggling financially during this period so he has applied for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees in order to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo, who was born in 1976, is a hardworking woman from north Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children, two of them non-adults. Dilrabo has been busy growing grapes for more than 10 years. She also has an animal husbandry business. Dilrabo works hard on her land to get a good harvest and to make profit to improve the family's living conditions. Her husband helps her to manage the business. Dilrabo is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for her grapes

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en: Mashhura is a repeat client of IMON. She is a very smart and hardworking woman with a good credit history. Mashhura is a widow and has a child. She began her own business selling women's clothing 6 years ago. She sells in a local market where she has her own place. Mashhura renews her assortment of goods every season. In this way, she attracts customers. Mashhura is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy women's clothes for the new spring season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new spring season

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 47-year-old woman from Duero, Bohol. She is engaged in a vegetable farming business, growing various crops in her field. This is the source of her income.

Emma is asking for a loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow more and improve the productivity of her farm. 

In the future, Emma hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Lấn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lấn has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to purchase waste materials to resell (to factories that can reproduce).

Lấn is 54 years old, is married, and has 3 children.
Lấn is the group leader of the 3.1.1002.8.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2013, Lấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lấn has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lấn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase waste materials to resell (to factories that can reproduce).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase jewelry and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase jewelry and shoes to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 46 years old, married and has children. She is a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She and her husband are managing their household while operating a business. She is working hard to sustain their financial expenses.

Zenaida is a coconut dealer. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing wooden carts. The coconuts are served either with one end cut and just with a straw to serve as the container itself. Coconuts can be offered where the juice and the edible part of the coconut are put into a plastic with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. They earn a minimum of 600 PHP a day.

To help continue operations of her business, Zenaida is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use loan to buy more coconuts to be supplied to her customers. She hopes to expand her business and dreams of becoming rich. 

Zenaida meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 27-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is an education assistant, although she is also a farmer, whereby she earns a living. She started this business to improve her standards of living. She faces a hardship due to the delay in the payment of her salary by the ministry of education and that's why she is opting for self-employment.

Lilian is requesting a loan to construct a house and start a business.

loans.use: to construct a house and start a business.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Thaer is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat with his family, which consists of six members. Thaer is now a university student majoring in Computer and Information Systems. He is in his second year. He noticed his family struggling financially during this period so he has applied for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees in order to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Maha was born in 1961. She is a widow living in a rented house with her 2 daughters. She has been trying her best to support her daughters and to provide them with the best education. One of her daughters is a university student majoring in Media. She is in her fourth year and is only one step away from graduation. But Maha doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
A 33-year-old mother of two children, Sokly resides in a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Chheung Prey district, Cambodia. She and her husband have been raising pigs and working for others for a fee. Together, they earn about KHR 59,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 daily for future needs.  

This is Sokly's second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise. Sokly hopes to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Zahra** Group

texts.en:
Zahra** is a group that consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Dalal is the leader of the group and she is a 26-year-old married woman that lives with her spouse in their own house. She studied up to Secondary school, but she didn't complete her studies because she got married. Dalal is a housewife, and her husband is an employee In the public sector in Sana'a. He receives a good salary, but it is not enough to buy furniture for the house. Dalal asked her husband to buy some furniture, but he told her that he can't afford that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to equip the house with some furniture. She looks forward to see her house equipped with all home appliances. She has a high ambition to provide her family with a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy some house furniture

loans.name: Panales No 2 Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Panales No2 está conformado por ocho integrantes madres solteras con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de salir adelante, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.  

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María y  tiene por actividad económica la  venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, short, faldas, blusas, vestidos, piyamas, ropa interior, el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante, y en su casa de habitación. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Los Panales agradece No2 agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Panales No 2" communal bank is composed of 8 members who are single mothers with 15 children under their care. They are natives of El Sauce in the north of the region. They are hard-working, responsible and want to get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources they could not study and had to go to work at a very young age. Today they work from day to day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead María is the coordinator. Her business is selling new clothing such as  pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, dresses, pyjamas and underwear. She does this door-to-door and from her house. Unfortunately due to a lack of resources she could not study and had to go to work at a very young age. The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in buying and selling merchandise so that in the near future she can generate more revenue. The "Panales No 2" communal bank is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who support people of low economic resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy products like pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, dresses, pyjamas and underwear.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Raquel es propietaria de un taxi que maneja su esposo, quien recibe una pensión de jubilación, siendo este medio de ingresos para su familia que ayuda para la manutención del hogar y el colegio de sus 3 hijos. Raquel solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar otro cuarto para el menor de sus hijos, así cada uno disfruta de su propio espacio y comodidad en su propia habitación.
texts.en:
Raquel owns a taxi that her husband drives.  He also receives a retirement pension.  This source of income helps to maintain their household and pay for their three children's education.  

Raquel is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to build another room for her youngest child, so that each one can have their own space and comfort in their own room.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, iron, a door, windows, and paint.

loans.name: Notholia

texts.en: Greetings from Bulawayo, the second largest city in Zimbabwe. Notholia is a 36-year-old widow with two children, one of whom attends school. She runs a retail shop selling clothes and shoes for all ages. The business has been in operation for 10 years now. The main challenges Notholia faces are the high rentals charged for shop space. She has requested a $500 loan. She says the income generated as a result of the loan will help her improve the general welfare of her family and educate her children. Notholia plans on opening her own boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anzhik

texts.en:
Anzhik lives in Noravan village with her husband. Their son is a constructor working in nearby country. 

Anzhik and her husband cultivate cabbage, tomato and greens and sell the gathered harvest in open market. 

They take care of their farm with great love and pleasure. By applying for this loan Anzhik would like to ask for financial support to purchase 8 oxen. This will let her get involved in cattle breeding as well and increase agricultural income. She hopes that lenders will support her idea to enlarge the farming business.

loans.use: to buy eight oxen

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Meet 29 year old Norah, a farmer living in the Kericho area of South rift Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children all of school going age. She has been farming for the past 5 years she enjoys dairy and banana farming the most, but her primary source of income is milk, eggs, tea, and green vegetables. Her biggest challenge is lack of capital.

Norah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they provide good training to farmers and provide asset financing. During the training, she learnt how to repay her loan on time. This loan will enable her grow in agri-business and thus be able to cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy items necessary for her dairy business

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno was born in 1983. She is a hardworking woman from the North part of Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Barno began her own business of selling perfumes, barrettes, and cosmetics 2 months ago. Barno sells her products in a local market. She has a lot of customers. Barno is the main provider of her family as her husband is a farmer and has a small income. Barno needs to increase the working capital of her business, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cosmetics, perfumes, etc., to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, etc., for increasing working capital of her new business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Thy is 34-years-old and married with four children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about KHR 54,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 30,000 each day for future needs. 

Thy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now, she is requesting a loan of KHR 3,500,000.  She wants to use it to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice to earn more income to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Francis Asuncion

texts.es: francis de 40 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y responsable que siempre esta en la mira de darle a su familia un mejor bienestar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, desde hace varios años que se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en: Francis, 40, is a very hard-working, honest, responsible man who is always looking for a way to give his family the best he can.  He lives in his own house with his wife and children.  For several years he has been working in the production and sale of dairy products in the area where he lives.  He has many good customers because he has known how to gain their confidence.  He offers quality products at low prices, and has decided to invest in raising livestock since his business depends on it.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy vitamins for the livestock and a new dairy cow to expand his business.  He hopes to obtain favorable results and continue giving his household the economic support it needs so badly.

loans.use: To buy vitamins for livestock and a new cow.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, le Bois, Légumes, Charbons, Gombo, Tissus  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Chata est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la  gauche, qui est vendeuse de légumes et de tubercules (pomme de terre, patate et igname). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  sacs de pomme de terre et igname à Sikasso. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Chata compte réaliser  100 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, their children and some relatives. They average 43 years of age and five children each. They sell various goods such as wood, vegetables, charcoal, okra, fabrics, etc. 

To expand their activities, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is their 2nd group loan cycle. 

Chata is the group member standing 2nd from the right in the photo. She sells various vegetables and tubers (potatoes and yams). She plans to use her loan to buy sacks of potatoes and yams in Sikasso. She sells her merchandise to a diverse clientele at the market and from her home.

The other group members expect to earn an average of 90,000FCFA each for this cycle. For her part, Chata expects to earn 100,000FCFA. In addition to repaying her loan, she will use part of her revenue to cover personal expenses and to bolster her working capital. 

The group hope to solidify their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: to buy tubers for resale.

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es: Maximo Antonio, mayor de edad casado padre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originario de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajor, con muchos deseos de superacion personal,Maximo es un microempresario que se dedica a la comercializacion de madera(eucalitpto) y leña seca negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, saca la madera con permiso legal, aduanas de este negocio, al igual se dedica tambien al destace y comercializacion de los derivados del cerdo como: frito, pepena, nacatamales, morongas, entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado, inicia este negocio con fondos propios productos de sacrificio y ahorros, como un medio digno de trabajo para obtener ingresos en su hogar, negocio que tiene mas de 38 años, uno de sus sueños es realizarse ciertas mejoras a su vivienda y el de crecer mas en su negocio, el objetivo de este credito es para incrementar su inventario en la compra madera y cerdo en pie para cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes  y de esa manera tener un poco mas de ingresos.-
texts.en: Maximo Antonio is an elderly married man with five adult children.  He is from a northern Chinandega town located in the western part of the country, and he is known for being a hardworking man with many desires to get ahead personally and professionally.  He is a small businessman who sells lumber (eucalyptus) and seasoned firewood out of his home.  He has a permit to harvest the logs and also butchers and sells pork such as cracklings, nacatamales, blood sausage and other things.  He makes his purchases in cash and started this business with the money he had saved up while working honestly to earn money for his household.  The has had this business for more than 38 years and one of his dreams is to make improvements to his house and to grow his business.  He will use the money from this loan to increase his inventory of firewood and pigs on the hoof to cover some of his customer requests.  This way he will have a bit more income.

loans.use: to buy firewood and pigs.

loans.name: Ndiolle's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 6 femmes existe depuis le 7 octobre 2007. Les membres qui le composent habitent pour la plupart dans le même village. Elles font du commerce et de l'embouche.
Dieynaba debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 4 moutons à raison de 50000f l'un. La durée de l'engraissement est prévue pour 6 mois. Ainsi pour bien nourrir les sujets, elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail pour une valeur de 75000f. Elle compte avoir un bon prix à la vente, 130000f pour chacun. L'écoulement se fait en général dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la localité.
Elle envisage avec les bénéfices de construire un magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' to which this group of six women belong has been in existence since 2007. The members composing it live for the most part in the same village. They do commerce and raise livestock. 

Dieynaba, who is standing at the right with her hand raised in the photo, is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including two girls. With this loan, she is going to purchase 4 head of sheep at 50,000 francs each. Fattening them will take six months. So, to feed the animals, she will purchase 75,000 francs worth of feed. She is planning on a good price upon selling the sheep at 130,000 francs each. Sales are general made at the weekly markets in her town. With the profits, she envisions building a store or warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase 4 head of sheep

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different products, such as dust pans, hangers, basins, pails, pitchers, glassware, laundry baskets, trays and other products needed in her store. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy different products, such as dust pans, hangers, basins, pails, pitchers, glassware, laundry baskets, trays and other products needed in her store. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susana dreams to be more successful with her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products needed in her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of nine children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a vegetable farming business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. Letecia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer . With this, she will be able to increase and improve the productivity of her farm.

Letecia wants to expand her farming business in the future and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Saidait

texts.en: Saidati is a fifty year married woman with ten children living in Bundibugyo Uganda.  She has a cocoa, rice, and beans garden. She's very hard working and plans to build a residential permanent house and buy land for her children in the future.  She wants a loan to increase her produce inventory, in order to generate more income and improve the standard of living for her home.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, and cocoa

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Nawal is a widow living in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her 6 children. One of her sons is a Diploma student majoring in Medical Machines. He is in his first year which is the beginning of his study journey. Nawal is trying her best to provide her children with the best education, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees because of the financial crisis she has been facing during this period. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products that help her to improve her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendulam is a 40-year-old widow who lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. She has been running a tailoring workshop for seven years. She is requesting a loan of 1700 USD to buy textiles in large amounts as orders for traditional clothes increase during this period. Her business sales turnover is increasing each year and she is thinking about hiring additional people. She says it is all thanks to benevolent and generous people who gave her an opportunity to work at her fullest. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy textiles in large amounts

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Gantugs, 36 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as stonemason for the Mongolian Stonemason's Association since 2000. His wife has profession of nurse and works at rehabilitation center. Their elder two children go to high school while the youngest one stays at home. 

Mr. Gantugs is requesting a loan of 2,275 USD to buy vacuum-insulated windows for better protection against outside noise and dust. By installing those windows, his family will live in clean environment without any dust. As spring comes to Mongolia, dust becomes a major issue in slum district because there is no cemented road or any grass growing. His youngest child has developed an allergy to dust and the other children are becoming allergic to dust. So the borrower wants to install vacuum-insulated windows as the dust is coming in with the wind through the present windows.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde, sus productos los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, El cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: He is 24 years old and lives in a home of his own with his life partner and son.  He grows corn and sorghum and also raises livestock.  He sells his products in the different markets near his home and is able to pay his household expenses with his earnings.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, compost, etc.  This way he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia vive con su familia, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y jocotes, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Samuel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.para continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a u familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Samuel is 47 years old and lives with his family in his own home.  He raises corn, beans, and cauliflower and sells his products in different markets near his home.  He is able to pay his household expenses with his earnings.  Samuel is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer, compost, insecticides, etc. so he can continue raising his crops and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian tiene 54 años de edad y  habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña tienda que ha logrado establecer en su hogar de habitación. Mirian desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales dado que los materiales del techo de su vivienda y de su cocina se encuentran deteriorados y desea invertir en la mejora de los mismos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y polines para reconstruir la cocina y para reparar el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Mirian 54 years old and lives in her own home with her four children.  She earns a living by selling personal products in her small store that she was able to set up in her home.  Mirian wants to make improvements to her home because the roof over her house and her kitchen have deteriorated and she wants to improve them.  She is asking for this loan to buy galvanized metal, lumber, and girders to rebuild the kitchen and repair the roof.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a farmer from Duero, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Rosalinda earns a living through her farming business. She grows various vegetables like onions, eggplants and others. This is the source of her income.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to improve her harvest and her yield. Rosalinda wants to expand her farming business in the future, thus, generating more revenue necessary for the needs of her family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is a responsible housewife who supports her husband with gaining income. They aim to become successful and financially stable in order to give their children a bright future. To achieve their goal, Rose Marie aims to improve her small variety store to earn a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she is seeking an additional PHP 16,000 to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oils, soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, canned goods, seasonings and beverages to sell. She hopes that someday, they will be able to improve their living status.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oils, soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, canned goods, seasonings and beverages to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has three children. She is a farmer in the rich highlands of Kericho, which she has been doing for nine years. Her main source of income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea, and green vegetables, but what she enjoys doing most is poultry farming. Her biggest challenges are the lack of good markets and expensive animal feeds.

Florence chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it finances products that are beneficial to farmers. Juhudi Kilimo offers good training before loans are give out. This loan will boost Florence's farming and give her family food security.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a farmer from Duero, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children. Eugenia is engaged in a vegetable farming business, together with her husband. She also sells her harvest to the market.

Eugenia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Eugenia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, es reconocida por su honradez y por ser emprendedora, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, así como también al destazo de los mismos, lo realiza desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió de sus padres, su ventaja es que lo realiza en su residencia y con ayuda de sus hijos. Rosa es casada, tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 10 años de edad.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una vaquilla y dos cerdos para destazarlos, ya que al efectuar una sola compra podrá ahorrar y aumentar sus ganancias, espera fortalecer su negocio y cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
Anhela a tener un negocio bien establecido para mejorar su economía y darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, pero sobre todo ofrecer a sus hijos las herramientas para que puedan superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa is well known for her honesty and enterprising skills.  She raises livestock and pigs and also runs a butcher business. She learned the trade from her parents and has been in business for ten years.  The advantage is that she works at home with the help of her children.  Rosa is married and has three children, ages 16, 12 and 10.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a cow and two pigs for her business.  By making only one purchase she will be able to save and increase her earnings.  She hopes to strengthen her business and pay back her loan on time.  She wants to have a well-established business to improve her economy and give her family a better lifestyle.  Most of all she wants to give her children the tools they need to excel in their education.

loans.use: To buy a cow and two pigs for her butcher business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, es madre de tres jóvenes de 18, 15 y 14 años de edad, es una persona que comparte la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades de su familia con su esposo, se dedica a cultivar maíz y pipián, es algo que aprendió junto a su esposo, sus labores las inicia de 5:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.
Solicita el crédito para  invertirlo en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, puesto que se está preparando para su próxima siembra y necesita preparar el terreno, espera mejorar la producción, protegerla de plagas y sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión.
Su sueño es mejor su vivienda y comprar un lote para aumentar el área de cultivo.
texts.en:
Teresa has three children who are ages eighteen, fifteen, and fourteen. She and her husband share the responsibility of meeting their family's needs. She works growing corn and squash, which she learned how to do alongside her husband. She works from 5:00 am to 12:00 pm.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides, because she is getting ready for the next sowing and needs to prepare the land. She expects to improve production, protect the crops from pests, and make the most of her investment.

Her dream is to improve her home and buy a lot in order to expand their farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-nine-year old hardworking married man, and father of four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a head-teacher and that's where he earns a living, though he also owns a motorcycle that works as a boda boda as his side income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He faces a challenge of low and delayed salary payment. He has hopes of being self employed and starting up a business for his wife in the future to come.

Moses is requesting for a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María es madre soltera de un hijo de 19 años de edad, por quien ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlo adelante.
A sus 49 años de edad, se gana la vida trabajando como independiente, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros, oficio que tiene hace varios años y que hasta el momento le ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia; cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleadas que le colaboran por temporadas y trabaja desde las primeras horas del día.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina de doble aguja, con la que podrá optimizar el tiempo de producción y mejorar la eficiencia, entregando de manera oportuna los pedidos a sus clientes, esto dará como resultado un incremento notable en los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener una casa propia, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente para que su negocio prospere y le garantice una estabilidad económica que le permita dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria is the single mother of a 19 year old son for whom she was worked tirelessly to get ahead.  

At 49years old, she earns a living working on her own making clothing for other people.  She has been doing this for several years and has been able to earn enough resources to cover the family expenses.  She has two employees who help her seasonally and she begins working at the beginning of each day.

She is asking for this loan to buy a double stitch sewing machine so she can maximize her productivity and efficiency for her customers.  This will provide a noticeable increase in her income.

Maria says that her greatest goal is to have a home of her own and continues to work arduously so that her business will prosper and she can guarantee herself financial stability and a better quality of live and university education for her son.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Sokny is 27 years old, married, and has one daughter, who is still small. For the last several years, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn about 22,000 KHR per day and can save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Sokny has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely paid back the loan, which has enabled her to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan. She is going to use the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully, sell it for a good price, and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar was born in 1969. She is a hardworking woman. She is married and has a daughter who is 22 years old. Dilbar has been occupied with sewing for more than 20 years. She sews women’s national dresses. Dilbar taught her daughter to sew dresses, and now, her daughter helps her with the sewing. Dilbar works hard but still has a small income which is not enough for living. She is going to organize an additional business of animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle for the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a new business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 21 años y 17 años de edad. Santos trabaja como jornalero desde hace más de 25 años. Santos es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia. ÉL desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el cambio del techo de su hogar y para la construcción de un cuarto para sus hijas. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. De esta forma desea dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Santos is 50 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and two daughters, ages 21 and 17.  Santos has been working as a laborer for more than 25 years and is a hardworking man, dedicated to his family.  He wants to improve the conditions of his home and is asking for this loan through FUSAI so he can fix his roof and build a room for his daughters.  He will use the money to buy galvanized metal, lumber, and nails.  This way he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his roof and build a room for his daughters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes son mayores de edad trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, doña Ana desde hace 9 años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra golosinas, granos básicos, pan dulce, productos para la limpieza, azúcar, sal, queso, etc. por mayor para poder surtir aun mas su tienda y atender mejor a sus clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 51 years old, lives in her own home with her two adult children, who work and help her with household expenses. For the past nine years, Ana has owned a small store located in her home. She has a large customer base because she sells a great variety of products.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy wholesale sweets, basic grains, pastries, sugar, salt, cheese, cleaning products, etc. to stock her store even better and serve her customers better so that she can obtain higher profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweets, basic grains, pastries, sugar, salt, cheese, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un poco más de capital para invertirlo en la compra de hierro y carbón por mayor para continuar produciendo los machetes, con esto se mantendrá generando los recursos económicos que necesita para cubrir los gasto familiares.
El préstamo anterior adquirió una materia prima que le facilito aumentar la producción de su negocio, tener ganancias mayores las cuales ha utilizado para cancelar sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Francisco saw the need to request a little more capital to buy iron and charcoal in quantity, so that he can continue making machetes.  This way he will continue to generate the income he needs to cover his family expenses. 

He used the previous loan to buy supplies so he could increase his production, have a greater income, pay off his debts, and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron and charcoal.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a 72-year-old married man with eleven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He practices farming for his earnings, along with his monthly pension.  He sells cocoa from his garden, which helps him to cater to his family's basic needs.  His challenges are the unpredictable weather changes and competition since most people in his area are cocoa farmers.  Edson intends to use the loan to complete his residential house, which is his dream.

loans.use: to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik lives in Qarakert village with her daughter. Her husband is a migrant worker at a neighboring country. Shushik runs a farm. She owns 3 piglets, calves, and a plot of land where cucumbers and tomatoes are cultivated. Shushik works hard to gather a good harvest, as the money that her husband sends is not enough for covering even daily costs. 

By applying for this loan, Shushik now asks financial support to be able to purchase 2 oxen and fertilizer for her farm. This will be a huge support for the farm that Shushik runs, therefore she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase 2 oxen, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sandra Argentina

texts.es: Doña Sandra es originaria de Diriamba, pero actualmente vivi en Managua, casada y madre de cuatro hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado incrementar su inventario y obtener mejores ganancias. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cosméticos, Perfumes, Cremas y Pinturas de labio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mayores ingresos para sustentar sus gastos.
texts.en: Sandra is from Diriamba but now lives in Managua.  She is married, and is mother of four adult children on their own.  She is a merchant and sells cosmetics.  [Sandra] is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because she has been able to increase her inventory and obtain better earnings.  She is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and lipstick.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help to her and she will be able to obtain better income with which to pay her expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Noe Esau

texts.es:
Noé, posee un taller mecánico y venta de llantas, lo aprendió junto a un amigo, hoy es la fuente de ingresos que tienen para salir adelante con sus compromisos económicos, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., lo respaldan cuatro años de experiencia. Noé está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de un pedido de llantas, que necesita para surtir el inventario de su negocio, con ello tendrá clientes satisfechos y sus ingresos serán mejores, los que le servirán para cancelar sus cuotas.
Su visión es tener un negocio más estable que le continúe dando los recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades tanto del negocio como de su familia.
texts.en: Noé owns an auto repair shop and sells tires. He learned this with a friend. Nowadays it is the source of income they have to move ahead with their financial obligations. His schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. He counts with four years of experience. Noe lives with a live in partner and has a 3 year old son. For now he does not have problems with his business. He is requesting a loan to invest in an order of tires, which he needs to stock up on the inventory for his business. With this he will have satisfied customers and his earnings will improve, which will serve to make his loan payments. His vision is to have a more stable business that keeps on giving the financial resources to cover the needs of his business as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to pay an order of tires

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old widow residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sokhorn has two children to take care of and earns a living through working as a construction worker. Having been in this business for 13 years, she can earn about 13,000 KHR per day to make a living and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Sokhorn’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy construction supplies to support her business. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay laborers.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
El señor José Orlando de 57  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo  que depende de él, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio a la reparación de vehículos automotores, tiene más de 40 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Don José Orlando tiene un taller en el cual repara motores, culatas, cambios de aceite, regulación de frenos, y más.
Don José Orlando está solicitando el préstamo para mejora de vivienda ya que desea construir una pequeña casa para su hijo menor, el quiere comprar piedra, tierra y adobes, es su tercer préstamo que solicita a Prisma, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con la institución.
Don José Orlando su sueño es construirle la casa a su hijo.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
José Orlando is 57 years old and has one son who depends on him. José has been making a living repairing vehicles for over 40 years.

José has a workshop where he repairs engines, cylinder heads, and he changes oil and does brake checks and more.

José is applying for this loan in order to make improvements to his home: he wants to build as small house for his youngest son. José wants to to buy stones, earth and bricks. This is José's third loan from "Prisma" and he is very happy to continue working with the organisation.

José's dream is to build his son a home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; February 2014

loans.use: to buy stones, earth and bricks for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic compost and tools.

loans.name: Heidy Damissela

texts.es:
La señora Heidy de 26 años de edad,  tiene  un hijo  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de golosinas.
Doña Heidy en su negocio vende tacos, enchiladas, jugos, pastelitos, tamales, etc. su venta es de forma ambulante y tiene casa propia, vive con sus hijo y su esposa, es una joven trabajadora que el ayuda a su esposo para que salgan adelante.
Doña Heidy está solicitando el préstamo para comprar la materia prima como frijoles, tortillas, plátanos, repollo, lechugas, etc. que se usa para elaborar las golosinas es su segundo préstamo que solicita a Prisma y está muy contenta por el apoyo a su negocio. 
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Heidy is 26 years old and has a son who depends on her. For a number of years Heidy has made a living selling snacks.

At her business, Heidy sells tacos, enchiladas, juices, cakes, tamales and more. She is a street vendor. Heidy owns her own home and lives with her son and husband. Heidy is a hard-working young woman. She is helping her husband so that the family can prosper.

Heidy is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as beans, tortillas, plantains, cabbage, lettuce and more. She will use these items to prepare her snacks. This is Heidy's second loan from "Prisma" and she is very happy to have support for her business.

Heidy's dream is to have a good business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; February 2014

loans.use: to buy beans, tortillas, plantains, cabbage, lettuce and more for her business.

loans.name: Gerber Emmanuel

texts.es:
Gerber, como una forma de cubrir sus gastos personales inicio vendiendo medicina natural, en vista que el negocio le daba buenos resultados luego para ofrecer otro tipo de productos y atraer más clientes incorporo la venta de ropa lo que facilita tener ganancias extras, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.. Es soltero, no tiene hijos, nadie depende económicamente de él.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, vitaminas, reconstituyentes, etc., ya que si tiene debidamente surtido el inventario sus clientes podrán encontrar lo que buscan, sus ventas serán mejores y tendrá ingresos extras con los que cancelara la deuda adquirida.
Aspira a mantenerse trabajando y fortaleciendo el negocio con el propósito de contar con los recursos económicos para comprar una motocicleta.
texts.en:
In order to cover personal expenses, Gerber started selling natural medicines. When he saw that the business had good results, he later decided to offer other types of products in order to attract more customers: Gerber started selling clothes, giving him extra profits. He works from 7am until 4pm. Gerber is single and has no children. Nobody depends on Gerber financially.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, dresses, blouses, trousers, vitamins, tonics and more. If Gerber has his business well-stocked, customers will find what they are looking for, sales will be better and Gerber will have the income to pay off his debt.

Gerber aspires to continue working and strengthening his business so that he can earn enough money to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dresses, blouses, trousers, vitamins, tonics and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cements, sand and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for her coffee crop and new seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the liquefied Petroleum Gas package to enable the family have full courses of daily meals

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru:
Бахри 54 года. Она жительница города Душанбе. Она живет в западной части города. Каждый день, рано утром Бахри ездит на рынок, на свою торговую точку. Она более 20 лет занимается торговлей яиц. На рынке Бахри продает домашние яйца, перепелиные яйца и фабричные яйца. В торговле Бахри помогает её дочь. Бахри вдова. У нее четверо дочерей. Трое из них живут отдельно. Только ее младшая дочь живет с ней. Она учится в средней школе. Бахри за счет своей деятельности выдала троих дочерей замуж. Сейчас у нее нет средств для расширения деятельности. 
Бахри берет кредит для приобретения домашних яиц. Также она намерена приобрести в аренду торговую точку.
texts.en:
Bahri is 54 years old. She is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She lives in the Western part of the city. Everyday, early in the morning, Bahri goes to her selling space at the market. She has been selling eggs for more than 20 years. At the market, Bahri sells household eggs, quail eggs and factory-supplied eggs. Bahri's daughter helps her with her sales. Bahri is a widow. She has four daughters, three of whom live on their own. Only her youngest daughter lives with her. She attends secondary school. Thanks to her business, Bahri was able to provide weddings for her three daughters. Now she does not have the funds to expand her business.

Bahri is requesting a loan to buy household eggs. She is also determined to rent a selling space.

loans.use: to buy eggs and rent a selling space.

loans.name: Fetah

texts.en:
Fetah has been photographed with his cat, who he adores dearly.  In the background, the rundown building you see, it’s his so called ‘house’. He has been living on his own for a very long time, since after his divorce. His neighbor, who considers him a father figure, has been taking care of him cleaning up his place, cooking and doing the laundry for him, all at no expense. Fetah has been working as a loader forever, even today at his age. Here is what he said to the loan officer when he took the photograph of him: “By petting my cat, all my exhaustion goes way. I love her; I share my food with her. She sleeps right by my foot bed and waits at the porch for me to return home.”

Fetah wants to repair the ceiling of his house because the conditions where he and his cat live are very unhealthy. In addition, he wants to buy a washer to release his neighbor from this chore, according to him.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling of his home and buy a washing machine

loans.name: Aimeerim

texts.ru: Аймээрим 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Аймээрим - средне-специальное образование, окончила медицинское училище, по специальности -медсестра. Трудовую деятельность начала в местной больнице, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Аймээрим очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Аймээрим занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аймээрим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -картофель и эспарцет. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аймээрим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Аймээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aimeerim is 27 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Aimeerim has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a medical college and has a nursing degree. Her professional career began in a local hospital, then she got married but continued to work there. Aimeerim is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Aimeerim and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aimeerim's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 horse, and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She also cultivates a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows potatoes and sainfoin. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Aimeerim turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Aimeerim plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en: Sanjar is young and purposeful man. He is 29 years old. Sanjar is married and has 2 children. His children are non-adults. He began his business deal with animal husbandry 4 years ago because he needed to make money. Sanjar’s business is the only source of income for his family as his wife is housewife and she has been busy with raising the children. Sanjar must organize a circumcision ceremony for his son but he has not the money. He is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to organize the circumcision ceremony for his son. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a circumcision ceremony for his son

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a thirty year old farmer married with five children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She sells the cocoa from her garden to the people around her area. She is a hard working lady faced only with the challenges of seasonality in cocoa growing and production. She wishes to buy enough land for cocoa growing so that she can harvest on a large scale for higher profits. Oliver needs the loan to buy more cocoa for selling to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling to her customers

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Touch is aged 61 years with five children. She and her husband earn a living through growing corn. Having been in this business for 43 years she manages to earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is group loan for Touch’s group of three who are female. She has already been on one cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Touch is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Sarita Colonia” conformada por 07 socios activos y emprendedores que buscan sobresalir cada día.  Katherine de 19 años es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bisutería. Siendo sus mayores clientes familiares y vecinos de la zona. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de pulseras, collares y accesorios para hacer manicure. Estudiar administración de empresas es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Sarita Colonia” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Katherine se encuentra sentada, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste bivirí azul.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sarita Colonia comprises seven active and enterprising members who are driven to excel every day. Katherine is nineteen and is a single mother of one child. She works selling costume jewelry. Local relatives and neighbors are her best customers. She will use this loan to purchase bracelets, necklaces, and manicure accessories. Her biggest wish is to earn a Business Administration degree. 

The group Sarita Colonia is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible and promises to keep working well. Katherine is the second person from the left in the picture, wearing a blue tank top.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, necklaces, and manicure accessories.

loans.name: Oftogay

texts.en: Oftogay was born in 1959. She is widowed. Oftogay has raised 2 children. She is a seamstress . She sews national women's clothes. She is the only income earner after the death of her husband. Oftogay hardly manages with family expense. Her son wants to help her, but he cannot get a job in Tajikistan. He is going to go to Russia to find a job. Oftogay is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy an airline ticket for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her son

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan was born in 1969. She is married and lives with her husband and her six children in a sector of Jordan called wihdat. She has been trying her best to support her husband to improve their living conditions by running her business of selling clothes at her house for the past five years. Now she needs to expand it by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes to resell

loans.name: Sayrabubu

texts.ru: Сайрабубу, 47 лет, вдова, имеет 3 детей. После смерти супруга, а он был кормильцем семьи, Сайрабубу в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву женских платьев, сюртуков, юбок, пальто с 1991 года, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Сайрабубу с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайрабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом- на покупку  материалов для производства и шитья женских платьев, сюртуков, юбок, пальто. На доходы от кредита Сайрабубу хочет увеличить товарооборот и купить земельный участок для строительства жилого дома.
texts.en: Sayrabubu is 47 years old, a widow, and has three children. After the death of her husband, who was the main provider for the family,  Sayrabubu was in search of a source of income for her family. She began a small business sewing women's dresses, frock-coats, skirts and coats. She started this business in 1991 with initial start-up capital in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). It is a good business, but more importantly, Sayrabubu enjoys doing it. It brings in an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Sayrabubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making and sewing women's dresses, frock-coats, skirts and coats. Sayrabubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase sales turnover. She also intends to save money to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing women's clothing.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.
