She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1969. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called southern Ghour. Alia has been supporting her husband and 6 children financially by running her business of selling clothes and accessories for five years. She started it with a small quantity of clothes. Then she added variety and new collections to them. Now she needs to expand her business by adding a new collection of women's clothes for the upcoming season to raise her profits. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rey is 47 years old and married. She has two dependent children. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 12 years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR 33,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 10,000 per day for the future needs.
This is the first loan for Rey with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader Rey is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
Guliston is 43 years old, divorced, and has three children. She lives in a small village in north Tajikistan. Guliston is only income provider of her family. The only source of income is from animal husbandry. She feeds milking cows and sells milk at local markets. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

Guliston wants to develop a business but does not have enough money to buy more cattle. She requested a loan, which she will use to purchase additional cattle. She will use the profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Joni

texts.en:
Joni runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Joni lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Joni is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Joni began working with Ruma two years ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, he has around $190 – 191 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melinda aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгул энергичная, общительная и позитивная женщина в возрасте 50 лет, проживающая в селе района Кубадиён. В течение двух лет она занята в сфере торговли. Норгул имеет продуктовый магазин. Вся ее семья -  дети и муж помогают ей в торговле. Одновременно она еще и занимается куплей и перепродажей миндаля. Сейчас она хочет расширить торговую деятельность. Она собирается закупить новую партию миндаля и для этой цели ей нужна финансовая поддержка. Поэтому Норгул обратилась за кредитом. Она стремится увеличить бюджет семьи и улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en: Norgul is an energetic, sociable and positive 50-year-old woman. She lives in a village in the Qubadiyon District. For two years, she has been working in the field of retail sales. Norgul has a grocery store. All of her family - her children and her husband - help her with this business. She simultaneously buys and resells almonds. Now she wants to expand her retail business. She is planning to buy a new shipment of almonds, for which she needs financial assistance. This is why Norgul is requesting a loan. She strives to increase her family's budget and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy almonds for retail sale.

loans.name: Lệ

texts.en:
Mr. Lệ  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Lệ  is 33 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Lệ  lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Lệ  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Lệ  has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Lệ  has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Lệ  faces in his life is not having latrine so his family shares a neighbor's latrine.He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

In the future Lệ  hopes to make enough money to provide for his children, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: Yudi

texts.en:
Yudi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Yudi lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Yudi is single.

Yudi began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime credits. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, he has around $67 – 68 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan for working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Asep lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Asep is single and lives with five persons in the family home.

Asep began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has around $95 – 96 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan for working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Thinh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Thinh is 58 years old and she is married with 5 children.
Thinh lives with 4 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Thinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thinh has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

With her business profit, Thinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room

loans.name: Juli

texts.en:
Juli runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Juli lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Yudi is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Juli began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has around $50 – 51 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan for working capital to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: 3.1.1003.8.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thi is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Thi is the group leader of the 3.1.1003.8.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2013, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thi has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thi hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Thu is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Thu is the group leader of the 3.1.1004.8.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2013, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: Rafaela Antonia

texts.es:
Rafaela, está decidida a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, fertilizante, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para preparar el cultivo de granos básicos y mejorar la producción.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar su cosecha, tener granos de calidad, incrementar su ingresos; su situación familiar es mucho mejor todos se encuentra bien de salud.
texts.en:
Rafaela has decided to take out another loan in order to buy manure, fertiliser and anti-insect and anti-disease chemicals in order to prepare to grow basic grains and improve production.

Rafaela's previous loan helped her to increase her harvest and have good quality grains. She also increased her income. Rafaela's family is now much better and all are in good health.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser and anti-insect and anti-disease chemicals.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 66 years old, married and has eleven children. 

Priscilla is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Priscilla requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Priscilla has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed twenty-four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Priscilla would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nargizakhon

texts.ru: Наргизахон 31 год, замужем, имеет 2 детей. С 2011 года Наргизахон начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды, стартовав с суммой в 15,000 сом (KGS), Наргизахон сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Наргизахон обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом на увеличение товара. Наргизахон планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем намерена дать хорошее образование детям.
texts.en: Nargizakhon is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Since 2011, Nargizakhon has been selling women's clothing. She began this business with start-up capital in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Nargizakhon has been able to develop her business so that she now has a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS). To expand her assortment of goods, Nargizakhon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum." She is requesting a loan to increase her merchandise. Nargizakhon plans to invest the earnings from the business to further increase her assortment of goods. She is also determined to give her children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Yuly Nayive

texts.es:
Ella es  Yuli Nayibe, es una joven de 33 años, ama de casa, trabajadora y estudiante de enfermería de campo alto, le gusta el cuidado de los enfermos y capacitarse para aprender más de  todo   lo que tiene que ver con la salud, es emprendedora y desea terminar la carrera intermedia para darle un buen futuro a los hijos y asi  cumplir  uno de los objetivos.
Le gusta mucha y la ayuda a la  prevención de todo  lo relacionado con la salud, con la prevención y la calidad de vida, es una joven que contribuye con  el fortalecimiento de la enfermería y para ella es una experiencia gratificante, ya que además de conocimientos requiere dedicación. 
La prioridad  para ella en  este momento con esfuerzo y disciplina es terminar la carrera ya que es corta y le va a permitir seguir estudiando y especializarse en otros campos de la salud, en estos momentos ella necesita el convenio de kiva porque se le dificulta pagar las mensualidades ya que tiene otra responsabilidades con los hijos y la familia y este año la carrera de auxiliar de enfermería con la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en:
This is Yuli Nayive, a young woman who is 33 years of age. She is a homemaker and a hardworking student in the nursing school at CampoAlto. Yuli enjoys caring for the sick and teaching people everything there is to know about health. She is very enterprising and wants to finish her degree so that she can provide a good future for her children and also fulfill one of her goals.

What she enjoys most is preventative health, since prevention is related to quality of life. As a young woman who is able to contribute to the strength of the nursing profession, Yuli finds this experience to be gratifying. In addition, utilizing all of this knowledge requires dedication.

Her priority at the moment is to finish her degree with effort and discipline since she doesn’t have much further to go. She would like to continue studying and specialize in other health fields. For now, Yuli needs a Kiva loan because she has difficulty with paying her monthly tuition because of other responsibilities related to her children and family. This year she expects to complete the nursing assistant’s program with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Greens Huligemmadevi-Nadnikeshwara Group

texts.en:
The Joint Liability Group (JLG) “Greens Huligemmadevi” is starting its first loan cycle with a local NGO Future Greens. Neelavva is the leader of this group. The members of the group are engaged in raising sheep, goats and rams.

The loan that the group is requesting will benefit women such as Neelavva (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) in Nadnikeshwara, Bagalkot, Karnataka. Neelavva is living in her own home with her husband and three children who are studying in school and college. She has finished her schooling up to fifth grade. Neelavva works in the agriculture fields along with her husband as a daily wage worker and earns Rs. 200 per day.                       

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy sheep. She will purchase lambs nearby, raise them for 6-7 months and sell them. She hopes to save enough to pay school fees and to buy more sheep.

This group consists of four other members. They are Yamanavva, Mallavva, Nagavva and Gaddevva. They all want loans for the same purpose and they all are daily wage workers.

loans.use: to buy lambs to raise

loans.name: Sert's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sert is 54 years old and married with five children, two of whom are dependent on her. She earns a living farming rice. Having been in this business for 18 years, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the twelfth loan for Sert with VisionFund and she successfully repaid all of her loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
La señora María de 58 años de edad,  no tiene  hijos que dependan  de ella, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de pulpería en la que vende frescos, pollo, jugos, churros, detergentes, granos básicos, lácteos, jabón, carnes. 
Doña María sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan, es una señora humilde trabajadora que lucha todos los días para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene casa propia.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz, detergentes, jabón, pollo, carnes, embutidos, etc. con el apoyo del crédito espera mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es mejorar mas su negocio y de esa forma mejorar su utilidad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and has no children who depend on her. 
For a number of years María has had a grocery store, where she sells fresh goods, chicken, juices, chips, detergents, basic grains, dairy products, soaps and meat. María's customers are friends and other regular customers. María is a poor and hard-working person who fights every day in order to help her family to get ahead. María owns her own house. 
María is applying for this loan in order to buy corn, detergents, chicken, meat, cold meats and more for her business. With the support of this loan, María hopes to improve her quality of life.
María's dream is to improve her business and, as a result, make it more profitable.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; February 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, detergents, chicken, meat, cold meats and more for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 7 años y 10 años de edad. Rosa trabaja como cocinera en un centro educativo cercano a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos. Tal como se muestra en la fotografía las condiciones habitacionales de Rosa y su familia son muy sencillas y humildes. Con mucho orgullo y motivación par salir adelante se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito que le permita reparar el techo de su vivienda dado que tanto la lámina como la madera se encuentran en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así proceder a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 year old and lives in a house that she owns with her two children who are 7 and 10 years old.  Rosa works as a cook in an educational center near her home, which allows her to provide for her children daily.  As can be seen in the picture, Rosa and her family's living conditions are very simple and humble.  

With a lot of pride and motivation to get ahead, she approached FUSAI to request this loan that would allow her to repair the roof on her home, as the sheet metal and wood are in poor condition.  With the requested amount, she will purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood.  She hopes to receive the loan and be able to proceed with the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Jesica Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Jessica  de 32  años de edad,  tiene tres  hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo, en su  casa de sus padres en una de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Jessica se dedica desde hace 03 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, sus clientes son los amigos, conocidos y personas de las diferentes aldeas y caseríos de la zona.
Doña Jessica está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, shores, blusas, etc. para invertir en este segundo negocio, con el apoyo de este préstamo la señora desea invertir más en su negocio y por ende tener más ganancias. Su sueño es tener su propia casa algún día.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Jesica is 32 years old and has 3 dependent children. She lives with her husband in her parents' house in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. For 3 years she has had a business selling tortillas and now she is making a living selling new and used clothing. Her customers are friends and people she knows as well as people from the various villages and hamlets in the area. 

Jesica is asking for the loan to buy trousers, skirts, shorts, blouses etc. to invest in this second business. With the help of the loan she wants to invest more in her business and as a result make more profit.

Her dream is to have her own house one day.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, shorts, blouses etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, es papá de dos hijos, todos viven juntos, la actividad económica que desempeña es atender su mini ferretería, venta de accesorios para celulares y recargas a los mismos entre otros, esté negocio lo ha emprendido por cuenta propia hace ya 9 años,  poco a poco ha ido incorporando los diferentes productos que ofrece a sus clientes, y es la forma de tener los recursos económicos para el sustento familiar.
Está solicitando capital para invertirlo en la compra de lámparas, C.D., cargadores,  cables, controles para televisión, etc., mejorará el inventario que tiene a disposición con mercadería variada que satisfaga las necesidades de los clientes, sus ventas serán mejores y tendrá buenas ganancias con las que responderá puntualmente a los pagos de sus cuotas.
Sueña con tener ampliar su vivienda, agregar otro tipo de productos y mejorar el estilo de vida que brinda a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his partner and his two children. To make a living he runs a small hardware stall, selling accessories for mobile phones and phone top-ups among other things. He started this business up on his own initiative 9 years ago and has gradually increased the variety of different products he offers his customers. This is how he makes an income to support his family.

José is asking for capital to buy lamps, CDs, chargers, cables, TV controls etc. This will increase the stock he has available, with a variety of merchandise which will meet the needs of his customers. This will give him better sales and he will have good profits which he will use to pay off his loan instalments punctually.

His dream is to extend his home, increase his product range and improve the lifestyle he provides for his family.

loans.use: to buy lamps, CDs, chargers, cables, TV controls etc.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda was born in 1976. She is married and has six daughters. Her husband works as a cleaner at the government building. He also works in agriculture. 

Ayda brings blankets to her house to sell them. She is requesting a loan to add clothes to her sales to expand her business, in order to earn a better income and to cover her children's needs.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of blankets she sells and to add clothes to her business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Amparo works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Amparo is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Amparo has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Novi

texts.en:
Novi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Novi lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Novi is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Novi began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, she has around $43 – 44 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoern, 44, is married with five children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. For the last 10 years, she has been fishing and working as a paid worker. 

Sokhoern’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhoern will use her portion to buy household supplies and renovate her old house. She hopes to have a bigger house to live in.

loans.use: to buy household supplies and renovate her old house

loans.name: Syahrudin

texts.en:
Syahrudin runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Syahrudin lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Syahrudin is single.

Syahrudin began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has around $15 – 16 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen, 41, is married and  living with her family in a village of the Moungkul Borey District of Banteay Meachey Province, Cambodia. She has two children. For the last 20 years, Khen and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid construction workers. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Khen is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una señora que curso hasta el sexto grado quien se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales todos dependen de ella, el mayor que tiene 20 años curso hasta ciclo común ya que por la falta de dinero por sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando decidiendo encargarse de la tierra y las diferentes actividades que son llevadas a cabo, la segunda tiene 16 años y cursa el segundo de ciclo y el menor tiene 15 años y cursa el primer año de ciclo común. Doña Maria se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace ya muchos años esta actividad la realiza por enseñanza de sus padres ya que ellos también se dedican a lo mismo. El producto lo venden con intermediarios y lo hacen cuando la fruta está en uva. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados aproximadamente a 15 minutos caminando desde su casa donde también tienen una manzana productora y llegada la corta de café se involucran todos los miembros de la familia minimizando los costos y reteniendo mayores ganancias.
Entre sus sueños uno de ellos es que sus hijos se gradúen, sean excelentes profesionales y personas de bien y con éxito, que sus cultivos de café sean más productivas, mejorar su casa de habitación y comprar más terrenos para sembrar más café. Por lo que hoy en día doña Maria solicita financiamiento para limpiar, abonar y foliar sus cultivos de café ya que necesita darle mantenimiento para que la plantación que está en mediano crecimiento pueda estar protegida y al momento de florecer sea con mucho grano.
texts.en:
María is a woman with a sixth grade education who makes a living as a farmer. She is the mother of three children who are all dependents of her. Her oldest is 20 years old and only has a middle school education. Because of a lack of money, he could not stay in school and instead began working the land. Her second child is 16 years old and is in her second year of middle school, and the younges is 15 years old and in his first year of middle school. 

María has been growing coffee for many years. This is an activity that she took on from her parents who taught her, as they had also grown coffee. She sells her coffee to intermediaries when the coffee is ripe. Her coffee crops are located about 15 minutes walking distance from her home where she has about 1.7 acres of productive land. The harvesting of the coffee crop requires all of the members of the family as a way of reducing costs and retaining greater earnings. 

Among her dreams is for her children to finish school, and become professional and sucessful adults; for her coffee crops to be more products; to improve her home; and to buy more land to plant coffee. For these reasons, María is requesting financing to clean, fertilize, and foliate her coffee crops. She needs to provide maintenance to her coffee plantation which is at medium growth so that her land is well protected and at harvest, she will have many coffee beans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and modernize her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta en La Paz y tiene todos los servicios (gas incluído) Nancy continua trabajando como Contadora Pública en una empresa privada y tambien cuenta con la ayuda el esposo para los gastos de la casa. Nancy solicita un prestamo para hacerse un tratamiento medico y poder curarse de un problema de varices que le estan ocasionando constantes molestias
texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children.  She lives in a rented home where she occupies two bedrooms.  The house is in La Paz and has all of the utilities (gas included).  Nancy works as a public accountant for a private company, and also has help from her husband for their household expenses.  

Nancy is seeking a loan in order to receive medical treatment and take care of a problem with varicose veins that are constantly bothering her.

loans.use: afford treatment for varicose veins.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
La Joven  Catherine  de 22  años de edad,  tiene un hijo que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo, en casa de su mama, vive en la comunidad San Lorenzo,   valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 02 año  al negocio de venta de sopa de res , pollo y mondongo, etc. 
Catherine quiere iniciar otro negocio de  venta de ropa nueva y usada y está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, chores, camisas,  blusas, etc. para su segundo negocio.
Catherine sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en  su casa, también sale a vender de forma ambulante por las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, es una joven muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Catherine con el apoyo de este préstamo la joven espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa algún día.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Catherine is 22 years old, and has a son that depends on her.  She lives with her husband in her mother's home.  They live in the community of San Lorenzo in Honduras's southern valley.  For the past two years, she has devoted herself to selling beef, chicken and tripe soup.  Catherine wants to start another business selling new and used clothing, and she is seeking this loan to purchase pants, skirts, shorts, shirts, etc, for her second business.  Catherine's clients are friends and other people who visit her at her house daily.  She also makes sales on a door-to-door basis throughout the towns and villages near her community.  She is a very hardworking young women with dreams of getting ahead.  With the help of this loan, Catherine hopes to improve her earnings and in so doing, improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to have her own home some day.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- February 2014.

loans.use: purchase pants, skirts, shorts, shirts, blouses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1976. She is married and has five children. Firuza began her own business with animal husbandry six years ago. She runs her business well and she has a good opportunity to develop the business. She lives in an agricultural region. Firuza works hard from early morning until late evening for the well being of her living condition. Her husband Tursun helps her with feeding the cattle. 

Firuza must organize the wedding party of her daughter as she is going to be married. Firuza is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to organize the wedding party of her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize the wedding party of her daughter.

loans.name: Lài

texts.en:
Mrs. Lài works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Lài is 57 years old and married with three children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Lài joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lài has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lài faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Lài hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef, a father of five children, came to the current location three years ago. He has built a new house, yet it does not have a washroom. He’s built a very primitive one, some meters away from home, like the ones every house in the village had up until some years after the collapse of the regime. 

The village where they currently reside is at the foot of a single isolated mountain, with a seemingly flat summit plateau, with elevations over 1,880 feet above sea level.  The name of this mountain comes from the name of water wells that, fortunately, are numerous. There are copper mines built since the first years of the communism era and a small Catholic church built 800 years ago. The mountain is covered with snow all year round and foreigners prefer to go hiking. 

Zef practices livestock and agriculture to make a living for the family of seven. He has pigs, chickens, and a dairy cow. He also plants and harvests wheat in large quantities that he sells to wholesale buyers and sellers.

loans.use: to build a washroom in their newly-built family house.

loans.name: Theang

texts.en:
Theang, 31 years old, lives with her family in a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Rice farming has been the family’s main source of income for 20 years. The current business earns Theang about 90,000KHR per day, out of which she manages to put aside about 50,000KHR daily for future use.

Having repaid her previous loan, Theang  is requesting a new one from VisionFund to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price. This will enable her to improve her family’s lifestyle and build on her savings to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Pablo Darío

texts.es: Pablo, a sus 68 años de edad,  es separado y tiene dos hijos.  Desde hace más de 13 años se ha desempeñado como comerciante independiente ya que tiene un puesto de venta comidas y alimentos fritos como arepa de huevo, carne, pasteles de pollo, chorizos, trabaja solo todos los días desde las 6 am a 9 pm, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, por medio de la observación.  Pablo lo que desea y sueña es poder ampliar su negocio, por ello se motiva para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará una mesa de acero inoxidable e insumos al por mayor (carne, aceite, arepas, huevos) para la preparación de sus mejores platos que la clientela tanto solicita; así podrá mejorar los ingresos que percibe y estará en la  capacidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 68 years old, Pablo is separated and has two children. For over thirteen years he has been an independent businessman with a stall selling meals and fried foods such as egg "arepas" (a corn snack), meat, chicken pies and chorizo. He works alone every day from 6am until 9pm and learned the trade by observing others at work. Pablo wants to and dreams of expanding his business and so has chosen to apply for a loan to buy a rust-proof steel table, and supplies (meat, oil, "arepas" and eggs) in bulk. With these items he can prepare his best dishes, which his customers order so much, and he will be able to increase his income and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a rust-proof steel table, and supplies (meat, oil, "arepas" and eggs) in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear for students.

loans.name: Nubia Orbelina

texts.es:
La señora  Nubia  de 27  años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en casa de un familiar,  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Nubia se dedica desde hace 02 año al negocio de venta de tortillas,  tamales de gallina y también vende ropa, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en  su casa, también sale a vender de forma ambulante por las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.
Doña Nubia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, chores, blusas, camisas, blusas, etc. para invertirlo en su segundo negocio y del cual desea tener mercadería para la venta,  con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Nubia con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio mandara a sus hijos a la escuela, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Nubia is 27 years old, has two children, and lives with her husband in the family home in a community that belongs to San Lorenzo, Valle al Sur in Honduras. 

She has worked by selling tortillas and chicken tamales, and also sells clothing. Her clients are her friends and daily visitors to her home, and she also goes out on foot to sell to the surrounding communities. 

Nubia is seeking this loan to buy to buy pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc., to invest in her second store, from which she would like to have merchandise for sale. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and quality of life. Nubia, with the earnings obtained form her store, will send her children to school. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to have her own house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, cinder blocks, zinc and beams

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Phen is aged 47 years old and widowed. She has three children to take care of. 

To feed her family, she has worked hard as a cleaner at a hotel in the province. She can earn about USD 7 per day to support her family. 

Phen has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her living. 

Now, Phen is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes to cut down on motor-taxi expenses, so she can save money for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Doris de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella vive en casa de su madre, sus hijos van a la escuela y se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la elaboración y venta de pan, tamales, venta de queso y cuajada.

Doña Vilma Doris su venta es ambulante en los barrios y caseríos de su comunidad ubicada en la zona sur de Honduras, municipio de Nacaome, Valle.

Doña Vilma Doris está solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en compra de pescado para venderlo seco para esta época de semana santa, también comprara leña seca para elaborar pan, con el apoyo de este crédito espera salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es mejorar su casa.



San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Vilma Doris is 38 years old. She has 3 dependent children and lives in her mother's house. Her children go to school and for a long time she has earned a living making and selling bread and tamales and selling cheese and curd cheese. Vilma Doris works as a street vendor around the neighbourhoods and hamlets of her community in the south of Honduras, in the municipality of Nacaome, Valle. 

Vilma Doris is asking for the loan to buy fish to sell it dried for the time around Holy Week. She will also buy firewood for making bread. With the help of the loan she hopes to get on in life and improve her quality of life. Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  February 2014.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sugar, beans, coffee, water, lard, cheese, milk, water, etc, for his business.

loans.name: Tới

texts.en:
Mrs. Tới works in agriculture farming food. 

Tới is 45 years old and married with three children. One of the children is a grown up so Tới lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tới joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tới has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tới has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and a clean water filter.

In the future, Tới hopes to maintain a successful business for her children to do well in school and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, saco el mayor provecho del crédito anterior pues tuvo los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cultivar la platanera, pipían y maíz, pudiendo incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Actualmente tiene un mejor estilo de vida familiar, ya se acompaño y tiene un hijo, ha comprado un vehículo para trasladarse él mismo sus productos al mercado para distribuirlos.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, concentrados para aves de corral y gasolina. Le permitirán preparar el terreno para sembrar, alimentará correctamente sus gallos y gallinas, también podrá realizar el riego del cultivo con la achicadora ya que esta época es seca.
texts.en:
José was able to take advantage of a previous loan, and obtained the necessary agricultural supplies to grow plantains, squash, and corn. He was able to increase his sales and improve his income. Currently, he is experiencing a better lifestyle with his family, since he is married and has a child. He has purchased a vehicle to transport himself and his products to the market for distribution. 

For this opportunity, José is asking for another loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pellets for poultry, and gasoline. These supplies will allow him to prepare his land for seeding, to properly feed his roosters and hens, and to set up irrigation for his crops with a baler, since this is the dry season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pellets for poultry, and gasoline.

loans.name: Greens Lakkammadevi- Jalihal Group

texts.en:
Bheemavva (the lady with the raised hand in the picture) lives in Jalihal, Bagalkot district, Karnataka. She is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her four children. Her husband is a disabled man and hence, cannot work. She works in the agriculture fields on a daily wage basis and earns Rs.100 per day. Bheemavva has finished her education to second grade. She is a very strong woman. She is the only member taking care of her family and sending her children to school. 

This is Bheemavva's first loan. The loan she is seeking now will be used to buy sheep. This will enable her to generate income so that she can build social and economic security for her family. She hopes to save enough to pay school fees and to buy more sheep. Her dream is to educate her children and ensure they get a good job in the future and help support the whole family.  

Bheemavva is the leader of Greens Lakkammadevi Joint Liability Group. "Lakkammadevi" means goddess of wealth and the group chose this name for good luck. All the members want loans to raise goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and goats

loans.name: Caricias Del Sol Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Caricias Del Sol” conformada por 05 socios emprendedores y entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar bien. Martina  una de las socias es casada con 01 hijo en etapa escolar. A sus 32 años Martina ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ensaladas de fruta, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente  en un mercado de su localidad. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su negocio puede brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Su mayor deseo es de instalar un espacio para vender sus ensaladas de frutas. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de frutas como papaya, plátano, fresas y mango. El nuevo grupo “Caricias Del Sol” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Martina es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo fucsia.
texts.en:
This is the new group, "Caricias Del Sol" (Caresses of the Sun), which is made up of 5 entrepreneurial members who are enthusiastic to engage in rewarding work. Martina is one of the members, and is married with one son in school. In her 32 years, Martina has managed to improve her home and support the household costs. She sells fruit in a street market in her town.  She feels happy, thanks to her business, which blesses her family with an improved quality of life. Her greatest desire is to install a permanent space for her to sell her fruit. The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy fruit, such as papaya, plantains, strawberries, and mango. The new group, "Caricias Del Sol," thanks the people who have made this loan possible. 

In the photo, Martina is the second from the left and is dressed in a fuchsia t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy fruit, such as papaya, plantains, strawberries, and mango.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more phone chargers, mobile phones, and phone batteries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana, está creciendo con su negocio el crédito anterior le ayudo a tener los materiales necesarios para continuar elaborando la comida que vende, cuenta con más clientes satisfechos, sus ventas son mejores, sus nuevos ingresos le han permitido mejor el estilo de vida familiar. Actualmente ya posee una tienda en su residencia. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio comprara carnes, arroz, verduras, aceite, papel higiénico, pan, dulces, bebidas, etc., con lo que elaborara la comida y tendrá más productos a la disponibilidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is growing her business with a previous loan, which helped her obtain the necessary materials to continue preparing the food she sells. She is counting on more satisfied customers, her sales are better, and her new income has led to an improved lifestyle for her family. Currently she has a store in her home. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business and buy meats, rice, vegetables, oil, toilet paper, bread, sweets, drinks, etc., with which she will prepare her food and have more choices available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy meats, rice, vegetables, oil, toilet paper, bread, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Besil

texts.en:
Besil is single and is operating his own farm for a living. 

He has been doing this for three years and he earns well enough that he has been able to support the family. He saves a portion of his revenue for his future needs. 

To improve the farm, he requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover maintenance and fertilization costs. He plans to expand his farm by having another farm to ensure more income for his future.

loans.use: to cover maintenance and fertilization costs

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Age 55, Pech is a married mother of five children living in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer and supplements her income by working as a paid worker. She has been in the business for 35 years and she can earn about US $11 per day and can save about US $7 each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Pech with VisionFund. She is now asking for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Isidro Armando

texts.es:
Isidro es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa en su finca de 28 hectáreas de las cuales 6.3 son de café. Sus 4 hijos también se dedican a la caficultura y cada uno cuenta con su propia parcela. En los últimos años, este productor ha venido mejorando su finca, siendo parte de este proceso la construcción de un campamento que está gestionando de forma paralela a esta solicitud. Su cosecha de café promedio ha sido de 200 quintales de café pergamino aproximadamente, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. 

Para este año, Isidro está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permita garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones. Esta inversión contribuirá a incrementar la producción en este ciclo en un en un 20% equivalente a 40 quintales más de café. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Isidrio is a small coffee producer in a community of Jinotega, a department of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife on his 28-hectare farm, 6.3 of which are for coffee. His four children also work in coffee agriculture and each one counts on their own parcels of land. In the last few years, this producer has been able to improve his farm, with part of this process being the construction of a camp that is developing alongside this request. His coffee harvest on average has been approximately 200 hundredweights of coffee parchment, which are produced under the criteria for a Fair Trade Certification.

This year, Isidrio is asking for a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer that will allow him to guarantee an integrated pest and disease plan for his plantations. This investment will contribute to a production increase of 20% this cycle, or the equivalent of 40 more hundredweights of coffee. This will result in better income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Stanley  Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso es un señor de 45 años, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa.
Alonso vive separado de su conyugue varios años, incluso sus hijos viven con su madre en otra ciudad, pero el hecho de no convivir juntos no se ha descuidado de sus hijos, Alonso siempre está apoyándolos.
Él se dedica a la venta de material eléctrico y de artículos de ferretería, recorre en recintos aledaños a la ciudad, además de este negocio cuando la temporada está buena vende mariscos, ya cuenta con clientela fija. Ofrece sus productos tres veces a la semana.
Alonso necesita un crédito para la compra de material como cables, bombas de agua y sopletes, pero por falta de capital no lo ha podido realizar; acudió a Fundación Alternativa y se le pudo ayudar. Alonso se siente enormemente agradecido con la institución y con Kiva por ayudarle a incrementar y mejorar su negocio. En un futuro sueña contar con su propio local.
texts.en:
Alonso is 45 years old and lives with his parents in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a coastal city with a pleasant climate. There is a lot of business in this city, with a transport terminal that brings together the country's highlands and coastal area.
Alonso separated from his partner a number of years ago, and his children live with their mother in another city. This distance has not made Alonso neglect his children, though, and he is always supporting them.
Alonso maes a living selling electrical items and DIY goods. He goes around the areas near the city to sell his goods, and also sells seafood during certain seasons. Alonso has a number of regular customers. He goes around to sell his goods three times per week.
Alonso needs a loan in order to buy materials such as cables, water pumps and blowtorches but, due to a lack of capital he has not been able to buy these items. Alonso has come to "Fundación Alternativa", who were able to help him.
Alonso is incredibly grateful to "Fundación Alternativa" and to Kiva for helping him to expand and improve his business. Alonso dreams that, in the future, he will have his own premises.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials and DIY goods.

loans.name: Ne'matullo

texts.ru: Неъматулло истинный животновод. Он продолжает ремесло отца и занимается этим делом уже 10 лет. Неъматулло сам из района Мастчох города Худжанд. Он живет там со своей женой, сыном, невесткой и внуком. Ему 40 лет. Жена и невестка помогают Неъматулло в его животноводческой деятельностью. Одновременно его жена занимается шитьем. Сын Неъматулло в данный момент учится. Он студент Худжандского Государственного Университета и учится на архитектора. Сын Неъматулло еще с детства интересовался этой областью, поэтому он учится с усердием, чтобы успешно завершить учебу и стать хорошим специалистом. В этом году они еще не оплатили за этот учебный год. Неъматулло просит кредит, чтобы его сын смог продолжить учебу в университете. Семья Неъматулло надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Ne'matullo is a true herdsman. He works in hos father's profession, and has been for ten years. Ne'matullo is from the Mastchoh region of Khujand. He lives there with his wife, son, daughter and grandson. He's 40 years old. His wife and daughter help Ne'matullo keep the livestock. Additionally, his wife works as a seamstress. Ne'matullo's son is currently studying. He is a student at Khujand State University and is studying to become an architect. Ne'matullo's son has been interested in this subject since childhood, so he studies diligently in order to successfully graduate and become a competent professional. They have not paid this year's tuition. Ne'matullo is requesting a loan so that his son can continue to study at the university. Ne'matullo's family is hoping for financial support.

loans.use: pay for his son's tuition so he can continue his studies.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Greetings from Goderich, a charming little fishing village which is just outside of Freetown.

Please meet Martha. Martha is 47 years old and is married to a local man who gets some work as a security guard. Together, they have eight children, aged between 1 and 25 years old. Six of their children are going to school. 

Martha began her business five years ago to be more independent from her husband’s salary. Martha sells ‘cookery’ to passersby.  'Cookery' is the term used to describe the spicy local stews which are served with rice. Martha is proud of her business and would like to have her own restaurant one day. She works hard from 7am to 8pm, 7 days a week. Whilst the business is going well, she sometimes faces challenges when the costs of supplies rise. 
 
Martha would like to use this loan to buy rice by the bag, palm oil, pepper, ‘maggi’ spice, onions, fish, ground nuts and spices so that she can continue to sell ‘cookery’ profitably to her customers.

This is Martha’s first loan with BRAC Sierra Leone and she believes the support to her business will allow her to continue to provide good food, shelter and support to her children. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell spicy stews to passersby in the market.

loans.name: Mathilde's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Mathilde (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Mathilde est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mathilde vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Mathilde et son mari. Pour cette raison, Mathilde vend des cartes de recharge téléphonique, des chaussures et du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis quinze ans. Mathilde s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Mathilde ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Their representative is Mathilde (with her hand raised in the photo), age 40. Mathilde never received a formal education. She is married to a driver named Albert, and the couple have four dependent children who all go to school. 

Mathilde lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Mathilde has been selling mobile phone recharge cards, shoes and charcoal from her home for 15 years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To strengthen her activity and better meet customer demand, she is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampon Cham province’s Memot district, Nhor is a 42-year-old mother of four dependent children. To support her children, Nhor has been growing rubber trees and coconuts and raising pigs for 20 years. The current business earns her about KHR 17,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Nhor is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is asking for a loan to buy piglets and their feed to raise in order to earn more income. She hopes to make more income from her new business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Greens Bhagyavanti - Nadnikeshwara Group

texts.en:
Dyamavva (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the leader of this group. The members of this group are engaged in raising sheep and goats. They all are daily wage workers in the agriculture fields earning Rs.100 per day. The Joint Liability Group (JLG) “Greens Bhagyavanti” is requesting its first loan. This group includes four other members. They are Neelavva, Yamanavva,  Basavva and Rayavva.

The loan the group is requesting will benefit women entrepreneurs such as Dyamavva who live in Nadnikeshwara, Bagalkot, Karnataka.  She is a widow living in her own home with a son who works as a driver. She also has two daughters who are married. She and her son could not complete their education and have studied only until second grade and her son until fifth grade. 
                        
The loan Dyamavva is seeking now will be used to buy lambs and goats. She hopes to save enough to have her son start his own enterprise and build a new house.

All the members of the group are very grateful to the lenders for helping them to achieve a better life.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, invirtió en préstamo anterior en compra de materiales para surtir el inventario de la tapicería de muebles y vehículos, con lo que se ha mantenido elaborando los encargos de sus clientes, sus ingresos son mejores, su buen record crediticio se mantiene y brinda mejores circunstancias de vida a su familia.
El Sr.: Sergio solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, cuero, espuma, tablas, pegamento, etc., así estará abastecido de la materia prima con la que realiza sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sergio invested his previous loan in materials to supply his furniture and vehicle upholstery business. He continued producing client orders, his income is improved, he maintained a good credit record, and is blessed with better circumstances in his family life. 

Sergio is asking for a new loan to buy fabric, leather, foam, boards, glue, etc., so he will be supplied with the raw materials he needs for his work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, leather, foam, boards, glue, etc.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима замужняя женщина в возрасте 48 лет. У нее большая семья. Муж Фотимы находиться в Российской Федерации. Он не нашел хорошую работу и был вынужден уехать чтобы прокормить семью. В Фотима с детьми живет на районе Кубадиён. Она работает учительницей младших классов в местной школе. И дополнительно в дома выращивает скотин, чтобы у детей всегда было свежее молоко и данный маленький бизнес приносит хорошую прибыль в бюджет семьи. К сожалению, у нее образовалось финансовые затруднения и Фотима просит Вас помочь. У нее осталось малое количество  скота. Ей чтобы сохранить бизнес необходим кредит, по на который она намерена купит скотин. Помогите ей.
texts.en: Fotima is a married woman, 48 years old. She has a big family. Fotima's husband is in the Russian Federation. He could not find a good job, so he was forced to go abroad to feed his family. Fotima and the children live in Kubad. She works as an elementary school teacher at the local school. Additionally, she raises cattle at home so that the children always have fresh milk and she has an active small business which brings in income. Unfortunately, she has had some financial difficulties, so Fotima is asking you to help. She is left with only a small number of cattle. In order to maintain her business, she needs a loan with which to buy cattle. Help her.

loans.use: buy cattle to maintain her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, tuvo como resultados del crédito anterior una cosecha abundante, granos de calidad, ya que conto con los insumos agrícolas que necesitaba en su momento. El núcleo familiar se mantiene pero en mejores condiciones de vida.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, tres cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, para preparar su próxima siembra, teniendo otro rubro como lo es la crianza de cerdos espera continuar fortaleciendo el negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
As a result of Martin's previous loan, he had an abundant harvest of quality grains, as he counted on the agriculture supplies that were needed at the moment. His family now enjoys better living conditions. 

He has decided to seek a new loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, three pigs, and animal feed. He will use these to prepare his next planting and will take more land to raise pigs. Martin hopes to continue strengthening his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, three pigs, and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as canned fish, milk, and bags of rice, sugar, and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the range of things she sells.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La señora Olivia de 47  años de edad es casada  vive en casa propia tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella y vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 15  años  a la venta golosinas.
Doña Olivia vende cerdos para destazo y cuajada, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Olivia está solicitando el préstamo comprar arroz, azúcar, café, agua, jugos, pan, etc. para abrir un negocio de abarrotería en el local donde prepara las golosinas ya que le están solicitando sus clientes que venda estos productos, con el apoyo de Prisma seguro que lo lograra.
 Su sueño es tener el nuevo negocio de pulpería en donde ella aumentara sus ventas y sobre todo sus utilidades.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Olivia is 47 years old, married, and lives in her own house with three children. They live in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle al Sur in Honduras. She has worked for 15 years selling sweets. 

Olivia sells pigs for its parts and for curds, and is a hard working woman with a wish to continue moving forward. She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, water, juices, bread, etc., to open a grocery store in the place where she prepares sweets, as her customers are asking for her to sell those products. With the support of Prisma, she is sure that she can achieve this. 

Her dream is to have a bodega in which she can increase her sales and above all the usefulness of her products. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, water, juices, bread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Komarudin

texts.en:
Komarudin runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Komarudin is single.

Komarudin began working with Ruma six months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last six months, he has around $150 – $151 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items for her business

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tres hijos y un nieto, ellos le colaboran en su negocio, desde muy joven aprendió de sus padres a cultivar granos básicos y  la crianza de cerdos, esto le genera los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su grupo familiar.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de una vaca, con lo que espera iniciar otro rubro en su negocio, además tendrá una forma de mejorar la alimentación de de su familia por medio de los derivados de la leche que también en un futuro puede comercializar.
Se visión es mantenerse trabajando y adquirir más ganado, mejorar sus ingresos para que su familia goce de un buen estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old, lives with his wife, three children, and grandson. They work together for their business, and since he was young, he learned from his parents to grow basic crops and raise pigs. This generates the income he needs to cover the household expenses for his family. 

He will invest this loan by purchasing a cow, with which he hopes to open a new aspect of his business. Additionally, he will have a better way to feed his family by means of the milk products that, in the future, can also be sold. 

His vision is to continue working, earn more profits, and improve his income so that his family might enjoy a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her oil and grease business. 

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more oil and grease and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and buy food for her family if need arises. Hadija hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a hardware store. 

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more oil and grease to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Raymundo

texts.es: Carlos tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 4 años de edad. Carlos se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace dos años. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Carlos desea dar inicio a la construcción de su vivienda para la cual ya cuenta con cierto material que con mucho es fuerzo ha logrado comprar. Dado que no cuenta con ingresos para terminar de comprar los materiales necesarios solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y lamina galvanizada. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así poder dar a su familia un hogar digno.
texts.en: Carlos is 28-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his 4-year old daughter.  For the last two years, Carlos has made his living offering security services.  That is how he earns a living and supports his household.  Carlos hopes to start construction on his home, for which he already has some materials.  It took a lot of effort for him to be able to buy the materials he has.  Since he doesn't have the income he needs to purchase the rest of the materials, Carlos is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  He will use it to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, iron and galvanized sheet metal.  He hopes to be able to get this financing and give his family a respectable home.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron and galvanized sheet metal for building a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron, and an air-conditioner.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and son. The whole family is engaged in agriculture. They cultivate wheat and tomatoes, and sell the gathered harvest locally. Realizing that agricultural income is very important for their living, Lusine and her family decided to ask for this loan of 2,500 USD. It will greatly assist them to renovate their greenhouse and expand their cultivation activities.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greehouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Septian

texts.en:
Septian runs a small stall where he sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Septian is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Septian began working with Ruma four months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, he has around $67 – $68 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Regina has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 450,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sauce pans, plates, and food items. It will also help Regina to generate greater profits and expand her business. Regina hopes that she will be able to buy a fridge in the near future. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more sauce pans, plates, and food items

loans.name: Greens Yallammadevi - Nadikeshwara Group

texts.en:
Lakshmavva (raised hand in the picture) lives in Nadikeshwara, Bagalkot district, Karnataka. She is a mother of two children. Both her children go to school. Her husband runs a small eatery in their village. She works in agriculture fields and earns Rs. 100 per day. She has her own house. She finished her schooling at second grade.  

Lakshmavva now plans to take a loan to buy sheep and goats. This is her first loan. She is a very confident woman. She will acquire the animals in her community, rear them for 6-7 months and sell them. She hopes to save enough to pay the school fees and to expand her husband’s business. 

Lakshmavva is the leader of “Greens Yallammadevi Joint Liability Group”. This group consists of four other members as seen in the picture. They all want loans for the same purpose, and they all are daily wage workers on farms.

loans.use: to purchase lambs to rear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugarcane for her business.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a new client. She is 40 years old, married, with six kids. 

She applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 shs to pay school fees for her child in secondary school. Her banana plantation produces little output, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to pay tuition to beat the deadline for her daughter to be able to sit for end of term examinations. 

She will repay the loan using funds from sales of bananas. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the tremendous job they are doing for the underpriviledged.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her child.

loans.name: Greens Grama Devathe-Sharadal Group

texts.en:
Mahadevi (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the coordinator of the group "Greens Grama Devathe Joint Liability Group" (JLG). Her group is located in Sharadal, Bagalkot, Karnataka. 

Mahadevi is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children. She did not have the opportunity to study, so she is making sure her children are educated. Her two kids are going to school while the other one is still a baby. Mahadevi and her husband work in agriculture fields as daily wage workers and earn Rs. 120 each per day. 

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy more sheep and goats. She will acquire the animals in her community, raise and sell them. This enables her to generate income so that she can support her family. She hopes to save enough to send her children to school and educate them. She also would want to expand her house.

This is the first time they are taking a group loan. The other members are Jainabhi, Chandabhi, Fatima and Lakshmibhayi. They all want loans for the same purpose and they all are daily wage workers on farms.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and goats.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a repeat borrower who is 39 years old and a resident of a village in Ntungamo district. He is married and has five children. He is applying for a loan to improve his farming business. His business is rearing goats and growing coffee and bananas. He wants to buy more goats and hire more labour to prune and weed his banana plantation to improve its productivity and income in the long run.

loans.use: To buy goats and hire labour

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 20 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her fuel business, which sells fuel and paraffin. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more jerrycans of petrol, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and pay her sisters' school fees. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a hardware shop. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of petrol.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to be able to go to various markets to sell coca leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
