Lusik is from Hoktember village in the Armavir region, where she lives with her son. Lusik is an accountant by profession but currently is involved in agriculture. Lusik's son is a taxi driver who works day and night to be able to sustain his family. 

Lusik cultivates some fruit trees and vegetables and sells the harvest at local markets. This activity is very important, for it helps gather enough income for her family's basic costs. Lusik has now applied for this loan to be able to make some investments to her land cultivation business. She would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. The loan will be a huge help for her and Lusik hopes for lenders' goodwill. 

Lusik has already applied for a loan to local financial institutions before but, because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, she is sure that she will be able to cover monthly payments on time and has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Greens Layamma- Anawal Group

texts.en:
“Layamma” is a Joint Liability Group (JLG) of women belonging to landless agricultural laborers who live under India’s “below the poverty line” or BPL criteria. Anawal, like many other villages in North Karanataka, often suffers from chronic droughts, making agriculture practices very difficult in these areas. The men generally travel to cities and work there for six months, mostly as construction workers. The Layamma group has learned the art of sheep and goat rearing from an NGO, Future Greens, which works in this area. 

Tulasavva (raised hand in the picture) is the leader of the group. She is a mother of three children and lives in a thatch-roof house. Her daughters are studying in a government-run primary school. Her husband is a farmer and also runs a copper utensils shop in the same village. Tulasavva works as an agricultural laborer during the day. 

Tulasavva needs a loan to expand her livestock activities to increase her income. To meet the needs of her kids’ schooling and have better housing, she wants to scale up the number of lambs from two to eight. 

The group wants to expand the activity of lamb rearing to widen their existing livelihood portfolio so that they generate additional income to meet education and reinvestment needs.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bans of bread.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked shop and to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and bread.

loans.name: Murni

texts.en:
Murni runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Murni is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Murni began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, she has around $17 – $18 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 55-year-old married woman, from the village of Pshaveli. She lives with her husband, who works as a register at private distribution company and generates 320 GEL monthly. Nana doesn't have her own activity and has a great desire to do her bit for the family's welfare. She requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan money of 2,100 GEL she will purchase a milk cow, start producing milk products, and sell them locally. Nana will generate some income and will somehow help her husband cover all daily costs. Nana will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders provided as she can have her own income and can get a chance to make financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and produce milk products for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that will help keep her coffee crops healthy and clean.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Irene has been working hard to manage her brewing business, which makes local brew. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and sorghum, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay for house rent and business rent. Irene hopes that in the future, she will be able to open an account and save money. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more millet and sorghum

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Dede is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Dede began working with Ruma two months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last two months, he has had around $51 – $52 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Gay village in the Armavir region. She lives together with her husband, two school-aged daughters and little son. 
 
Astghik and her husband are farmers with many years of experience running a farm. They own greenhouses where tomatoes and greens are grown. Astghik's husband sells the gathered harvest at local open markets and earns an income for his family's living. 

Astghik now asks financial support of USD 3,000 to be able to improve her agribusiness. The loan will be a huge support for this hard working family to purchase seeds for cultivation and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. Astghik and her family will be very grateful for the support and goodwill of lenders.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is 38 years old and a differently able woman who lives in a small village in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India with her brother, her brother's wife and three nephews. Pratima owns a grocery shop near her house where she sells basic household items like rice, pulses, spices, sugar, edible oil, etc. Currently she earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity. She did not want to be a burden on her brother, which is why she started this business seven years ago.

Pratima has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase edible oil, sugar, rice, pulses, biscuits, spices etc. in bulk. She is really very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase edible oil, sugar, rice, pulses, biscuits, spices etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Ann Nyambura Muriu

texts.en:
Ann is a small-scale farmer from Central Kenya. She is a single mother of two and, as the sole breadwinner, she practices dairy farming and grows vegetables. She owns four dairy cows that produce at least 30 litres of milk, which she sells for KES 35 each 
.
She also runs a grocery business that operates mainly with her farm produce and earns KES 150 per day. Her monthly expenses of KES 5,400 include farm inputs, charcoal, firewood, kerosene, food, clothing, school fees, and rent for her grocery shop among others. 

She learned from a friend about biogas construction by Visionary Empowerment Programme  She approached VEP to learn more about biogas and made a decision to construct a biodigester. Ann will have sufficient gas for cooking and lighting. In addition, with organic bio slurry she can practice organic agriculture and will save approximately KES 4,100 due to the reduced cost of fertilizer, kerosene, firewood and charcoal. With clean gas, she will also be able to distribute to a couple of neighbours at a fee, enabling her to repay the loan.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 20-years-old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her charcoal selling business. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and buy a fridge. Oliver hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a soft drinks business. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Anastazia purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit lives in Haykashen village with her husband and 4 children (three daughters and a son). 
Her husband is employed in the private sector, but with only his salary it is not possible to meet the family's basic needs. Therefore Margarit and her children are running a farm. They own a greenhouse where they cultivate tomatoes, cabbage and some greens. 
Margarit will be very thankful if lenders help her with this requested loan of USD 2500. She asks that to be able to purchase fertilizer, seeds and hire workers for the cultivation process. The loan will provide a large support for family's farming business. 
As this is Margarit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and to hire workers for the cultivation process

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is a 36-year-old married male with four children, all of whom go to school.  He has been in the retail business for ten years and carries out farming for additional income. Saul started his business to cater to his family and intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell. Saul hopes to become a great businessman by transforming his business into a wholesale business to increase his profits despite being challenged by price fluctuations and high transport costs.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods mentioned for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 41 years old and married with four children, but only two attend school. John is in the transport business and he drives a taxi along Kagadi - Fort portal road but he also deals in poultry keeping.
He has approached Ugafode for a loan of 3,000,000 to buy chicken feed and he hopes to pay back the loan after making profits from the sale of chicken and eggs.
His dream is to buy another taxi, since it is a profitable business, but the challenge is limited capital and poor roads. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: María, es una mujer de 56 años de edad, alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en Tulcán, es casada tiene 7 hijos, 3 varones y 4 mujeres, de los cuales solo 3 viven con ella su hijo de 18, su hija de 16 que van al colegio y su hija de 20 años quien le ayuda en el negocio. Ella se decida a vender almuerzos, meriendas y empanadas en un pequeño local de la zona, donde van muchos clientes, aunque el  espacio es limitado para atenderlos, no ha sido motivo para que no le vaya bien en su negocio, a sus clientes no les incomoda esperar  un poco mas de tiempo en ser atendidos por el buen sazón que le pone a las comidas que ella prepara. Previamente ella solicitó un préstamo a FODEMI con el cual adecuó su local. Ahora ella necesita el préstamo para comprar materias primas para preparar las comidas como arroz, harina, aceite, huevos entre otros. El sueño de ella poder tener un espacio mas grande donde pueda poner mas mesas y atender a sus clientes de mejor forma.
texts.en: María is 56 years old, and is happy, enthusiastic, and hardworking. She lives in Tulcán, and is married with 7 children, 3 males and 4 females, of which only 3 live with her: her 18 year-old son and 16 year-old daughter, who attend high school, and her 20 year-old daughter, who helps her in the store. She sells lunches, snacks, and empanadas in a small space in her zone, which is frequented by many customers. Though space is limited for serving them, it has not been a reason for things not to go well with her business. Her customers are not bothered by waiting a bit longer to be served the delicious seasoning that María puts in the foods she prepares. Previously, she solicited a loan from FODEMI through which she adjusted her location. Now she needs a loan to buy more raw materials to prepare food, such as rice, flour, oil, eggs, among others. Her dream is to have a bigger space where she can put more tables and serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as rice, flour, oil, eggs, among others.

loans.name: Paola Jazmin

texts.es: Paola es una mujer de 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive en Tulcán con sus padres. Desde hace aproximadamente un año atrás tiene su tienda de comestibles ubicada en un barrio, donde no tiene mayor competencia, por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio. Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio para poder juntar un capital e independizarse y buscar una casa donde vivir, además quiere que su negocio siga prosperando como hasta ahora y sueña a futuro que su tienda se encuentre bien abastecida de varios productos para la venta.
texts.en: Paola is a 19-year old woman.  She is single and lives in Tulcán with her parents.  Since about a year ago, she has run a small grocery store, which is located in her neighborhood.  Because her store is in an area where she doesn't have a lot of competition, her business has been going very well.  Paola decided to start this business in order to put together some capital, move out of her parents' house and find a place to live.  In addition, she wants her business to keep thriving, as it has so far.  She hopes, in the future, to have her store well-stocked with items for sale.

loans.use: to stock up on foodstuffs like rice, sugar and cooking oil, among other items.

loans.name: Rithot

texts.en:
Rithot lives in south of Haiti, married and has one child. This way is a difficult to access town in coastal Haiti that only has electricity for very few hours a day. He is now interested in launching a business as a clean energy entrepreneur. He manages many people and employees in the area so he will be able to expand access to clean energy products to many people. 

With a Kiva loan, Rithot will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills to launch his business. For his first inventory he will purchase solar desk lamps and kerosene and charcoal-efficient cookstoves.

loans.use: to buy inventory for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Sukufa

texts.en:
Sukufa, 49 years old, is married and has a son and two daughters. Her husband works as a laborer. Sukufa has been raising seasonal fruit trees (apples, pears, etc.) for 20 years and has good skills in this field. Her monthly salary is 170 AZN. The family lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement because they are refugees. 

Azerbaijan people like fresh fruits and have a high demand for them. Refugees, especially, can’t buy fresh fruit when they need them because of prices. That’s why Sukufa tries to sell her harvest as cheaply as possible because she knows that refugees have a hard life. 

Unfortunately, Sukufa’s income is too low to cover the family’s living costs. Seasonal fruits don’t bring as much earnings as needed. Sukufa has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to supply seeds to raise and sell other kinds of fruit. She hopes that this is a good way to increase her income. Let’s help Sukufa and her family.

loans.use: to supply seeds to raise and sell fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build Luz´s house by promoting and strengthening her community development through mutual help.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a new client who is 59 years old. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to hire labor to help him clear his farm. He is challenged with low milk output from his cows because he is not feeding the cows adequately. So if he can remove the unwanted grass through pruning, he can have enough grass for his cows, which will translate into an increase in milk production. Since milk is the source of his income, he will be able to increase his income through this loan.

loans.use: To hire labor to clear his grazing land.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and married. She supports a family of two. She runs an M-PESA (mobile-money services) business and a cosmetic sales business in the town of Kapsabet. This has been her income-generating business for the last six years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000.

Catherine will use the loan amount borrowed to purchase more stock of assorted cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children. Her dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora  Narcisa de 62  años de edad, no tiene hijos  que depende de ella vive con su esposo,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de venta de cuajada, queso, mantequilla, morro, maíz, también hace pan y tamales.
Doña Narcisa tiene un molino que también le genera ingresos, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Narcisa está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de leche y granos básicos y también necesita darle mantenimiento a su molino, con el apoyo del crédito espera mejorar su economía y mejorar su calidad de vida,  es una buena clienta con varios ciclos, su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 62 years old, does not have dependents, and lives with her husband. She has her own home and has worked for 12 years in her store selling curds, cheese, butter, snouts, corn, and also makes bread and tamales. 

Narcisa has a mill that generates income for her. Her customers are friends and other people who visit her daily. She is a hardworking woman with desires to continue progressing. 

Narcisa is asking for this loan to buy milk and basic seeds, and she also needs to provide some maintenance to her mill. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her economic situation and quality of life. Her dream is to improve her home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy milk and seeds for her store.

loans.name: Jostus

texts.en: Jostus is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop located in a rural area and he farms for extra income. Jostus started his business to provide for his family. Like any loving parent, he hopes to educate his children to higher institutions of learning and expand his business to increase his income base. Jostus faces the difficulty of inadequate capital to re-invest in the business; he is thus requesting a loan to buy cups to sell.

loans.use: to buy cups to sell

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik lives in Haytagh village. She is an agronomist, running a small farm. Specifically, in the greenhouse that she owns, Qnarik cultivates greens, potatoes and tomatoes.  She sells the gathered harvest at the local open market and earns income for the family. 

Qnarik lives with her parents-in-law, husband and son. They help Qnarik with taking the harvest to the market.  Now, Qnarik asks for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse, potato and tomato seeds. The loan will greatly support this hardworking woman to improve her farm's condition and increase the income from agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse, potato and tomato seeds

loans.name: Abubaker

texts.en: Abubakar is a repeat client, 22 years old, who dropped out of school due to the lack of tuition. He eventually resorted to small-scale farming and petty businesses to earn income for his living and taking care of his two siblings who are still in primary school. He is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle, which will add extra income in addition to his agriculture. His challenge is always his limited income that does not cater to the family and his welfare. He hopes this problem will be solved eventually with the financial assistance from UGAFODE and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison, 34 years old, is married to Jane, and they are blessed with two children, both of whom are in school. For 10 years Harrison has been operating a business selling kerosene in Naivasha. He is now requesting his fifth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a kerosene pump. With the anticipated profit, he plans to invest more in his business.

In the near future, Harrison hopes to open a petrol station in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a kerosene pump.

loans.name: Zamiq

texts.en:
Zamiq is a 25-year-old refugee. He lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement with his wife and two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and she educates the children. Zamiq has worked as a butcher for 2 years to earn money for the family. People come to him when they need to cut cow or sheep meat properly. He earns 200 AZN monthly. 

Butchery is one of the oldest and most prevalent professions. Azerbaijan cuisine is very famous and varied, with a lot of different delicious dishes made from meat. Some of the recipes require meat to be specially cut. In these cases, most people refer to butchers. Zamiq is the most famous butcher in his region. Many restaurants’ chefs know him and prefer his butchery.

Being IDP makes Zamiq’s family’s life hard. He can’t provide his children with education and isn’t able to cover the family's demands. Zamiq has applied for a loan of 1,100 AZN in order to buy new butchery tools and new husbandry for his small business. He wants to buy new butchery tables and make his butchery shop wider.

loans.use: to buy new butchery tools and additional husbandry

loans.name: Fobias

texts.en:
Fobias is a forty-two year old married woman from Kasese, Uganda. She has six children, all of whom attend school. She operates a retail business and earns additional income from raising animals.

Fobias hopes to become a great businesswoman. She dreams of having a fully-stocked general store that sells on both a retail and wholesale basis, thereby allowing her to serve all her customers and deal with the challenge of price fluctuation. Fobias will use this loan to buy tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 56 years old with 18 children. He practices cocoa farming and receives income from his pension as a retired civil servant and from rentals. He sells cocoa to the major leading agents in the area, specifically ESCO and three other farmers. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of understanding. Charles needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en:
Zhenya lives in the village of Tsiatsan with her parents and brother. Her father is a migrant worker in a neighboring country, trying hard to support his family financially. Zhenya is engaged in a farming business. Zhenya, her mother and brother cultivate potatoes, greens and some strawberries. Despite her young age, Zhenya is a very talented farmer who does her best to gather a good harvest. 

Zhenya is asking for this loan to purchase potatoes and fertilizer for growing trees. As this is Zhenya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Denis has been working hard to manage his spare parts business.

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Denis to generate greater profits and increase inventory. Denis hopes that, in the future, he will be able to improve his profits and open up another branch. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq is a 28-year-old refugee. He is married and has a son and a daughter. The family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates their children. He has been working as a builder for six years. His monthly income is 190 AZN, which is too low to cover life's demands. 

There are many projects to be built in an IDP settlement in order to help refugees and establish favorable conditions for their living. Architects are looking for responsible, hardworking and highly qualified builder chiefs and one of them is Namiq. The job of builder is very hard and requires strength and good health.

Namiq’s income doesn’t allow him to cover his family’s demands. He applied for 1100 AZN in order to buy good construction tools and coveralls for his building team. This will make their job easier and more productive and at the end, he will get a higher income.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and coveralls for his team

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 35 years old, is married to Harriet and they have 5 children aged between 17 and 4 years. James operates a business selling clothes in weekly markets around Kagadi and the whole of Kibaale. He also does farming and transport (boda boda riding). James says he started his business in 2005 to earn a living for his family.

James has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete construction of his residential house in Kyenzigye, which is one of his future dreams alongside educating all his children. The completed house will give his family better accommodation and will also improve his social standing in society. 

James' main challenge is the poor road network, which affects transportation of his clothes to markets, especially when it rains. James describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials

loans.name: Li Aubra Group

texts.es:
María: Es una señora emprendedora y amistosa, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Li-Aubra (que en lengua miskita significa Corriente de agua); está integrado por tres mujeres, que se organizaron con el propósito  de buscar alternativas de financiamiento mediante crédito en Pana Pana, para poder mejorar sus negocios e ingresos, que les permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, para poder cubrir necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y vivienda.

Esta amable señora, es casada, tiene 12 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se encuentra desempleado. Desde hace aproximadamente 7 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan y wabul (bebida tradicional de los miskitos que se hace a base de banano, agua o leche). Es vendedora ambulante en Waspam. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos para hornear pan y vender bastimentos. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto y que su negocio crezca. 

Cristilita: Desde hace aproximadamente 25 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos: Harina, azúcar, levadura, canela, coco y queso para elaborar pan de coco, pan simple, empanadas y rosquillas que las vende de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Waspam. Su sueño es ampliar su pequeño negocio.

Ana: Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar su negocio, comprar 2 pacas en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Waspam, también para comprar insumos para hornear pan y empanadas que ella misma hace. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising and friendly woman.  She is the coordinator of the Li Aubra (which in the Miskita language means the flow of water) communal bank.  It is comprised of three women who organized themselves in order to look for financial alternatives through a loan with Pana Pana.  They did this in order to be able to improve their businesses and earnings.  This will allow them to improve their families’ living conditions and be able to cover the basic necessities of food, education, and housing.

This nice lady is married and has 12 children who are adults and independent.  Her husband is unemployed.  She has been making bread and ‘wabul’ [traditional drink of the Miskitos that his made from bananas, water or milk).  She sells in an itinerant manner in Waspam.  She is requesting her first loan to buy supplies to bake bread and to sell provisions.  Her dream is to build her house from concrete and for her business to grow.

Cristilita has been making bread for approximately 25 years.  She is requesting her first loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, leavening, cinnamon, coconut, and cheese to make coconut bread, plain bread, empanadas, and donuts.  She sells these items in an itinerant manner in the city of Waspam.  Her dream is to expand her small business.

Ana has been making bread for eight years.  She is requesting her first loan to diversity her business and to buy two bales in Managua and to sell them for affordable prices in the Waspam municipality.  She will also buy supplies to bake bread and for the empanadas that she makes herself.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to bake bread.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Teddy has been working hard to manage her business, selling fish. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and to pay house rent. Teddy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up an account and save money. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old from Naivasha and is married. She has four children who are in school. 

Beatrice has a hawking business that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for this first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy basins, cooking pans, etc., to add to her stock. 

She hopes to own her house in the near future and educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy basins, cooking pans, etc

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from Arshaluys village, where she lives with her husband and three school-aged children. 

Alina is an enthusiastic farmer who takes care of her small farm with great love and care. She cultivates potatoes, cabbage and tomatoes and sells the gathered harvest locally. Alina and her family have no alternative sources of income, and the only one is agribusiness. 

Therefore, Alina has applied for this loan to be able to purchase potato seeds for land cultivation, fertilizer, two oxen and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, and enlarge her farm. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her agribusiness and will wait for their support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds for land cultivation, fertilizer, two oxen and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Piedad Coralia

texts.es:
Piedad es una joven ecuatoriana de 20 años, es soltera, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria, la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella no se negó a seguir estudiando y es por eso que por sus propios derechos y ahora tiene ya su título superior.
Por circunstancias adversas sufrió el abandono de su padre pero esto no le fue impedimento para superarse en su vida personal y laboral. Ahora Piedad vive con su madre y hermano en una casa de familiares ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Este sector se llama Pujili conocido por sus tradiciones folkloricas. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona netamente musical y agrícola. 
Piedad se dedica a la elaboración y repartición de desayunos y snacks en las diferentes oficinas de la localidad se dedica a esta actividad desde hace algunos años atrás, en vista de que el negocio ha resultado muy bueno y con ganancias rentables se ha visto en la obligación y necesidad de incrementar con un horno y para lo cual solicita un crédito. Además a Piedad le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Piedad agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Piedad is a young, 20 year-old Ecuadorean who is single.  Thanks to her parent's efforts, she managed to finish high school, but due to a lack of financial resources she was sent out to work from the time she was very young in order to support the household's needs.  In spite of having a job that demands a lot of her time and effort, she did not neglect her studies and because of this, by her own rights, she has obtained a college degree.  

She dealt with adverse circumstances, including the abandonment of her father, but this did not stop her from excelling in her personal and work life.  Now Piedad lives with her mother and her brother in a family house located in the Cotopaxi province in the Republic of Ecuador.  This area is called Pujili, and is known for its folkloric traditions. As far as the economy, it is an area that is particularly devoted to music and agriculture.

Piedad works making and delivering breakfasts and snacks to the various offices in the area.  She's been doing this work for a few years.  Given that the business has done very well and is profitable, she has seen the need to expand with an oven.  This is why she is requesting a loan.  In addition, Piedad would like to buy a vehicle in the future, so that she could get to more of the customers who demand her products.  Piedad thanks Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es agricultora, no tiene hijos y vive en la comunidad de Tipampa. Carmen no pudo concluir la secundaria porque necesitaba trabajar para sobrevivir. Ella es una clienta muy pobre, su vivienda es de adobe y los pisos son de tierra, aunque su vivienda cuenta con luz y agua. Necesita credito para poder comprar abono, semillas y hacer mantenimiento de sus cultivos actuales ubicados en una propiedad obsequiada por su padre. Carmen es soltera y vive sola, no tiene familiares que puedan ayudarle y por eso acudio a Kiva
texts.en: Carmen is a farmer with no children. She lives in the community of Tipamba. Carmen was not able to finish her secondary schooling because she needed to work to survive. She is a very poor client with a home made of adobe, and dirt floors. However, she does have electricity and access to water. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and to provide maintenance to her crops, which are located on a piece of land inherited to her by her father. Carmen is a single woman and lives alone. She has no family members who can help her, which is why she came to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheilah lives in the Kitale area of Kenya's North Rift. She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. Sheilah has been a farmer for four years. Her income is derived from selling milk, eggs, and tea on a retail basis. She enjoys feeding her livestock. Her biggest challenge is caring for hungry livestock during dry spells.

Sheilah is applying for a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the products they offer are tailored to meet farmers' needs. This loan will enable her to purchase necessary inputs for her crops and livestock. The loan will increase crop and milk yield and provide her with a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for her farm

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar lives with her husband and two daughters in Haykashen village. Tsovinar is a teacher at a local village school, and her elder daughter is employed in the private sector. 

The family owns arable land where different types of vegetables are cultivated (cucumber, tomato, greens and peppers).
The whole family works hard to be able to gather a good agricultural harvest. Tsovinar now asks for this loan of USD 2500 to be able to improve her farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and supplies for renovation of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover, rods). Tsovinar has already taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of hard financial conditions wasn't able to pay for monthly payments. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Tsovinar has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and supplies for renovation of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover, rods).

loans.name: Jose Rafael

texts.es:
José es un señor de 32 años, hace 4 meses lamentablemente quedó viudo, ahora está a cargo de sus tres hijitos, una niña de 9, un niño de 8 y un pequeño de 2 años; el vela por el bienestar de sus hijos, por las mañanas pasa con ellos, los deja en la escuela y por las noches cuando trabaja los cuida una hermana que vive cerca. Tuvo que enfrentar solo esta situación muy dura, José es ahora padre y madre para sus pequeños, hace las labores en su casa para que estén bien.
José es un señor muy humilde, cuenta con casa propia sencilla que la pudo obtener gracias al esfuerzo de todos estos años de trabajo, él ahora cuenta con un puesto donde vende comidas rápidas, trabaja por las noches en un sector muy estratégico. Tiene su domicilio y negocio en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad muy comercial, con un clima cálido húmedo.
José acudió a Fundación Alternativa para obtener un crédito para la compra de papas, salas y gaseosas para su negocio, además para hacer unas escaleras en su casa. Gracias al proyecto Kiva y la institución José pudo beneficiarse y se siente enormemente agradecido ya que con este dinero podrá mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a 32 year-old man who, sadly, became a widower 4 months ago.  He is now in charge of his 3 young children: a daughter aged 9, a son aged 8, and a 2 year-old baby boy.  He watches after the welfare of his children. He spends the mornings with them, leaving them at school.  In the evenings when he works, a sister who lives nearby cares for them.  He has had to face this very difficult situation on his own.  Jose is now both mother and father to his children.  He does the household chores to keep them well.

Jose is a very unassuming man.  He has his own simple house that he was able to obtain thanks to all of his efforts over many years of work.  He now has a stand where he sells fast food.  He works during the nights in a strategically located area.  His house and business are located in the city of Santo Domingo, a city with a lot of commerce that has a warm and humid climate.

Jose approached the Fundacion  Alternativa to get a loan to buy potatoes, sauces and soft drinks for his business.  He will also use part of the loan to build some stairs in his home.  Thanks to Kiva and the Institution, Jose can benefit from this loan.  He feels extremely grateful, because with this money he will be able to improve his business and get ahead with his children.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages, and to build some stairs in his home

loans.name: Jhovik

texts.en:
Jhovik is a 56-year-old refugee. She is married, and has two daughters and two sons. The big family has been living in an IDP settlement for a long time. The head of the family earns money working as a labourer. The main source of the family’s income is farming. Jhovik has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables (onion, cucumber, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.)  and selling them at a local bazaar for 35 years. She has gained good experience in farming during this period, and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

People have high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables, especially refugees. Their life is not so easy, and they can hardly find money to cover life costs. They attend Jhovik’s grocery store because they can always find fresh fruits and vegetables there and buy them cheaply.  Besides that, everybody knows that Jhovik’s harvest is raised without any pesticides. 

Jhovik needs money to be able to cover her family’s life costs. The weather in her region is cold and sometimes her harvest dies. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy new garden tools and build a green house for her garden. This will keep the harvest safe and increase income.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and build a green house.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is 51 years old and married with a daughter and a son. He is a refugee and lives with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. The source of the family’s income is Ramiz’s construction materials market. He has been selling paints, glue, masking tapes, drills, and glass dust etc. for 25 years, and he sorts out in this area very well. His monthly income is 150 AZN. 

A lot of houses are built in IDP settlements at this moment because of the big population of refugees. That’s why there is a high demand for construction materials in that region. Ramiz’s market is the most popular and biggest one. Almost all builders require his materials.

Though Ramiz's market is very big, the assortment there isn’t as wide as required. This makes Ramiz’s income very low and impossible to cover the family’s demands. He applied for 1100 AZN in order to supply more construction materials for market.

loans.use: to supply more construction materials for market.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy used her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. She is happy that her business is doing better after the loan. 

Lucy has applied for her fifth loan after repaying her previous loan well. She is planning to use the money to buy farm inputs and also pay for labor. 

Lucy will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and also pay school fees for her two children. She hopes to boost her farming business in the near future and be a leading producer of horticultural crops in her area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has six children, all of whom attend school. 

For the last ten years, Mary has running a video business on a busy street. She also grows flowers to increase her income. Mary will use the loan to buy flower seedlings to plant. She hopes to expand her flower sales, as her flowers are in high demand. She hopes she can increase her profit and face the challenges of competition and inclement weather.  

Mary is a hardworking woman and appreciates your help.

loans.use: to buy flower seedlings to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, salt, and so on for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop in one of the busiest trading centres, alongside a butchery as another source of income.

He wishes to expand his business and reap enough income to run his home affairs and pay school fees for his children. His challenges are price fluctuation in the market and inadequate capital for business expansion.

Joseph is acquiring a loan to buy more merchandise like sugar and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sugar and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is a 35-year-old refugee. She is married and has a son. Her husband earns for the family by working as a laborer. The main source of income for the family is the raising of seasonal vegetables (onions, greens, etc.) by Elnara. She has been raising vegetables for nine years and has good skills in this area. The family lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement.
 
Greens and onions are very popular in Azerbaijan national cuisine. They are used in the cooking of kebabs, levengi, qutab, doghramajh and other dishes. That’s why these vegetables are in high demand. Elnara raises the vegetables and then sells them at a local bazaar.

Elnara’s income from this small business doesn’t cover life’s demands. Her harvest isn’t profitable enough, and she plans to raise other vegetables and fruits additionally. The life cost in Azerbaijan is expensive; especially, it’s hard for IDP families.  

She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizers for her business of raising vegetables.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil is a 51-year-old refugee who is married with a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in an IDP settlement. Famil earns money for his family raising seasonal fruits (apples, pears, cherry, quince, etc.). He has been working in this area for thirty years and has good experience in this. His monthly income is 220 AZN. 

Fresh fruits are in high demand and people buy them very often. They use fruits to prepare jam for tea, fruit pies, juice and so on. They buy them from Famil because his fruits are always fresh and tasty.

The region where Famil lives is very severe and after almost every winter it’s hard for him to get a good harvest. This reduces his income. He applied for 1,100 AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and to build a greenhouse for trees. Let’s help Famil and make his life easier.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizers and to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Santa Cruz  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo se reunirán  cada quince días EL Grupo Crédito Santa Cruz.
Este es un grupo de 9 mujeres y  1 hombre que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo Crédito que les va a servir de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Natalia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 16, 15  y 9 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Ella junto al esposo tienen una dulcería donde día a día elaboran dulces y bocaditos  de todas las formas y sabores los mismos que venden en su local ya sea al por mayor o al menudeo, con ellos también trabajan dos personas a quienes les pagan un sueldo mensual por su labor, ya son 15 años que tienen este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante, este negocio es una tradición familiar ya que su mamá también se dedica a esta misma actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para elaborar los duces y bocaditos, este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez con que le sdieron. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Calceta is also known by the nickname “Calceta Beyond Compare” because of the beauty of its women and because the residents believe that there is no other more beautiful city in the world. It is here that the Santa Cruz Communal Bank meets every 15 days.

This group consists of nine women and one man. They decided to join together and form this Communal Bank because they thought it would be very helpful in improving their small businesses. They engage in different activities that involve trade, services, selling food, and other forms of commerce.

Sra. Natalia lives in this place. She is 36 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has three children (ages 16, 15, and 9). The two older children are in high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Natalia and her husband own a candy shop where every day they sell sweets and snacks of all types and flavors. They sell their products either in bulk or individually. They also have two employees who are paid a monthly salary for their work. Natalia and her husband have been in this business for 15 years and it has allowed them to get ahead. This business is a family tradition since her mother was also in the same line of work.

Her loan will be used to buy necessary ingredients for preparing sweets and snacks. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and she likes how quickly it was approved. Her dreams include providing the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks and sweets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has three children ranging in age from three to six years. He operates a farm where he grows crops to sell like maize, wheat, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area good for agriculture and his primary customers are hotels and the community around. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. 

Joseph will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to economically sustain his business within five years. This is his second loan. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear at wholesale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a 53-year-old father of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Evalyne who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. He has been doing this business for the last six years. This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase farm inputs. Additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Simon would like to expand his farming to become a large-scale farmer. He hopes to have a quiet old age.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en:
Murvat is a 34-year-old refugee. He is married and has a little daughter. The family lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates their child. Murvat has been raising fruit trees (quince and persimmon) and selling the fruit at the local bazaar for 10 years. His monthly salary is 150 AZN.

Quince and persimmon are very popular fruits in Azerbaijan. They are very tasty and useful for health. People use them to make pies, or jams for tea. They also use dried quince and persimmon. This is very useful when people get ill. 

The assortment of fruit trees isn’t wide, and this makes Murvat’s income very low. It’s impossible to meet the financial needs of his young family. Murvat wants to provide his girl with an excellent education and a bright future. He does everything that he can to reach this aim. He applied for 1,100 AZN in order to buy fertilizers and other sorts of fruits. Expanding the assortment of fruit that he offers will increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other sorts of fruits

loans.name: Saday

texts.en:
Saday is 55 years old and married with two sons. The members of his family are IDP and live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. He has been raising seasonal fruits (apples, cherry, pears, apricots, etc) and vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens) for 35 years. Then he sells his harvest at the local bazaar. His monthly earnings for this are 180 AZN.

Azerbaijan people have high demands for fresh fruits and vegetables. They use them to cook national and delicious dishes. They prepare juice and jam for tea using fruits. Vegetables are used to cook such dishes as badimjhan dolmasi, pomidor dolmasi, etc.

Saday’s earnings are too low to cover the family’s demands and his children's education. Beside that, after the cold winter, he lost part of his harvest. He needs to increase his income to help his family. He applied for 1,100 AZN to buy new fertilizers and fruit tree seeds. This will increase his harvest and income. Saday hopes that one day, all his problems will be away, so let’s help him to reach his aim.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Ana Rocio

texts.es:
En el año 2006 la señorita Ana Roció tuvo la oportunidad de culminar satisfactoriamente los estudios como bachiller, el sueño siempre fue el tener la posibilidad de ingresar a la educación superior para estudiar auxiliar de enfermería y así formarse profesionalmente, pero debido a la inestabilidad económica de ella y de los familiares fue imposible ingresar y formarse como una persona profesional, ella tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para intentar costearse los estudios cosa que fue muy difícil, pues en ese momento en la vida tuvo la gran bendición de ser madre, pero, la cosas no salieron como ella lo pensaba, meses antes de finalizar el embarazo dio a luz , y a los 15 días  el pequeño hijo falleció.
La vida le dio un giro de 180 grados pues reponerse de esta pérdida no fue tan fácil, todas las ilusiones, sueños y metas se desvanecieron, pero como dicen "después de la tormenta viene la calma”, tres años después de este lamentable hecho Roció vuelve a quedar en embarazo, al saber esa noticia ella y los sueños revivieron de nuevo pues en ese momento se  dio cuenta que quería darle una mejor vida a este pequeño.
A pesar de tener las ganas de formarse académicamente, ya la vida no giraba en torno a ella si no a al bebe y a al esposo, ya se comenzaron a presentar problemas económicos a falta de empleo y se hacía cada vez más difícil el que ella realizará el sueño.
Poco tiempo después tuvieron el esposo y ella la oportunidad de obtener un muy buen empleo y cubrieron los problemas económicos, a los pocos meses Roció vuelve a concebir una bebe cosa que la impulsa más y más a realizar el sueño.
Cierto día al estar ella donde la hermana y luego de una ardua charla sobre la situación llegaron a la conclusión y acuerdo de un préstamo el cual se utilizaría para el pago del primer semestre de los estudios es aquí donde inicia el cumplimiento de un gran sueño, Pero en este momento ella no tiene un empleo, así que quien carga con toda la responsabilidad económica del hogar  es el esposo el cual le ayuda en ocasiones con una parte del dinero para  el estudio, por lo tanto a ella se le hace muy difícil costearse los estudios pues sin un empleo no hay entradas de dinero, es por eso que ella necesita el convenio con kiva, ya que el esposo es el único que le colabora con una parte del estudio y ella no tiene empleo fijo. 
A pesar de las circunstancias y los problemas ella no quiere abandonar los estudios pues sueña con ser una mujer exitosa y darles una mejor vida a los hijos, aún falta mucho eso está muy claro, pero ella se esfuerza cada día por terminar de subir este pequeño escalón el cual tiene un gran significado en la vida y el que la hace sentir orgullosa de ser una mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
In 2006, Srta. Ana Roció had the opportunity to satisfactorily complete her high school studies. Her dream had always been to enroll at an institution of higher learning so that she could study to become a nursing assistant. This would allow her to become a professional. Due to her own financial instability and that of her family, she found it impossible to enroll and become the professional that she had dreamed. She decided to work with the intent of being able to afford her studies, but she found it to be very difficult. At this point in her life, she also had the great blessing of becoming a mother. However, things did not go as planned in the final months of her pregnancy. Her little boy died 15 days after being born.

Recovering from that loss was not easy since her life took a 180 degree turn. All of her ambitions, dreams, and goals had disappeared, but as the saying goes, “there’s always calm after the storm”. Three years after this unfortunate event, Roció became pregnant again. Receiving this news revived her dreams once again, and at that moment, she wanted to provide a better life for this little one.

Even though she had the desire to obtain academic training, her life revolved around her baby and her husband. Financial problems presented themselves when her husband couldn’t find work. Being able to fulfill her dream became more difficult each day.

Shortly thereafter, her husband was able to secure a good job and take care of their financial situation. A few months ago, Roció gave birth to her baby and it motivated her once again to pursue her dream.

One day when Roció was with her sister, they had a deep discussion about her situation and how to resolve it. They agreed that a loan could be used to pay for her first semester of studies, which would help her get started down the path of fulfilling her greatest wish. At the moment she has no job, so all of the financial responsibility lies with her husband. On occasion, he will be able to provide part of the money for her studies. It is very difficult to afford school without a job or other means of generating income. For this reason, Roció needs a Kiva loan since her husband can only afford to pay for part her studies and she does not have a regular job.

Despite the circumstances and problems she faces, Roció does not want to abandon her studies. She dreams of becoming a successful woman and providing a better life for her children. At least that much is clear. Roció strives each day to complete little steps that have great significance in life. This makes her proud to be an enterprising woman.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and oil for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos tiene 50 años de edad,  su núcleo familiar está conformado por su esposa y un hijo adolescente;  tiene mucha experiencia en cultivos y venta de productos agrícolas, esto lo incentivó para iniciar una legumbrería desde hace 2 meses; allí ofrece toda clase de frutas, verduras, arepas, encurtidos, etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana y tiene una persona como colaborador.  Carlos sueña con tener un negocio bien establecido y por ello recurre a solicitar el préstamo con lo cual podrá adquirir una estantería y adecuar la legumbrería logrando exhibir mejor los productos; esto dará mejor presentación y acceso dentro del establecimiento, permitiendo encontrar los alimentos frescos y de muy buena calidad, ello le multiplicaría a Carlos las ventas y de igual manera los ingresos, obteniendo así más beneficios para seguir con el sustento de toda su familia y un bienestar en general.
texts.en:
Carlos is 50 years old.  His family is comprised of his wife and his adolescent son.  He has a lot of experience with crops and selling agricultural products.  This motivated him to start a vegetable business two months ago.  He sells all types of fruit and vegetables, cornmeal cakes, and pickled products, etc.  He starts work very early in the morning, and he has an employee.

Carlos dreams of having a well-established business.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  With the loan he will be able to get shelving and adapt his place of  business.  He will be able to better display the products.  This will make for better presentation and access in his establishment.  It will allow for the food to be fresh and of very good quality.  This would increase his sales and his earnings.  This way he will be getting more profits in order to continue supporting his entire family and provide for their general well-being.

loans.use: to buy shelving and to make adaptations to his place of business.

loans.name: Gladys Argentina

texts.es:
La señora  Gladys    de 60  años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos en su propia casa, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de pan como rosquillas y quesadillas, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen pan y por sus buenos precios,.
Doña Gladys su clientela la tiene definida con los empleados de una empacadora de camarón y con personas que visitan el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo también vende en los caseríos y sus alrededores, tiene un empleado familiar que es una hija que le ayuda a preparar el pan y a venderlo.
Doña Gladys es una mujer que ha  luchado sola junto con su madre para poder hacer su casa y salir adelante con sus hijos y a pesar del poco apoyo a este tipo de microempresarios se siente muy bien con Prisma porque le está apoyando a realizar sus sueños.
Doña Gladys está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como ser leña, maíz, harina, manteca, huevos, etc. su sueño es tener su taller de fabricar pan bien acondicionado, para así tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y por ende luchar para contratar otro empleado.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys is 60-years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her three children in her own home.  For the last fifteen years she has made her living making and selling bread, including donuts and quesadillas.  Her customers prefer to come to her because of her good bread and her good prices. 
Doña Gladys's clientele is made up of employees from a shrimp packing company and people who visit the old market in San Lorenzo.  She also sells her products in the small villages and their outskirts.  She has one family member employee, one of her daughters.  She helps doña Gladys prepare and sell the bread. 
Doña Gladys is a woman who has worked hard, with only her mother helping her, to set up her home and get ahead with her children.  Despite the small amount of help available for her type of small business, she feels very happy with Prisma because they are helping her to realize her dreams. 
Doña Gladys is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials, like firewood, corn, flour, butter, eggs etc.  Her dream is to have a workshop with a good set-up to make her bread and thereby have better working conditions and ultimately contract another employee. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, flour, butter, eggs etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Melida

texts.es:
Ma. Melida es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora con muchos de deseos de superarse en la vida al cual estudio hasta el cuarto grado de la primaria que por la falta de apoyo económico no pudo culminar. Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos quienes viven con ella y su esposo en casa los cuales estudian y ayudan a los diferentes trabajo que son llevados a cabo en el campo. A sus 47 años de edad ella sigue trabajando en el rubro por vocación de la familia lo cual es el cultivo de maíz y frijoles ya que por más de 15 años este ha sido medio de sustento en su familia. El terreno donde ellos habitan y su casa de habitación está construida es propio gracias a una herencia de su familia y es ahí mismo donde cultivan el grano.
Sus metas y planes a futuro poder tener una granja de gallinas ya que de esa manera ella podrá percibir otro ingreso ayudando a los mismos a su pareja para el sustento de su familia. Como productora lograr por medio de este apoyo financiero solicitado comprar semilla de maíz certificada e insumos agrícolas que ayuden al desarrollo del mismo para poder cultivarlo y ampliarlo de manera que sus ingresos para este año sean mejores y ayuden en sus estudios a sus hijos y demás necesidades a cubrir. Esperando ser apoyada por los inversionistas en la plataforma para llevar a cabo sus metas y propósitos
texts.en:
Ma. Melida is a determined and enterprising woman who has the drive to succeed in life. She has only a fourth grade education because she lacked the financial resources needed to finish her studies. Ma. Melida is married and the mother of four children who live with her and her husband. In addition to going to school, her children help with different jobs around the farm. At 47 years of age, Ma. Melida continues to work in the same vocation as her family did before. She has been growing corn and beans for more than 15 years in order to support her family. Ma. Melida and her family own the land on which they live and they built their house themselves, thanks to an inheritance she received from her family. This is also the same place where they cultivate their crops.

Her goals and plans for the future include having a poultry farm. This would create another source of income that would help her and her husband in sustaining their family. As a producer, Ma. Melida will use this loan to buy certified corn seeds and farming supplies in order to develop the crops she will cultivate. This will help to increase her earnings for this year and help pay for her children’s education and other necessities. Ma. Melida waits for the support from lenders through the Kiva platform so that she can fulfill her goals and carry out her proposals.

loans.use: to buy certified corn seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Afruz

texts.en:
Afruz is 58 years old and an IDP. She is a widow and lives with her only son in an IDP settlement. The son helps his mother earning money as a laborer. Afruz raises fruits and vegetables in her garden and sells them at local bazaar. That is Afruz’s business and she has working in this area for 30 years. Her monthly income is 160 AZN.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper.  People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with pesticides and harmful. During long years of experience, Afruz learned how to cover her customer demand.  So selling fruits and vegetables grown at home is popular and cheaper for people to buy them in bazaars than in big markets.

Afruza’s income doesn’t allow covering her customer's demands. She is planning to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables. Afruza wants her son to get a high education and have a good life. She applied for 1500 AZN in order buy new fertilizer and expand her business.

loans.use: buy new fertilizer

loans.name: Mario Isabel

texts.es: Mario Isabel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su finca de 6.3 hectáreas, de las cuales 3.5 son de café. En el último año su producción de café fue de 100 quintales pergamino. Su visión es incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café, mediante procesos de renovación y un adecuado mantenimiento. La renovación en las plantaciones de café, se realiza en plantas con más de 15 años, consiste en el reemplazo de plantas improductivas, en estos casos se calcula el área a renovar en base del número de plantas que se reemplazará. Para este año, el pequeño productor está solicitando un crédito de inversión que le permita renovar 0.7 hectárea de café, lo cual le permitirá ir mejorando los rendimientos productivos de su cafetal. Este tipo de inversión, incrementará la competitividad de su pequeña finca y además generará empleo en la comunidad. Su esfuerzo y la implementación de las actividades derivadas de un plan de manejo integral en su finca, le permitirá a este productor obtener mejores rendimientos y por tanto, mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mario Isabel is a small-scale coffee producer from the northern part of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and three children on a 6.3 hectare farm, 3.5 hectares of which is planted with coffee. In the last year his coffee production was 100 quintals in parchment. His vision is to increase the yield of his coffee plantation through renewal processes and good maintenance. The renewal process will be carried out on plants that are more than 15 years old. It consists of replacing the unproductive plants. In these cases the area in need of renewal is calculated based on the number of plants that need replacing. For this year, Mario is requesting a loan that will allow him to renew 0.7 hectares of coffee, which will enable him to continue improving the yield of his coffee plantation. This type of investment will increase the competitiveness of his small farm and generate employment in his community. His effort and the implementation of activities derived from a management plan will enable Mario to obtain a greater yield, and therefore, greater revenue.

loans.use: to swap out unproductive coffee plants for new ones

loans.name: Santos Enemesio

texts.es:
Santos, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, su negocio consiste en atender la granja de pollos de engorde, la cual ya tiene un año de funcionar, está proyecto nace mediante la el apoyo de organizaciones en su comunidad; le colabora toda la familia.
Está solicitando capital para invertirlo en la compra concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos serán de mucha ayuda para mantenerlos saludables y bien alimentados lo que le facilitara la venta y mejorara sus ingresos.
Su sueño es contar con los recursos económicos para mejorar su vivienda y dar a sus hijos las herramientas necesarias para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Santos is married. He lives with his wife and three children, who are 13, 11, and 9 years of age. His business consists of looking after a chicken farm, which he has had up and running for one year. This project was born through the support of organizations in his community and his whole family works with him.

He is requesting capital in order to invest it in buying animal feed and vitamins for the chickens. The supplies will be very helpful in keeping the chickens healthy and well-fed, which will facilitate Santos' sales and improve his earnings.

His dream is to have the economic resources to improve his home and give his children the necessary tools to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins for his chickens

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a thirty four year old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop and hopes to expand his business to a big shopping store in his home area. He owns a cocoa garden as another source of income. He is challenged by limited capital to run his business and constant price fluctuations of his goods. James is acquiring a loan to buy soft drinks like quencher, plastic cups, soap and exercise books to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks like quencher, plastic cups, soap and exercise books to sell.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is 29 years old single man. He is a refugee and lives with parents and brother in a IDP settlement. The main source of family’s income is gardening. He is grows fruits and sells them. Tehran has been in this business for 10 years.  His monthly income is 200 AZN.

Fresh fruits are in high demand because they are tasty and healthly. People prefer to attend Tehran’s grocery because fruits there are cheaper and always fresh.

Thought Tehran has a hard life he is very optimistic about the future regarding the expansion of his business, because it will raise the living conditions of his family. For this, he has applied for the loan of 1100 AZN in order to buy new garden tools.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes wholesale

loans.name: Carlos Bernardino

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en barriles como muestra la fotografía para la después comercializarlo en los alrededores de la zona, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and five children. He has been growing corn for several years. When his crops are ready to be harvested, the grain is stored in barrels (as shown in the photo) before being sold in the surrounding neighborhoods in his area.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy supplies such as compost, pest controls, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, and other items. This will allow him to continue maintaining his crops so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, pest controls, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is 42 years old and married with a son and two daughters. They are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children.  Karam has been raising and selling fruit for 18 years and has good skills in this area. His monthly salary is 130 AZN.

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. Karam‘s shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy fresh fruit. 

 Karam wants to expand his business. The amount of product he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as to improve the life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a 1100 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: St Eva United Group

texts.en:
Levania is a 38-year-old married female with five children, all of whom go to school. She has been selling fish for eight years, plus she engages in agriculture for additional income. Levania started her business to support her family and she needs the loan to buy fish to sell. She hopes to educate her children and buy land for farming despite the hardships of price fluctuations and government laws on fishing that affect her income.

She is a member of St Eva United Group, where the members guarantee each other to acquire a loan without security.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Buena Esperanza está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia del país, es de un clima frió pero de un corazón muy cálido de sus habitantes quienes reciben a sus visitantes siempre con una sonrisa. Las socias son mujeres carismáticas, mantienen su buen sentido del humor y gracias al trabajo arduo que realizan diariamente pueden solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, mantienen un la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica, está realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Buena Esperanza, le gusta este grupo porque existe mucha solidaridad y compañerismo de todo el grupo. 
La Señora. Mónica tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido una niña de 6 años de edad, está muy emocionada ya que se encuentra embarazada de su segundo hijo y esta de 8 meses de gestación, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora en una carpintería, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña Mónica labora en un gabinete de belleza, ella estudio y es todo una profesional, labora 8 horas diarias de lunes a sábados. Espera tener muy pronto su propio salón de belleza. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar tijeras, cosméticos, cepillos y secadoras de pelo. Su meta es  tener su propio local.
texts.en:
