The loan group Buena Esperanza (Good Hope) is formed by 8 women and 2 men, who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, a city that has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site since December 1999. It is the third most important city in the country and has a cold climate, but its inhabitants have very warm hearts and always receive their visitors with a smile. The members of this group are charismatic women. They maintain their good sense of humor, and thanks to the hard work that they do daily, they are able to pay their household expenses and raise their families. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Señora Monica. She is taking out her third loan, along with her friends and fellow members of the Buena Esperanza group. She likes this group because there is a lot of solidarity and camaraderie among all the group.

Señora Monica is 22 years old. She lives in free union, and from this relationship she has a 6-year-old daughter. She is very excited since she is eight months pregnant with her second child. Her daughter goes to a little school in the city. Her husband works as a carpenter. The house in which they live is rented.

Doña Monica works in a beauty center. She studied [for this work] and is a complete professional. She works 8 hours a day from Monday to Saturday. She hopes to have her own beauty salon very soon. The money from her loan is to buy scissors, cosmetics, brushes, and hairdryers. Her goal is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy scissors, cosmetics, brushes, and hairdryers.

loans.name: Heriqnaz

texts.en:
Heriqnaz lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two little children ages 3 and 6 years old. 
Heriqnaz and her family are involved in agriculture. They own a greenhouse where they cultivate tomatoes, cabbage and potatoes. The gathered harvest is taken by Heriqnaz's husband to nearby open markets and sold. The loan that Heriqnaz has requested is for improving the farm. It will enable her to purchase 2 oxen, potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. 
Heriqnaz will be very grateful if lenders help her to improve her farm. She awaits for their support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and 2 oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, pepper, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. 

She has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She generates additional income from selling beer, soda and local brew. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and also a van for transporting charcoal to the market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Rose’s major expenses include food, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa lives in Aghavnatun village with her husband and son. Her elder son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Alisa and her family are involved in a agriculture. They cultivate greens in greenhouse and also own a small orchard where strawberries are grown.
Now this hardworking woman with perfect credit history has applied to SEF for loan of USD 2000 in order to renovate the greenhouse that she owns. She needs some supplies for renovation (eg., polyethylene cover, rods) to enable an increase in cultivation. She will be very grateful if lenders support her farm and hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to renovate the farm (polyethylene cover, rods)

loans.name: Inversiones Carmen Alto Group

texts.es: Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INVERSIONES CARMEN ALTO” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Echerate de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú. Maria Aurarora tiene 40 años y es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica es la agricultura donde tiene plantaciones de café, cacao, coca y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, lima, mandarina y limón. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas. Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Inversiones Carmen Alto”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. They live in the District of Echerate in La Convención Province, Cusco, Peru.

Maria Aurora is 40 years old. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has helped her family get ahead. Her business is in agriculture and she cultivates crops such as coffee, cacao, coca, and citrus fruits (oranges, limes, tangerines, and lemons). Maria Aurora is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy compost and seeds.

The other group members engage in livestock breeding, farming, selling food, raising small animals, and providing other professional services. They appreciate those who have helped to full their dreams in this manner, so they promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Zike

texts.en:
Zike, a 47-year-old married mother of two children, is a member of the ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians.  She wants to buy a milk cow with this loan. Kindly note that most of the ethnic Egyptians resided in the suburbs up until the collapse of the regime doing odd jobs and after the collapse, their focus shifted to collecting scrap for cash, selling thrifty items, etc.

Zike’s activity is agro/livestock and arboriculture.  She sells the raw milk from the two cows she has at the moment to some nearby dairy farm.  She also sells plum fruits, since she has lots of plum orchards and plants, and sells red beets, corn and animal fodder. While she takes care of all the above activities, her husband works for pay as a night man.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil for her business.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis.  She works seven days a week. She has been in  this business for the last two years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality, which hinder her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal to the market. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Resty’s major expenses include food, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Junk Girls, Llc Group

texts.en:
Fresh off the successful fundraising of their first Kiva loan. Junk Girls was able to scale up and meet demand for their art therapy products.  Now they are looking to meet further demand through the fulfillment of online orders:  www.junkgirls.com 

Junk Girls was founded in 2009 and born out of a combination of Art Therapy for Jenny and Melissa’s love for all things handmade. After our 18+ years working in corporations including Netflix and eBay, our vision is to put our collective skill sets together and do something meaningful that would make a difference for both of us and others. We believe that everything has value, no matter how damaged it is, and we enjoy giving new life to things that might otherwise be overlooked or thrown away, which, as a metaphor, fits our lives perfectly. 

We are Social Entrepreneurs who work within the emerging new industrial revolution of Makers/Do It Yourself Micro-Manufacturing. Considered innovators by many, we are utilizing our background in art and design to create inventive ways to repurpose what some call junk into beautiful art, jewelry and home décor products, while enabling ourselves and others to heal during and by this process. The manufacturing of our metal stamped products is done 100% by hand. This is our number one area of growth, with our retailers requesting higher product volume than we can supply. By automating the process, we can build product at least 4-5 times faster to meet the market demand. A Kiva loan will help us with the second round of tools used in building the metal stamping automation process.

loans.use: to purchase tools used to build the metal stamping automation process

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37-year-old divorced man with five children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He practices cocoa farming and hires cocoa gardeners during the harvest time to increase his quantity of sales and income.  He sells fresh cocoa beans to the cocoa agents Esco and Olam Uganda.  He is challenged by inadequate capital to hire workers to aid him to do his harvesting and also by seasonal changes.  He hopes to educate his children to the university and construct a permanent residential house for his children.  Richard is acquiring a loan to hire cocoa gardeners during harvest season.

loans.use: to hire cocoa gardeners during harvest season.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepcion es un hombre ejemplar con 52 años de edad, es soltero y se desempeña como maestro de educacion primaia en una comunidad donde habita con 26 años de ejercer dicha profesion.
Actualmente  este señor se presento a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la construccion de un dormitorio,  dicho financiamiento lo utilizara en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como: cemento, ladrillo, hierro, zinc, arena , pago de mano de obra y transporte.
lo que vendria a mejorar su comodidad en su hogar y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, con este credito ya el segundo financiamiento que obtendria lo cual ha desmostrado ser un hombre responsable y con mucha moral.
texts.en:
Concepcion is an exemplary gentleman. He is 52 years old, single, and works as a primary school teacher in the community where he lives. Concepcion has been in this profession for 26 years.

He came to the CEPRODEL office in order to request a loan for building a bedroom. The funds will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron, zinc, and sand, as well as pay for labor and transportation costs.

This improvement will make his home more comfortable, provide better conditions, and raise his standard of living. Concepcion is receiving his second loan since he has already demonstrated that he is a responsible individual with high morals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a bedroom and to pay for labor and transportation costs.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from Goris town where people are mostly engaged in cattle breeding. Alina breeds cattle, keeping five cows and four sheep. She also cultivates potatoes but only uses the gathered harvest for family use.

Alina is very enthusiastic about running her farm successfully and gathering enough income for her family. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband requires a pension and is hardly able to help his wife with farming activities because of illness.

Alina has now applied for this loan of $1,500. She will use it to purchase a cow and two calves as well as to enlarge her livestock. The loan is very important for Alina to increase her income and to address her family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and two calves.

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en: Jacent is a 43-year-old year man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He sells cocoa from his garden to the Bundibugyo Cocoa Association.  He uses his salary to look after his family.  He dreams of building a residential permanent house and of educating his children.  His problem is competition from other cocoa dealers.  He is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa to sell this peak season.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, three of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She gets additional income from selling piped water.

She has requested a loan of 900,000 shillings from MCDT–SACC0 to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her top customers from reaching out to her. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal to the market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Zula’s major expenses include food, power, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Muhamudu

texts.en:
Muhamudu is a 46-year-old married man with seven children.  They live in Kyenjojo, Uganda where he has operated a retail shop for eight years selling eggs, soda, sugar, soap, and other items. 

Muhamudu's hardship is low buying power.  His vision is to become a wholesale business, and to educate his children.  Muhamudu requested the loan to buy soap, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Nora es originaria municipio de san Rafael del sur Managua, es comerciante tiene veinte nueve años de experiencia, tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal de productos artesanales y articulo plásticos. Este y todos sus créditos han sido para ampliar su negocio ingresando otros productos para obtener mejor utilidades. Todos los financiamiento que se le han otorgado gracias a kiva y ceprodel ha ayudado al crecimiento de su negocio y como persona  
Es importante mencionar que anteriormente su negocio era pequeño y con la ayuda de los créditos ha logrado obtener una mayor diversidad de productos artesanales. Logrando estabilidad en el mercado.
Esperando recibir siempre el apoyo de kiva y ceprodel.
texts.en:
Señora Nora is originally from the borough of San Rafael, in the south of Managua. She is a businesswoman and has 29 years of experience. She has a stall in the municipal market for artisanal products and plastic items. This and all her other loans have been to expand her business, bringing in other products to obtain better earnings. All the financing that has been granted to her thanks to Kiva and to CEPRODEL has helped the growth of her business and her growth as a person.

It is important to mention that in the past her business was small, and with the help of the loans, she has succeeded in obtaining a greater diversity of artisanal products, achieving stability in the market.

She hopes to always have the support of Kiva and CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy artificial flowers and earthenware products such as traditional griddles, flower pots, and piggybanks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine ,iron, and air conditioner.

loans.name: Llamiletk

texts.es:
La Joven Llamiletk habita en el municipio del Sauce departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio para sobrevivir. 

Llamiletk es una joven de 46 años de edad Madre soltera con 1 hija bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a su hija y le brinda una buena educación, por lo que su pequeña de 14 años de edad está estudiando en la secundaria y en los próximos años estaría en la universidad. 

Desde hace ocho años ejerce el trabajo como maestra, pero son de sus sueños darle una mejor enseñanza profesional a su hijita. 

Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinde un crédito, para la compra de una computadora, esto lo ve de gran importancia, para que su hija obtenga un mejor aprendizaje estudiantil.  

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
Llamiletk lives in the town of Sauce in the department of Leon. This is a city whose inhabitants engage in a variety of commercial activities in order to survive.

Llamiletk is a 46 year old single mother, who supports a daughter. With the little that she earns she is hardly able to support her daughter and provide her with a good education. Her 14 year old is in high school and in a few years will be in the university.

For the past 8 years, Llakmiletk has worked as a teacher, however she dreams of giving her daughter a better education. She feels comfortable with this type of job because it has greatly helped her with her family.

She greatly needs a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva so that she can purchase a computer, which she views as very important in insuring an improved learning situation for her daughter.

She is grateful for the support provided by Ceprodel and Kiva and hopes that God will see to it that she continues having the privilege of receiving these small loans that help her so much

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: El es fabian, estudiante de sistemas, cuenta la historia porque lo único que quiere es estudiar y ser cada día mejor persona, poder terminar el técnico en sistemas y poder seguir avanzando en las metas y seguir siendo cada día mejor en las cosas, también quiere de aquí a mañana poder ayudar a los padres en todo lo que ellos necesiten, ya que  gracias a ellos puede estudiar  con tan solo 22 años, nació en el año de 1992, a los 6 años ya estaba en primaria cursando primero y así  llego a bachillerato  de hay en adelante creció muy rápido y curso todos los estudios hasta 11 de bachillerato y se graduó, entro  a trabajar en la electricidad y luego de años después quería estudiar  una carrera o algo para poder ser mejor persona en un futuro, se quería decidir por alguna carrera técnica, primero se decidió por administración de empresas, pero no le alcanzaron los ingresos  económicos y solo alcanzo a estudiar 6 meses, iba a entrar al segundo  semestres  y no pudo por estabilidad económica, pero en esos 6 meses aprendió hacer varias cosas, luego de pasar un buen tiempo se decidió a estudiar otra carrera técnica y se decidió por harware ensamble y mantenimiento de computadores, ya curso el primer semestre en el cual ya e aprendido a instalar programas y desarmar y armar computadores, hacerles todo el mantenimiento y en los tiempos  libres trabaja en electricidad, pero no me alcanza para poder pagar  un semestre, ya que los ingresos son el mínimo y por eso necesita del subsidio de kiva para poder seguir adelante, terminar el técnico en sistemas, poder tener un buen trabajo, ayudarle a los padres, ya que ellos le prestaron la ayuda todo  este tiempo, ya es hora de que fabian logre el gran sueño de ellos, que es poder tener la casa propia y poder vivir tranquilamente  el resto de los días con la familia que es lo que mas ama en este mundo.
texts.en:
This is Fabian, a student in technical systems. He tells his story because the only thing he wants is to study and to become a better person every day. He wants to be able to finish his studies in technical systems and to continue advancing toward his goals and continue getting better in things every day.  He also wants from now on to be able to help his parents with all that they need since, thanks to them, he is able to study at only 22 years of age. 

He was born in 1992. At the age of 6 he was already in primary school in first grade and thus he arrived at high school. Thereupon he grew very quickly and finished all his studies until the 11th grade of high school and he graduated. He started working in electricity and then a few years afterwards he wanted to study a profession or something in order to be able to become a better person in the future. He wanted to go into some technical career. First, he decided on business administration, however he did not have the income and was only able to study for 6 months. He went to start the second semester and was unable to do so due to economic reasons. Nevertheless in those six months he learned to do various things. Then after some time he decided to study another technical career and focused on hardware assembly and computer maintenance. He is already in the first semester where he has already learned to install programs and dismantle and assemble computers and do all kinds of computer maintenance. In his free time, he works in electricity however he does not have the funds to pay his semester’s tuition since his income is minimal and thus he needs a subsidy from Kiva so that he can continue forward. He wants to finish technical systems so that he can get a good job and help his parents since they have been helping him all of this time. 

Now is the time for Fabian to help his parents’ realize their great dream, which is to own their home and live peacefully the rest of their days with the family that they most love in this world..

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona lives with her husband and three sons in Qarahunj village, which is in Syuniq region. 

Sona has been involved in agriculture for more than eight years. She keeps livestock including cows, pigs, piglets and some calves. The gathered meat and milk is sold locally and Sona's family earns income that is vital for covering their everyday costs.
 
Now Sona has requested this loan the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Jean Ladylee

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora y amable, casada, tiene 25 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 8 años que está en cuarto grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, es taxista. Solicita su primer financiamiento para construir anexo de concreto de 24 x 12 pies y comprar materiales: 700 bloques, 30 bolsas de cemento, hierro, arena fina y arena gruesa. El anexo será utilizado como cuarto: Uno para su hijo y el otro para ella y su esposo. Actualmente disponen de la infraestructura de la sala y cocina, la cual era utilizada como un solo espacio. Su sueño es tener su propio de negocio, una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en: This is a hard-working and friendly woman. She is married, is 25 years old, and has an 8-year-old son who is in the fourth grade in primary school. Her husband works informally; he is a taxi driver. She is applying for her first loan to build a 24 x 12 foot concrete addition and to buy materials: 700 blocks, 30 bags of cement, iron, fine sand, and coarse sand. The addition will be used for bedrooms: one for her son and the other for her and her husband. Now they have a living room and kitchen, which are used as a single space. Her dream is to have her own business, a clothing store in her home.

loans.use: to construct a 24 x 12 foot concrete addition and buy materials: 700 blocks, 30 bags of cement, iron, fine sand, and coarse sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, iron and chair

loans.name: Cecilio Ignacio

texts.es: Es un hombre amable, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 41 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos, de 12 años de edad, estudia su segundo año de secundaria y el menor de 11 años de edad que está cursando su sexto grado de primaria. Desde hace 3 años construyo su vivienda de tambo de madera con fondos propios. Con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, solicita su tercer financiamiento para construir su baño de minifalda de concreto y de zinc, comprar 80 bloques, 2 bolsas de cemento, arena fina,  arena gruesa, alambre de amarre, hierro, madera, 6 libras de clavos y láminas de zinc. Con el primer financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA, le permitió expandir su vivienda al construir un anexo de madera y el corredor o porche. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: This is a friendly man, originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is 41 years old and is married, with two children. One is 12 years old and is studying in the second year of secondary school. The younger is 11 and is in the sixth grade of primary school. Three years ago he built his wooden home on stilts with his own funds. With the goal of improving his living conditions and those of his family, he is applying for his third loan to build his minifalda-style (concrete base with wood walls) bathroom of concrete and zinc. He will buy 80 blocks, 2 bags of cement, fine sand, coarse sand, tie wires, iron, wood, 6 pounds of nails, and zinc sheets. With his first loan granted by Pana Pana, he was able to expand his home by constructing an addition of wood and the corridor or porch. His dream is to construct his home of concrete.

loans.use: to construct a minifalda-style (concrete base with wood walls) bathroom and buy 80 blocks, 2 bags of cement, fine sand, coarse sand, tie wires, iron, wood, 6 pounds of nails, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 36-year-old married woman living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is an Enrolled Nurse working in a government hospital where she earns a salary. She gets additional income from a drugstore to supplement her earnings. She started the business to provide for the family's needs like paying school fees and to serve the people around her community who live far away from the major hospital. Justine is faced with a lack of capital to expand her drugstore to have many types of drugs. Her ambition is to open up new outlets to serve many sick people in the rural areas. She is requesting a loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her nephew). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and rent. Rose sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She works for six days a week, and has been in business for the last four years. Her major challenges includes transportation and seasonality, which hinders her movements.

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, pineapples, carrots and oranges. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, pineapples, carrots and oranges.

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en:
Sonik lives in Goris town with her mother-in-law and husband. Her husband provides a vehicle repair service in their village, and Sonik herself is involved in pig breeding. She keeps a mother pig and six piglets. The family's living mostly depends on agricultural income, therefore it is very important for Sonik to successfully keep her livestock.

Sonik has now asked for this loan of 3,000 USD to be able to purchase six more pigs and thereby enlarge her livestock. As Sonik does not have enough land to cultivate forage for her livestock, she has to purchase forage, for which she also needs sufficient funds. This loan will be a huge support for this hard working farmer and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for six pigs and forage for her livestock.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene un pequeño taller donde se dedica a la soldadura de estructuras metálicas y al manejo de mototaxi, trasladando a pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de herramientas que utiliza para soldar y de esta manera atender con mayor facilidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Carlos is 27-years old. He lives with his wife and son in Cayalti district, a community where the people make their livings in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. The community is located in Chiclayo Province, which is a part of the Chiclayo Region, on the northern coast of Perú.

José Carlos has a small workshop where he earns a living welding metallic frameworks. He also drives a "mototaxi" bringing passengers to the neighboring villages of his district. He is an enterprising father. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to purchase tools that he will use for welding. José Carlos will then be able to more easily help his customers.

loans.use: to purchase welding tools.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child, and she goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and rent.

Annet operates a retail shop at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week, and she has been in business for the last five years. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of sweets, rice, bread, biscuits, cooking oil, baking flour, and crates of soda. 

Her major challenges includes transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach out to her. 

Her goal and aspirations are to own a fully stocked retail shop, and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of sweets, bread, rice, biscuits, crates of soda, cooking oil, and baking flour

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. All her children go to school. She doesn’t takes care of any additional family members. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

Fatuma sells fish at the market. She sells her products retail and wholesale and works seven days out of every week. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. Her major business challenges include transportation, perishability and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van and fridge to keep her fish fresh. 

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 43-year-old man who is married with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in commercial agriculture tea farming for the last eight years. He obtains additional income from teaching in a primary school. He started his tea farming business to get more income for providing for basic wants, as his salary is not enough to do so. He is challenged by the unpredictable weather changes, especially during the dry season when his income reduces in line with the harvests. Peter is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs and expand his tea estates to meet his dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure and expand his tea estates.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a 28-year-old married man with two children who owns a produce store in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has also been doing agriculture for the last four years, and then he started buying and selling produce. Now he also brands maize for sale. His hardship is that the business is seasonal and his vision is to become a market leader of produce, plus own a good food store that will cater for increased demand during periods of no production (as dry seasons are hurting farmers seriously). Johnbosco needs the loan to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 34 years old and the father of three children. He is a hard-working man and a cattle trader. He started this business because there was demand in the highly populated town of Kyenjojo. He has dreams of educating his children and turning the business into a large cattle trade to supply all butcheries in surrounding towns. He is faced with a lack of capital and transport to serve different market segments. John wants a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Lolis

texts.es:
Lolis tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad de bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, desde hace 6 años, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, son una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lolis is 22-years old. She lives with her husband and son in the Colasay District. The district is a community of green forests whose people make their livings in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in Chiclayo Province, on the northern coast of Perú.

Lolis makes her living in agriculture. For the last six years she has grown coffee. Her husband helps her with the work; they are a tight-knit family. Lolis has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles (USD $1075) to purchase compost for her coffee crop so she can have decent production to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase compost for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jaireth

texts.en:
Jaireth is a 45-year-old married woman with five children who is a peasant living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in the pineapple growing business  for eight years; she started with a loan from a village women savings group. She has a dream of educating all her children. 

She is faced with a problem of paying fees for the children to have her dream fulfilled.

Jaireth‘s pineapple sales cannot support her paying the fees at once, thus she is requesting a loan to  pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rwentuha Abamwe Group

texts.en:
Caroline is an enterprising widow, aged 46, and a mother of two children, ages 9 and 6. She owns a nursery school, which she started in the year 2009 with a hope of eradicating illiteracy in her area of operation, and also with a hope of getting enough income from the school to use to cater for the domestic needs of her family and to pay the school fees for her two children. 

Caroline is also a farmer, and this boosts her income greatly, since she sells the harvest at a profit. 

Her nursery school is located in Rwentuha village in Kyeizooba sub county in Bushenyi District, and the attendants are mainly pupils from the same area, since she only has day scholars. 

She proudly associates with Rwentuha Abamwe Group, and she hopes to get a loan through the same group where she is a member so that she can buy chairs and desks which would make the pupils more comfortable while at school. 

Her hopes for the future include developing the school to the level of having the primary section as well, so that when the pupils graduate from nursery they just cross to the primary section of the same school under the same management, for this would increase her income.

Her main challenge, though, is lack of money to develop the school and to pay qualified teachers who would help a lot in boosting the standard of the school.  She believes that this challenge will be overcome if she gets the UGAFODE loan through Abamwe Group.

loans.use: To buy chairs and desks

loans.name: Nimatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Nimatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Nimatou est mariée à un certain Ismaël. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nimatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Nimatou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Nimatou vend des noix de colas et des fruits par la méthode de distribution depuis douze ans. Nimatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Nimatou ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Nimatou (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 38 years old and did not attend school. Nimatou is married to one Ismaël. The couple has three children, all in school and in their care. Nimatou lives with her husband and their children. The family's various expenses are taken care of by Nimatou and her husband. For this reason, Nimatou has sold kola nuts and fruits by the method of delivery for twelve years. Nimatou stocks up in the market of Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting the demand of her clientele, Nimatou, together with the members of her group, is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase kola nuts and fruits.

loans.name: Nafissatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Nafissatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Nafissatou est mariée à un couturier brodeur du nom de Mohamed. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nafissatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Nafissatou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Nafissatou vend du savon par la méthode de distribution depuis huit ans. Nafissatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Nafissatou ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, by the name of Nafissatou (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 40 years old. She had very little formal schooling. Nafissaiout is married to Mohamed, a tailor and embroiderer. They have four children, all in school. Nafissatou lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. This is why Nafissatou has been selling soap through a distribution system for eight years. Nafissatou stocks up in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting customer demand, Nafissatou, together with the other members of her group, is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Suzanne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Suzanne(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 46 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Suzanne est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de  Basile. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Suzanne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Suzanne vend de la pâte de maïs, de la pâte à base de gari accompagné de diverses sauces dans une école dans sa région depuis six ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Suzanne ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Suzanne (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 46 years old and did not attend school. Suzanne is married to a mechanic by the name of Basile. The couple has three children, all in school and in their care. Suzanne lives with her husband and their children. The family's various expenses are taken care of by the couple. For this reason, Suzanne has sold corn dough, dough made from cassava flour, along with various sauces in a school in the region for six years, which allows her to respond to the needs of her family without difficulty. Suzanne stocks up in the market of Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting the demand of her clientele, Suzanne, together with the members of her group, is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cassava flour, and vegetables and spices for making sauces.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children. Seven of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a grandson). She lives in her own house. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major expenses include school fees.

Kasifa sells yellow bananas wholesale at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. Kasifa has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy bunches of yellow bananas (Cavendish bananas). Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas (Cavendish bananas)

loans.name: Santos Magdalino

texts.es:
Magdalino tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz desde hace tres años, su chacra esta ubicada a 30 minutos de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo y pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento del mismo y de esta manera tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Magdalino, 41, lives with his wife and children in the Pucará district, a farming, business, and ranching community in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern Peruvian highlands.

He has earned a living in agriculture for three years, especially growing corn.  His farm is located 30 minutes from his house.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy soil amendments for his crops and to pay for labor to maintain his crops so he'll have a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and to pay for labor

loans.name: Marc D Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bashizi est une vaillante commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Marc D», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers habits de bébés (layette) et sociétaire d’un magasin. Elle étale sa marchandise dans une maison la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec  de fonds reçu comme prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Son conjoint est un agent de la banque. Il y a plusieurs années qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des tricots, couvre-bébés couverture, souliers bébés, linges, cash couches, couches,  biberons, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The client Bashizi is a valiant shopkeeper and member of the business collective "Marc D," a senior entrepreneur, 42 years old, married and the mother of six children who are all in school. The client is a saleswoman of various baby clothes (layette) and member of a store. She lays out her merchandise in a house along the principal route in her town. She started her business with funds received, like from the IMF Hekima loan. Her spouse is a bank agent. It has been several years that she has run this business. This new loan will serve to buy knitwear, baby blankets, baby shoes, linens, diapers, bibs, etc. In this way, she wishes to increase her capital and keep her children in school, clothed and fed. To finish, she strongly appreciates Hekima for making non-bankable women entrepreneurs independent, especially during this critical post-conflict moment to the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase knitwear, baby blankets, baby shoes, linens, diapers, bibs, etc.

loans.name: Bernardino Luis

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador, casado, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mujeres y 2 son varones. La mayor de 12 años de edad estudia su primer año de secundaria en el municipio de Waspam, con el propósito de cuidar a su abuela. La de 10 y 6 años están cursando segundo y quinto grado de primaria en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas y tiene dos pequeños de 3 y 2 años respectivamente. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, solicita su primer financiamiento para reconstruir su vivienda de tambo de madera, ya desde hace aproximadamente 9 años no le realizaba mejoras, por lo que la madera se encuentra en condiciones desfavorables. Su sueño es construirle las divisiones de los cuartos a sus hijos, debido a que solamente cuentan con un solo espacio y construir el baño de concreto y mejorar la infraestructura de la letrina.
texts.en:
This borrower is a hardworking man. He is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons. The oldest daughter is 12 years old and in her first year of secondary school in the town of Waspam. She is in charge of looking after her grandmother. The other daughters, ages 10 and 6, are in the second and fifth grades at a primary school in the town of Puerto Cabezas. The two youngest ones are ages 3 and 2 respectively. His wife is a homemaker.

In order to improve his quality of life and that of his family, the borrower is requesting his first loan so that he can rebuild his wooden stilt house. It has been approximately nine years since any improvements were made, so the wood is in unfavorable condition. His dream is to build dividers among his children’s rooms so that each child has an individual space. He also wants to build a bathroom and improve the infrastructure of the latrine.

loans.use: to pay for renovations to his house.

loans.name: Jose Deonisio

texts.es:
José Deonisio tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y venta de plátano y siembra del mismo desde hace mas de 4 años de experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Deonisio is 42 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Buenos Aires. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. The area is situated in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

José Deonisio raises small animals, but he also grows and sells bananas. He has more than four years of experience. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to buy compost for maintaining his crop of bananas. This will enable him to have better production so that he can offer the fruit to his customers.

loans.use: to buy compost for his banana crop.

loans.name: Blanca Celia

texts.es: Blanca vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos a poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in her own home along with her family. She has been cultivating sugar cane for several years. Blanca sells her products at different markets that are located near her home. With the revenue she generates, she is able to pay for a few of her household expenses.

Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy herbicides, pest controls, compost, and other supplies so that she can continue maintaining her crops. As a result, she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pest controls, compost, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and other stock for his own buisness

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, peanuts, salt, etc., for the business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad de paisajes verdes que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante desde hace 4 años, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio pero también realiza labores agrícolas y actualmente siembra 1 ha de cultivo de café, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes y parte en bebidas como cerveza y gaseosa ya que también vende este tipo de productos, lo cual le permitirá generar más ventas y por ende más ingresos.
texts.en:
Angélica is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in the District of Querocotillo. This community has green pastures and its people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Angélica has been selling food at her restaurant for the past four years. Her husband helps with the business, but he also engages in farm work. He is currently planting one hectare of coffee. Angélica is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, as well as beverages such as beer and sodas, since she plans to also sell these products. This will enable her to generate more sales, which will lead to more income in the end.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, as well as beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 38 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 10. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 45 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 20, 18 and 10. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

Gita has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Gita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called nasals are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Paulino

texts.es: Carlos de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, desde hace varios años decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, pan dulce, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para continuar on sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old and resides in his own home with his wife and child. Several years ago, he decided to establish a small store in his home. He has many customers because of the variety of products and the affordable prices. With the income he earns from his sales, Carlos is able to cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy basic grains, sweet bread, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products so that he can continue his sales. This will generate good earnings and bring about better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweet bread, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Chand Devi

texts.en:
Chand Devi is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 19. In 2008, she established her tea shop business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy food materials for the business.  

In the future, Chand Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called chiya nasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her tea shop

loans.name: Cruz Delia

texts.es: La señora Cruz  tiene 39 años de edad y se dedica a impartir clases como maestra de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 14 años, tiene una relacion estable donde han procreado  2 hijos al que tienen que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo,   Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Cruz  atraviesa, es de construir un sumidero, baño y mejoramiento de techo de su vivienda para garantizar la seguridad familiar, por lo que se decidió  acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para lograr el objetivo  de efectuar  las mejoras antes mencionadas  de su vivienda. Ya que esto le ayudara a darle mejores  condiciones y nivel de vida. y lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construccion tales como bloques, cemento, arena, perlines, inodoro, tubos pvc,  ceràmica , bondex y pago de mano de obra. Este es el financiamiento Nº 15 con los que ella se encuentra muy satisfecha por que le han ayudado a mejorar su vida y lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Cruz is 39 years old and conducts classes as a primary school teacher. She is employed at a small municipal school and has been in this profession for 14 years. Cruz is in a stable relationship and has two children, so she must provide the necessary conditions for their development. Among her priorities are to build a septic tank, a bathroom, and to repair the roof of her home in order to guarantee her family’s safety. For this reason, she decided to visit CEPRODEL about requesting a loan so that she could make these improvements to her home, which would provide better conditions and a higher standard of living.

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, crossbeams, a toilet, PVC pipes, ceramic tiles, and bonding agent, as well as to pay for labor. This will be her 15th loan and she is very pleased because it will help improve her life and enable her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for various home improvements and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Dora Araceli

texts.es:
Dora Araceli tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Buenos Aires una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio desde hace más de 4 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dora Araceli is 45 years old and lives with her husband and child in the District of Buenos Aires. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Dora has been selling beer out of her home for more than four years. She has a considerable clientele. Dora is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to buy a large quantity of beer that she can offer to her customers. This will allow her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new booth to expand his mobile money business to serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Vardaqar village with her husband and daughter. 
She runs a farm. It includes livestock (cows, sheep, and chickens) and cultivates wheat, barley and potato. 
Laura works hard to run a sustainable farm and provide a good quality of life for her family.
She requested this loan to be able to purchase 2 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. This purchase will greatly improve Laura's farm and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 2 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de sandias, su negocio lo tienen ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por que su producto es fresco y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se e presentan en su hogar, vive ne casa propia con su familia, Faustino esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sandias por mayor y seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabjo y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Faustino is 30 years old and sells watermelons. His business is located at his house. He has many customers because his products are fresh and priced well. With the revenue he generates from his sales, Faustino is able to cover his household expenses. He lives in his own home along with his family.

Faustino is requesting a loan in order to buy watermelons in bulk. This will enable him to continue his sales since this is his only form of work. As a result, he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy watermelons in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, pain tablets, blood syrup and cholera drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used bed covers and window cotton material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bowls, pots, baskets and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as cigarettes, soft drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Barrio 3 Group

texts.en:
San Marcos La Laguna is a small and very poor town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. Unlike other towns on the Lake such as Panajachel, Santiago Atitlan, and San Pedro La Laguna, San Marcos La Laguna does not draw tourists and there are scant work opportunities for the inhabitants. 

Eight women united and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Barrio 3” or “Neighborhood 3”. Most of the ladies are involved in handicraft and textile production, as is the case of 58-year-old Juana. She has been involved in this business since childhood and has been able to support her family with her earnings. As she wants to increase her business, Juana is applying for a loan with Friendship Bridge. She will use the funds to purchase materials such as yarn in a variety of colors as well as needles and other materials. Along with her husband, Juana makes backpacks to fill the orders of her customers.

Juana is the sole member of her Trust Bank who cannot read or write in Spanish. However, she is most eager to learn about many things and can do so in the monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares information on topics like business management and investment, women’s identity and leadership, education and empowerment and much more.
 
The financial capital provided by Kiva investors combined with the educational training by Friendship Bridge are a winning combination for the women. It is a solid way for them to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. They have a wonderful opportunity to create a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community of San Marcos La Laguna.

loans.use: to purchase yarn in a variety of colors, needles and other materials

loans.name: Maritza Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el sitio Resbalón del  cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Primavera. En este lugar la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos así como también a la preparación de dulces que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 7 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Maritza es una gran mujer que le gusta ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a sus hijos y su hogar, es por esta razón que ella realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su labor, el se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual todos los días recorre la ciudad y campos aledaños en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos, de tres a cuatro veces por semana el se desplaza hasta playas cercanas a comprar el mejor pescado y luego les lleva a sus clientes el pescado fresco y recién salido del mar, tiene cinco años realizando esta labor con la cual salen adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su marido venda el pescado.
texts.en:
At the site of Resbalón in the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the Communal Bank “Primavera” (Spring) meet every 15 days. Most of the people who live in this place engage in agriculture and then sell their products, but they also prepare sweets that are well-known throughout the country.

Sra. Maritza lives in this area. She is 43 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has two children, age 16 and 7, who are in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Maritza is a successful woman who has helped her husband with raising their children and maintaining their home. For this reason, she will obtain a loan that her husband will use for his work of selling fish. Every day he travels throughout the city and to the neighboring farms by tricycle so that he can offer his products. Three or four times a week, her husband goes to the beaches nearby so that he can buy the best catch and then deliver fresh fish out of the sea to his customers. He has been in this business for five years and his work has allowed their family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fish. Maritza has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance and benefits she has received from her group. Her dreams include buying a car that her husband can use when selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Marc I Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie est une brave commerçante, Conseillère et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Marc I », senior  entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, responsable  et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers habillements. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 300 pièces de pagnes et 80 jupes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Marie, is a brave retailer. She is an adviser and member of the “Marc I” business collective. She is a senior entrepreneur who is 50 years old. She is also the mother of five dependent children who all go to school. 

The client sells various clothing items. She displays her clothing in a market in the city. She started her business with funds received from her boyfriend. She has been working on this business for 20 years. 

This new loan will help her buy 300 pagnes (traditional wraparounds) and 80 skirts. As such, she thanks Hekima strongly for the empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially in this critical post-conflict moment in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy 300 pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) and 80 skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.
